text: שִׁילֹה נוֹב וְגִבְעוֹן וּבֵית עוֹלָמִים.

אִיסִי בֶּן מְנַחֵם אוֹמֵר, אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ: וּמָה בְּטוּמְאָה קַלָּה לֹא חָלַק הַכָּתוּב — בְּטוּמְאַת אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ חֲמוּרָה, לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן? אִם כֵּן מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בְּקַרְקַע הַמִּשְׁכָּן״ — שֶׁלֹּא יָבִיא מִתּוֹךְ קוּפָּתוֹ.
אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: אֵין שָׁם עָפָר, מַהוּ שֶׁיִּתֵּן אֵפֶר? אַלִּיבָּא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ, דְּאָמְרִי: לֹא מָצִינוּ אֵפֶר שֶׁקָּרוּי ״עָפָר״.

כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ, אַלִּיבָּא דְּבֵית הִלֵּל דְּאָמְרִי: מָצִינוּ אֵפֶר שֶׁקָּרוּי ״עָפָר״, מַאי? אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיקְּרִי ״עָפָר״, הָכָא ״בְּקַרְקַע הַמִּשְׁכָּן״ כְּתִיב, אוֹ דִילְמָא הַאי ״בְּקַרְקַע הַמִּשְׁכָּן״ לְכִדְאִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה וּלְכִדְאִיסִי בֶּן מְנַחֵם הוּא דְּאָתֵי?
תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה מְקוֹמוֹת הֲלָכָה עוֹקֶבֶת מִקְרָא.
הַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה בְּ״עָפָר״, וַהֲלָכָה בְּכׇל דָּבָר. הַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה בְּ״תַעַר״, וַהֲלָכָה בְּכׇל דָּבָר. הַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה ״סֵפֶר״, וַהֲלָכָה בְּכׇל דָּבָר.
וְאִם אִיתָא — לִיחְשׁוֹב נָמֵי הַאי!

תְּנָא וְשַׁיַּיר. וּמַאי שַׁיַּיר דְּהַאי שַׁיַּיר? שַׁיַּיר מְצוֹרָע, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי יְגַלַּח אֶת כׇּל שְׂעָרוֹ״ — כְּלָל, ״אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ וְאֶת זְקָנוֹ וְאֵת גַּבֹּת עֵינָיו״ — פְּרָט, ״וְאֶת כָּל שְׂעָרוֹ יְגַלֵּחַ״ — חָזַר וְכָלַל. כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל — אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְעֵין הַפְּרָט. מָה פְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ: מְקוֹם כִּינּוּס שֵׂעָר וְנִרְאֶה — אַף כׇּל מָקוֹם כִּינּוּס שֵׂעָר וְנִרְאֶה.
מָה רַבִּי — רַבִּי שְׂעַר הָרַגְלַיִם. מַאי מִיעֵט — מִיעֵט דְּבֵית הַשֶּׁחִי וּדְכוּלֵּיהּ גּוּפֵיהּ.

וְהִלְכְתָא: מְגַלֵּחַ כְּדַלַּעַת. דִּתְנַן: בָּא לוֹ לְהַקִּיף אֶת הַמְצוֹרָע — מַעֲבִיר תַּעַר עַל כׇּל בְּשָׂרוֹ, וְקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: וּבַיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי מְגַלְּחוֹ תִּגְלַחַת שְׁנִיָּה כְּתִגְלַחַת רִאשׁוֹנָה.
אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: כִּי קָא חָשֵׁיב, הֲלָכָה עוֹקֶבֶת מִקְרָא, הָא עוֹקֶבֶת מִדְּרַבָּנַן הִיא.
רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: כִּי קָא חָשֵׁיב הֲלָכָה עוֹקֶבֶת וְעוֹקֶרֶת, הָא עוֹקֶבֶת וּמוֹסֶפֶת הִיא.
רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: הָא מַתְנִיתָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הִיא, דְּדָרֵישׁ כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי.
human_translation: Shiloh, Nob, and Gibeon, and the Eternal House,

Isi ben Menaḥem says: There is no need With regard to impurity, a lenient the Torah does not differentiate. with regard to the impurity of a married woman, stringent all the more so not If so, what the verse states: on the floor of the Tabernacle”? that one should not bring from his basket
A dilemma was raised before there is no dust there, what is place ashes no raise the dilemma in accordance with Beit Shammai, as they say: We never find ashes referred to as dust

When you raise the dilemma, in accordance with Beit Hillel, who say: We find ashes referred to as dust What Although referred to as dust, here it is written: “On the floor of the Tabernacle,” Or perhaps “on the floor of the Tabernacle” comes in accordance with Isi ben Yehuda or in accordance with Isi ben Menaḥem.
Come hear that Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: In three instances the halakha supersedes the verse,
The Torah states: in dust” but the halakha is in anything The Torah states razor but the halakha is with anything. The Torah states: bill [ sefer ] but the halakha is on anything
And if it is so consider this as well

taught and omitted What did he omit that he omitted this? He omitted the leper, as it is taught “And it shall be on the seventh day, that he shall shave off all his hair” a generalization. “His head and his beard and his eyebrows,” a detail. “Even all his hair he shall shave off,” then generalized a generalization, and a detail, and a generalization, you may deduce only similar to the detail. Just as the detail is explicitly areas a collection of hair which is visible, so too all areas a collection of hair which is visible
what extend extends pubic hair. What exclude? It excludes armpit hair, and body hair

And the halakha is: shaves like a gourd, As we learned comes to shave the leper, he passes a razor over all of his flesh. And the latter clause, teaches: On the seventh day he shaves The second shaving is like the first shaving.
Rabbi Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: counted halakha supersedes verse. This is supersedes of the Sages.
Rav Pappa said: counted halakha supersedes and uproots This, supersedes and adds.
Rav Ashi said: This baraita , is whose It is Rabbi Yishmael, who interprets generalizations and details.
llm_translation: Let us not be like the Nob, who were destroyed by the Giborim, and the house of Omri. I, son of Menachem, say: We are not required: And what is the severity of the prohibition? — Is it because of the woman of a certain man, a certain husband, that we are not permitted to cut the beard? — Rather, is it because of the verse: "In the tent of the tabernacle" — that he should not come forth from the midst of his tent?

Rav Yehuda said: There is no place where one can find a single grain of flour, what is the reason? R. Shmuel b. Avraham said to you, my son: Do not be hasty, for it is not fitting to say that a place is worthy of being called "place of flour" unless it is a place where one can find a single grain of flour. For what reason, O Beit Hillel, O House of the Sages, that we should not eat the flesh of a non-kosher animal, but rather to be concerned for the sake of the poor, for the sake of the widow, for the sake of the orphan, for the sake of the stranger in our midst, for the sake of the slave, for the sake of the poor of the house of Judah and for the sake of the poor of the house of Menachem?

Rabbah son of Chanina, son of Rabbi Yishmael: In three places, the Torah commands us to observe the laws of the Mikvah. Rav — Rav Shua bar HaRagel. What is the meaning — the meaning of the house of Shimeon and his sons.

Rabbis: What is the meaning of the verse? — Rav Yehuda: In his presence, he must clarify the evil — by removing the horn from his entire body, and the sages say: And on the sixth day he must be cast out — as if he had cast out the firstborn, as if he had cast out the red heifer.
Rava bar Yitzchak said: For one who is a master of the law, the law is to be obeyed, for he who is obeying the law is the one who is obeying the master.

Rav Pappa said: For one who is a master of the law, who is diligent and meticulous, the one who is diligent and meticulous is the one who is meritorious. sentences.llm_translation: For what reason, O Beit Hillel, O House of the Sages, that we should not eat the flesh of a non-kosher animal, but rather to be concerned for the sake of the poor, for the sake of the widow, for the sake of the orphan, for the sake of the stranger in our midst, for the sake of the slave, for the sake of the poor of the house of Judah and for the sake of the poor of the house of Menachem?

sentences.llm_translation: Rabbis: What is the meaning of the verse? — Rav Yehuda: In his presence, he must clarify the evil — by removing the horn from his entire body, and the sages say: And on the sixth day he must be cast out — as if he had cast out the firstborn, as if he had cast out the red heifer.

sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: counted halakha supersedes verse. This is supersedes of the Sages.
sentences.llm_translation: Rava bar Yitzchak said: For one who is a master of the law, the law is to be obeyed, for he who is obeying the law is the one who is obeying the master.

text: בִּדְחִטֵּי אוֹ בְּדִשְׂעָרֵי? בְּרַכִּיכָא אוֹ בַּאֲקוֹשָׁא? תֵּיקוּ.
אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד — בְּעַצְמוֹ שִׁיעֵר. וְהָאִיכָּא בֶּן עַזַּאי דְּלָא נְסֵיב?
אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: נְסֵיב וּפֵירַשׁ הֲוָה. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מֵרַבֵּיהּ שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: ״סוֹד ה׳ לִירֵאָיו״.

דָּרֵשׁ רַב עַוִּירָא, זִמְנִין אָמַר לַהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, וְזִמְנִין אָמַר לַהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַסִּי: כׇּל הָאוֹכֵל לֶחֶם בְּלֹא נְטִילַת יָדַיִם — כְּאִילּוּ בָּא עַל אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי בְעַד אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה עַד כִּכַּר לָחֶם״.

אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי ״בְּעַד אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה עַד כִּכַּר לָחֶם״ — ״בְּעַד כִּכַּר לֶחֶם עַד אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל הַבָּא עַל אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה, לְסוֹף מְבַקֵּשׁ כִּכַּר לֶחֶם.

אָמַר רַבִּי זְרִיקָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כׇּל הַמְּזַלְזֵל בִּנְטִילַת יָדַיִם נֶעֱקָר מִן הָעוֹלָם. אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: מַיִם רִאשׁוֹנִים — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּגְבִּיהַּ יָדָיו לְמַעְלָה, מַיִם אַחֲרוֹנִים — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּשְׁפִּיל יָדָיו לְמַטָּה. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַנּוֹטֵל יָדָיו — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּגְבִּיהַּ יָדָיו לְמַעְלָה, שֶׁמָּא יֵצְאוּ הַמַּיִם חוּץ לַפֶּרֶק, וְיַחְזְרוּ וִיטַמְּאוּ אֶת הַיָּדַיִם.
אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: כׇּל הָאוֹכֵל פַּת בְּלֹא נִיגּוּב יָדַיִם — כְּאִילּוּ אוֹכֵל לֶחֶם טָמֵא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ כָּכָה יֹאכְלוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת לַחְמָם טָמֵא וְגוֹ׳״.

וּמַאי ״וְאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ נֶפֶשׁ יְקָרָה תָצוּד״? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ גַּסּוּת הָרוּחַ — לְבַסּוֹף נִכְשָׁל בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ נֶפֶשׁ יְקָרָה תָצוּד״.

אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי ״נֶפֶשׁ יְקָרָה״ — ״נֶפֶשׁ גְּבוֹהָה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ. וְעוֹד: ״הִיא תָּצוּד״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, אֲפִילּוּ לָמַד תּוֹרָה דִּכְתִיב בַּהּ ״יְקָרָה הִיא מִפְּנִינִים״, מִכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁנִּכְנָס לִפְנַי וְלִפְנִים, ״הִיא תְּצוּדֶנּוּ״ — לְדִינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם.

אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ גַּסּוּת הָרוּחַ — כְּאִילּוּ עוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״תּוֹעֲבַת ה׳ כׇּל גְּבַהּ לֵב״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וְלָא תָבִיא תוֹעֵבָה אֶל בֵּיתֶךָ״.
וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דִּידֵיהּ אָמַר: כְּאִילּוּ כָּפַר בָּעִיקָּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְרָם לְבָבֶךָ וְשָׁכַחְתָּ אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ וְגוֹ׳״.
רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: כְּאִילּוּ בָּא עַל כׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״תּוֹעֲבַת ה׳ כׇּל גְּבַהּ לֵב״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״כִּי אֶת כׇּל הַתּוֹעֵבוֹת הָאֵל וְגוֹ׳״.
עוּלָּא אָמַר: כְּאִילּוּ בָּנָה בָּמָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חִדְלוּ לָכֶם מִן הָאָדָם אֲשֶׁר נְשָׁמָה בְּאַפּוֹ כִּי בַּמֶּה נֶחְשָׁב הוּא״ — אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״בַּמֶּה״, אֶלָּא ״בָּמָה״.

מַאי ״יָד לְיָד לֹא יִנָּקֶה״? אָמַר רַב: כׇּל הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, אֲפִילּוּ הִקְנָהוּ לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ כְּאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״הֲרִימֹתִי יָדִי אֶל ה׳ אֵל עֶלְיוֹן קֹנֵה שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ״ — לֹא יִנָּקֶה מִדִּינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם.
קַשְׁיָא לְהוּ לִדְבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא: הַאי ״יָד לְיָד לֹא יִנָּקֶה״, ״יָדִי״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
אֶלָּא אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא: אֲפִילּוּ קִיבֵּל תּוֹרָה כְּמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״מִימִינוֹ אֵשׁ דָּת לָמוֹ״ — לֹא יִנָּקֶה מִדִּינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם.
קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַאי ״יָד לְיָד״, ״יָד מִיָּד״ מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ!
אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן:
human_translation: where of wheat, or where of barley, where soft, or where hard, shall stand
Rav Yitzḥak bar Rav Yosef says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Each and every one estimated based on himself, But there is ben Azzai, who did not marry,
If you wish, say he was married and separated And if you wish, say he heard from his teacher. And if you wish, say “The counsel of the Lord is with them that fear Him”

Rav Avira interpreted homiletically; times he said in the name of Rabbi Ami and times he said it in the name of Rabbi Asi: anyone who eats bread without washing hands, as if engaged in sexual intercourse with a prostitute, as it is stated: “For on account of a harlot a man is brought to a loaf of bread.”

Rava said: This “For on account of a harlot a man is brought to a loaf of bread,” It should have “On account of a loaf a man is brought to a harlot.” Rather, Rava says Anyone who engages in sexual intercourse with a harlot eventually beg a loaf of bread.

Rabbi Zerika says Rabbi Elazar says: Anyone who treats washing hands with contempt is uprooted from the world. Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi says Rav says: first water, must raise his hands upward last water, must lower his hands downward. This is also taught One who washes his hands must raise his hands upward lest the water advance past the joint and return rendering hands ritually impure.
Rabbi Abbahu says: Anyone who eats bread without wiping hands as if he were eating impure bread, as it is stated: “And the Lord said: Even thus shall the children of Israel eat their bread unclean

And what “But the adulteress hunts for the precious life”? Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Any person who has arrogance within him will eventually stumble with an adulteress, as it is stated: “But the adulteress hunts for the precious life,”

Rava said: This “The precious life,” It should have An arrogant life. And further, it should have she hunts Rather, Rava says Anyone who engages in sexual intercourse with an adulteress, even studied Torah, about which it is written: “She is more precious than rubies [ peninim ]” than a High Priest, who enters the innermost sanctum, this will entrap him into the judgment of Gehenna,

Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: Any person who has arrogance within him as if he were an idol worshipper, it is written here: “Everyone that is proud in heart is an abomination to the Lord” and it is written there “And you shall not bring an abomination into your house”
And Rabbi Yoḥanan said his own as if he has denied the core as it is stated: “Then your heart be lifted up, and you forget the Lord your God”

Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina says: as if he engaged in sexual intercourse with all those with whom relations are forbidden, it is written here: “Everyone who is proud in heart is an abomination to the Lord” and it is written there, “For all these abominations
Ulla says: as if he built altar as it is stated: “Cease you from man, in whose nostrils there is breath, for how little [ bammeh ] is he to be accounted” Do not read as bammeh , Rather, bama ,

What “Hand to hand, he shall not be unpunished” Rav says: Anyone who engages in sexual intercourse with an adulteress, even he attributed possession of heaven and earth to the Holy One, Blessed be He, just as Abraham our forefather that it is written with regard to him: “I have lifted up my hand to the Lord, God Most High, Maker of heaven and earth” he will not be unpunished from the judgment of Gehenna.
poses a difficulty to the school of Rabbi Sheila: This “Hand to hand, he shall not be unpunished,” It should have My hand,

Rather, of the school of Rabbi Sheila say: even received the Torah like Moses our teacher that it is written with regard to him: “At His right hand was a fiery law unto them” will not be unpunished from the judgment of Gehenna.
This poses a difficulty to Rabbi Yoḥanan: This hand to hand” It should have Hand from hand,
Rather Rabbi Yoḥanan says:
llm_translation: In what manner? In the manner of the Torah study? In the manner of the Talmudic discussion? What is it?
Rav Yitzchak said: Any one and another — in the measure of seventy. And the one who is the son of Azarya, the son of Rava, did he not say?

Rabbis of the generation: We must not speak and we must not write. Rabbis of the generation: From the great ones who heard Him. Rabbis of the generation: "The house of the Lord is His dwelling place." (Psalm 87:5)

Rabbis Ammi and Asi said in their Master's name: Whoever desires to sin with the hand — as one who lies with a prostitute. For it is said: "As with a prostitute, so with the hand — for the sake of the hand."

Rav said: "In what case is it permitted to marry a prostitute? — In what case is it permitted to marry a prostitute, until the time of the Temple, until the time of the High Priest? — My teacher said to me: 'If all the men of the world were to marry prostitutes, to the extent that they would be as if they were burning with fire, as if they were burning with fire, a prostitute!' — I would say to him: 'If all the men of the world were to marry prostitutes, to the extent that they would be as if they were burning with fire, as if they were burning with fire, a prostitute!' — For it is written, 'You shall not covet your neighbor's wife, and you shall not desire his servant.' Rabbi Zeira said: Rabbi Eliezer: All who are accustomed to the habit of raising their hands in prayer, are in danger of being led astray from the truth. Rabbi Chia b. Ashai said: Rabbi: Wine is for the forenoon, and it is necessary that one's hands be raised to the heavens, wine is for the afternoon, and it is necessary that one's hands be raised to the earth. Rav Nachman: One who is accustomed to raising his hands in prayer — is in danger of being led astray from the truth, for it is said: "The hands which have touched the wine, let them be cut off." — The hands which have touched the wine — are in danger of being led astray from the wine, and it is necessary to cut off the hands.

Rabbi Avahu said: All desire to be free from the yoke of the law, to be exempt from the burden of the commandments — as if one were to desire to be like the ox that is slaughtered, as it is said: "And the Lord said: 'Let them eat the flesh of the ox, that is slaughtered'." — R. Avahu said: This is not the path of the righteous, for it is written: "And the Lord said: 'Let them eat the flesh of the ox, that is slaughtered'." — R. And what is the case of a man who has a wife, a fleshly desire? Said Rabbi Chiyaya bar Avah: Said Rabbi Yochanan: Every man who has in him the inclination of the flesh — to be seduced by the wife of a man, as it is said: "A wife is a fleshly desire, a fleshly desire is a wife, a fleshly desire is a wife."

Rav said: "The one who is in a state of desire" — "The one who is in a state of desire" — from his words. And further: "How is it that one is not ashamed" — from his words! For it is said: "He who has a wife, if he has studied Torah, it is written in her, 'She is from the men's side'" — from the Talmud. For it is said: "How is it that he is not ashamed of her" — to the honor of their fathers.

Rabbi Yochanan from Shum: Rabbi Shim'on ben Yochai: Any man who has in him the inclination to evil — as if he were a slave to a wicked master. As the saying goes: "Woe to him who has the power to do evil — all his power is for evil." And as they say: "And let him bring evil into his own house."

Rabbah Yochanan said in the name of his sons: As one who has sinned in the most serious of sins, as it is said: "And lo, you have sinned against the Lord your God, and have turned away from following him, and have made for yourselves other gods of wood and of stone, and have bowed down to them, and have served them." (Deuteronomy 17:3). R. Amram said: As one would say to a daughter in the marketplace, saying: "You shall not be envious of your neighbor's wife, for it is written: 'You shall not covet your neighbor's wife, for the neighbor is the one who is in the same condition as you are.'" — Do not say "in the same condition," rather "in the same state," for it is written: "You shall not covet your neighbor's wife," — not "in the same condition," but "in the same state."

R. Yehudah: What is the meaning of "to be bound to one's father to one's father, lest he be freed"? R. Shmuel said: A man is bound to his wife, even if he has divorced her and sold her to a gentile, for it is written: "I have bound my hands and feet to the Lord, my God, to the heavens and the earth, for the Lord who dwells on the heavens and the earth." — He is not bound by the law of his people.

sentences.text: בִּדְחִטֵּי אוֹ בְּדִשְׂעָרֵי? בְּרַכִּיכָא אוֹ בַּאֲקוֹשָׁא? תֵּיקוּ.
sentences.human_translation: where of wheat, or where of barley, where soft, or where hard, shall stand
sentences.llm_translation: In what manner? In the manner of the Torah study? In the manner of the Talmudic discussion? What is it?

sentences.text: אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד — בְּעַצְמוֹ שִׁיעֵר. וְהָאִיכָּא בֶּן עַזַּאי דְּלָא נְסֵיב?
sentences.human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Rav Yosef says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Each and every one estimated based on himself, But there is ben Azzai, who did not marry,
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak said: Any one and another — in the measure of seventy. And the one who is the son of Azarya, the son of Rava, did he not say?

sentences.text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: נְסֵיב וּפֵירַשׁ הֲוָה. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מֵרַבֵּיהּ שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: ״סוֹד ה׳ לִירֵאָיו״.
sentences.human_translation: If you wish, say he was married and separated And if you wish, say he heard from his teacher. And if you wish, say “The counsel of the Lord is with them that fear Him”
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbis of the generation: We must not speak and we must not write. Rabbis of the generation: From the great ones who heard Him. Rabbis of the generation: "The house of the Lord is His dwelling place." (Psalm 87:5)

sentences.text: דָּרֵשׁ רַב עַוִּירָא, זִמְנִין אָמַר לַהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, וְזִמְנִין אָמַר לַהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַסִּי: כׇּל הָאוֹכֵל לֶחֶם בְּלֹא נְטִילַת יָדַיִם — כְּאִילּוּ בָּא עַל אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי בְעַד אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה עַד כִּכַּר לָחֶם״.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Avira interpreted homiletically; times he said in the name of Rabbi Ami and times he said it in the name of Rabbi Asi: anyone who eats bread without washing hands, as if engaged in sexual intercourse with a prostitute, as it is stated: “For on account of a harlot a man is brought to a loaf of bread.”
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbis Ammi and Asi said in their Master's name: Whoever desires to sin with the hand — as one who lies with a prostitute. For it is said: "As with a prostitute, so with the hand — for the sake of the hand."

sentences.text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי ״בְּעַד אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה עַד כִּכַּר לָחֶם״ — ״בְּעַד כִּכַּר לֶחֶם עַד אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל הַבָּא עַל אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה, לְסוֹף מְבַקֵּשׁ כִּכַּר לֶחֶם.
sentences.human_translation: Rava said: This “For on account of a harlot a man is brought to a loaf of bread,” It should have “On account of a loaf a man is brought to a harlot.” Rather, Rava says Anyone who engages in sexual intercourse with a harlot eventually beg a loaf of bread.
sentences.llm_translation: Rav said: "In what case is it permitted to marry a prostitute? — In what case is it permitted to marry a prostitute, until the time of the Temple, until the time of the High Priest? — My teacher said to me: 'If all the men of the world were to marry prostitutes, to the extent that they would be as if they were burning with fire, as if they were burning with fire, a prostitute!' — I would say to him: 'If all the men of the world were to marry prostitutes, to the extent that they would be as if they were burning with fire, as if they were burning with fire, a prostitute!' — For it is written, 'You shall not covet your neighbor's wife, and you shall not desire his servant.' sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי זְרִיקָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כׇּל הַמְּזַלְזֵל בִּנְטִילַת יָדַיִם נֶעֱקָר מִן הָעוֹלָם. אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: מַיִם רִאשׁוֹנִים — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּגְבִּיהַּ יָדָיו לְמַעְלָה, מַיִם אַחֲרוֹנִים — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּשְׁפִּיל יָדָיו לְמַטָּה. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַנּוֹטֵל יָדָיו — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּגְבִּיהַּ יָדָיו לְמַעְלָה, שֶׁמָּא יֵצְאוּ הַמַּיִם חוּץ לַפֶּרֶק, וְיַחְזְרוּ וִיטַמְּאוּ אֶת הַיָּדַיִם.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Zerika says Rabbi Elazar says: Anyone who treats washing hands with contempt is uprooted from the world. Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi says Rav says: first water, must raise his hands upward last water, must lower his hands downward. This is also taught One who washes his hands must raise his hands upward lest the water advance past the joint and return rendering hands ritually impure.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Rabbi Eliezer: All who are accustomed to the habit of raising their hands in prayer, are in danger of being led astray from the truth. Rabbi Chia b. Ashai said: Rabbi: Wine is for the forenoon, and it is necessary that one's hands be raised to the heavens, wine is for the afternoon, and it is necessary that one's hands be raised to the earth. Rav Nachman: One who is accustomed to raising his hands in prayer — is in danger of being led astray from the truth, for it is said: "The hands which have touched the wine, let them be cut off." — The hands which have touched the wine — are in danger of being led astray from the wine, and it is necessary to cut off the hands.

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: כׇּל הָאוֹכֵל פַּת בְּלֹא נִיגּוּב יָדַיִם — כְּאִילּוּ אוֹכֵל לֶחֶם טָמֵא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ כָּכָה יֹאכְלוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת לַחְמָם טָמֵא וְגוֹ׳״.

sentences.text: וּמַאי ״וְאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ נֶפֶשׁ יְקָרָה תָצוּד״? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ גַּסּוּת הָרוּחַ — לְבַסּוֹף נִכְשָׁל בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ נֶפֶשׁ יְקָרָה תָצוּד״.
sentences.human_translation: And what “But the adulteress hunts for the precious life”? Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Any person who has arrogance within him will eventually stumble with an adulteress, as it is stated: “But the adulteress hunts for the precious life,”
sentences.llm_translation: And what is the case of a man who has a wife, a fleshly desire? Said Rabbi Chiyaya bar Avah: Said Rabbi Yochanan: Every man who has in him the inclination of the flesh — to be seduced by the wife of a man, as it is said: "A wife is a fleshly desire, a fleshly desire is a wife, a fleshly desire is a wife."

sentences.text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי ״נֶפֶשׁ יְקָרָה״ — ״נֶפֶשׁ גְּבוֹהָה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ. וְעוֹד: ״הִיא תָּצוּד״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, אֲפִילּוּ לָמַד תּוֹרָה דִּכְתִיב בַּהּ ״יְקָרָה הִיא מִפְּנִינִים״, מִכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁנִּכְנָס לִפְנַי וְלִפְנִים, ״הִיא תְּצוּדֶנּוּ״ — לְדִינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם.
sentences.human_translation: Rava said: This “The precious life,” It should have An arrogant life. And further, it should have she hunts Rather, Rava says Anyone who engages in sexual intercourse with an adulteress, even studied Torah, about which it is written: “She is more precious than rubies [ peninim ]” than a High Priest, who enters the innermost sanctum, this will entrap him into the judgment of Gehenna,
sentences.llm_translation: Rav said: "The one who is in a state of desire" — "The one who is in a state of desire" — from his words. And further: "How is it that one is not ashamed" — from his words! For it is said: "He who has a wife, if he has studied Torah, it is written in her, 'She is from the men's side'" — from the Talmud. For it is said: "How is it that he is not ashamed of her" — to the honor of their fathers.

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ גַּסּוּת הָרוּחַ — כְּאִילּוּ עוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״תּוֹעֲבַת ה׳ כׇּל גְּבַהּ לֵב״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וְלָא תָבִיא תוֹעֵבָה אֶל בֵּיתֶךָ״.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: Any person who has arrogance within him as if he were an idol worshipper, it is written here: “Everyone that is proud in heart is an abomination to the Lord” and it is written there “And you shall not bring an abomination into your house”
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan from Shum: Rabbi Shim'on ben Yochai: Any man who has in him the inclination to evil — as if he were a slave to a wicked master. As the saying goes: "Woe to him who has the power to do evil — all his power is for evil." And as they say: "And let him bring evil into his own house."

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דִּידֵיהּ אָמַר: כְּאִילּוּ כָּפַר בָּעִיקָּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְרָם לְבָבֶךָ וְשָׁכַחְתָּ אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said his own as if he has denied the core as it is stated: “Then your heart be lifted up, and you forget the Lord your God”
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbah Yochanan said in the name of his sons: As one who has sinned in the most serious of sins, as it is said: "And lo, you have sinned against the Lord your God, and have turned away from following him, and have made for yourselves other gods of wood and of stone, and have bowed down to them, and have served them." (Deuteronomy 17:3). sentences.text: עוּלָּא אָמַר: כְּאִילּוּ בָּנָה בָּמָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חִדְלוּ לָכֶם מִן הָאָדָם אֲשֶׁר נְשָׁמָה בְּאַפּוֹ כִּי בַּמֶּה נֶחְשָׁב הוּא״ — אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״בַּמֶּה״, אֶלָּא ״בָּמָה״.
sentences.human_translation: Ulla says: as if he built altar as it is stated: “Cease you from man, in whose nostrils there is breath, for how little [ bammeh ] is he to be accounted” Do not read as bammeh , Rather, bama ,
sentences.llm_translation: R. Amram said: As one would say to a daughter in the marketplace, saying: "You shall not be envious of your neighbor's wife, for it is written: 'You shall not covet your neighbor's wife, for the neighbor is the one who is in the same condition as you are.'" — Do not say "in the same condition," rather "in the same state," for it is written: "You shall not covet your neighbor's wife," — not "in the same condition," but "in the same state."

sentences.text: מַאי ״יָד לְיָד לֹא יִנָּקֶה״? אָמַר רַב: כׇּל הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, אֲפִילּוּ הִקְנָהוּ לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ כְּאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״הֲרִימֹתִי יָדִי אֶל ה׳ אֵל עֶלְיוֹן קֹנֵה שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ״ — לֹא יִנָּקֶה מִדִּינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם.
sentences.human_translation: What “Hand to hand, he shall not be unpunished” Rav says: Anyone who engages in sexual intercourse with an adulteress, even he attributed possession of heaven and earth to the Holy One, Blessed be He, just as Abraham our forefather that it is written with regard to him: “I have lifted up my hand to the Lord, God Most High, Maker of heaven and earth” he will not be unpunished from the judgment of Gehenna.
sentences.llm_translation: R. Yehudah: What is the meaning of "to be bound to one's father to one's father, lest he be freed"? R. Shmuel said: A man is bound to his wife, even if he has divorced her and sold her to a gentile, for it is written: "I have bound my hands and feet to the Lord, my God, to the heavens and the earth, for the Lord who dwells on the heavens and the earth." — He is not bound by the law of his people.

sentences.text: קַשְׁיָא לְהוּ לִדְבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא: הַאי ״יָד לְיָד לֹא יִנָּקֶה״, ״יָדִי״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!

sentences.text: אֶלָּא אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא: אֲפִילּוּ קִיבֵּל תּוֹרָה כְּמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״מִימִינוֹ אֵשׁ דָּת לָמוֹ״ — לֹא יִנָּקֶה מִדִּינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם.
sentences.human_translation: Rather, of the school of Rabbi Sheila say: even received the Torah like Moses our teacher that it is written with regard to him: “At His right hand was a fiery law unto them” will not be unpunished from the judgment of Gehenna.
sentences.llm_translation: Amrami b. Rav Shilah: If one takes upon himself the study of the Torah as one of our masters has said, "As is the servant of the Master, so is the servant of the Master," — it is not permissible to take upon oneself the study of Torah lest one be corrupted by the din of the gentiles.

sentences.text: קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַאי ״יָד לְיָד״, ״יָד מִיָּד״ מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ!

text: דִּכְתִיב: ״זֹאת״. בִּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים וּשְׁנֵי בּוֹעֲלִין — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּהָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״תּוֹרַת״.
כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד וּשְׁנֵי בּוֹעֲלִין, בִּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים וּבוֹעֵל אֶחָד.
תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: ״תּוֹרַת״ — לְרַבּוֹיֵי כּוּלְּהִי, ״זֹאת״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי אִישׁ אֶחָד וּבוֹעֵל אֶחָד.
וְרַבָּנַן בָּתְרָאֵי סָבְרִי: ״זֹאת״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי כּוּלְּהִי, ״תּוֹרַת״ — לְרַבּוֹיֵי שְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים וּשְׁנֵי בּוֹעֲלִין.

וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: ״זֹאת״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי תַּרְתֵּי, ״תּוֹרַת״ — לְרַבּוֹת תַּרְתֵּי. ״זֹאת״ לְמַעוֹטֵי תַּרְתֵּי — אִישׁ אֶחָד וּבוֹעֵל אֶחָד, אִישׁ אֶחָד וּשְׁנֵי בּוֹעֲלִין, ״תּוֹרַת״ — לְרַבּוֹיֵי תַּרְתֵּי, שְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים וּבוֹעֵל אֶחָד, שְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים וּשְׁנֵי בּוֹעֲלִין.
הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הָיָה מֵבִיא

הָיָה נוֹטֵל אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ מִתּוֹךְ כְּפִיפָה מִצְרִית, וְנוֹתְנָהּ לְתוֹךְ כְּלִי שָׁרֵת, וְנוֹתְנָהּ עַל יָדָהּ, וְכֹהֵן מַנִּיחַ יָדוֹ מִתַּחְתֶּיהָ וּמְנִיפָהּ. הֵנִיף וְהִגִּישׁ, קָמַץ וְהִקְטִיר, וְהַשְּׁאָר נֶאֱכָל לַכֹּהֲנִים.

הָיָה מַשְׁקָהּ וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַקְרִיב אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מַקְרִיב אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ וְאַחַר כָּךְ הָיָה מַשְׁקָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַחַר יַשְׁקֶה אֶת הָאִשָּׁה אֶת הַמָּיִם״. אִם הִשְׁקָהּ וְאַחַר כָּךְ הִקְרִיב אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ — כְּשֵׁרָה.

גְּמָ׳ אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לְרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה דְּדָרֵיהּ: לָא תֵּיתֵב אַכַּרְעָךְ עַד דִּמְפָרְשַׁתְּ לָהּ לְהָא מִילְּתָא: מִנַּיִן לְמִנְחַת סוֹטָה שֶׁטְּעוּנָה תְּנוּפָה? מְנָא לַן?! ״וְהֵנִיף״ כְּתִיב בַּהּ! בִּבְעָלִים, מְנָלַן?
אָתְיָא ״יָד״ ״יָד״ מִשְּׁלָמִים. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְלָקַח הַכֹּהֵן מִיַּד הָאִשָּׁה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״יָדָיו תְּבִיאֶינָה״.
מָה כָּאן כֹּהֵן — אַף לְהַלָּן כֹּהֵן, וּמָה לְהַלָּן בְּעָלִים — אַף כָּאן בְּעָלִים. הָא כֵּיצַד? מַנִּיחַ יָדוֹ תַּחַת יְדֵי הַבְּעָלִים וּמֵנִיף.
הֵנִיף וְהִגִּישׁ קָמַץ וְכוּ׳. הָיָה מַשְׁקָהּ וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַקְרִיב אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ. הָא אַקְרְבַהּ!
הָכִי קָאָמַר: סֵדֶר מְנָחוֹת כֵּיצַד? הֵנִיף וְהִגִּישׁ, קָמַץ וְהִקְטִיר, וְהַשְּׁאָר נֶאֱכָל לַכֹּהֲנִים.

וּבְהַשְׁקָאָה גּוּפַהּ פְּלִיגִי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבָּנַן. דְּרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: מַשְׁקָהּ וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַקְרִיב אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: מַקְרִיב אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַשְׁקָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַחַר יַשְׁקֶה״.
וְאִם הִשְׁקָהּ וְאַחַר כָּךְ הִקְרִיב אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ — כְּשֵׁרָה.

תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְהִשְׁקָה״ מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״וְהִשְׁקָהּ״! שֶׁאִם נִמְחֲקָה מְגִילָּה וְאוֹמֶרֶת ״אֵינִי שׁוֹתָה״ — מְעַרְעֲרִין אוֹתָהּ וּמַשְׁקִין אוֹתָהּ בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.

רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״וְאַחַר יַשְׁקֶה״ מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״וְהִשְׁקָהּ״! אֶלָּא, לְאַחַר כׇּל מַעֲשִׂים כּוּלָּן הָאֲמוּרִין לְמַעְלָה. מַגִּיד שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים מְעַכְּבִין בָּהּ: עַד שֶׁלֹּא קָרַב הַקּוֹמֶץ, וְעַד שֶׁלֹּא נִמְחֲקָה מְגִילָּה, וְעַד שֶׁלֹּא תְּקַבֵּל עָלֶיהָ שְׁבוּעָה.
עַד שֶׁלֹּא קָרַב הַקּוֹמֶץ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: מַקְרִיב אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַשְׁקָהּ.
עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִמְחֲקָה מְגִילָּה. אֶלָּא מַאי מַשְׁקֶה לַהּ? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לֹא נִצְרְכָה לְשֶׁרִישּׁוּמוֹ נִיכָּר.

עַד שֶׁלֹּא תְּקַבֵּל עָלֶיהָ שְׁבוּעָה. מִישְׁתָּא הוּא דְּלָא שָׁתְיָא, הָא מִיכְתָּב כָּתְבִי לַהּ, וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: מְגִילַּת סוֹטָה שֶׁכְּתָבָהּ קוֹדֶם שֶׁתְּקַבֵּל עָלֶיהָ שְׁבוּעָה — לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם! כְּדִי נַסְבַהּ.
בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? תְּלָתָא קְרָאֵי כְּתִיבִי: ״וְהִשְׁקָה״ קַמָּא, ״וְאַחַר יַשְׁקֶה״, ״וְהִשְׁקָהּ״ בָּתְרָא.

רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: ״וְהִשְׁקָה״ קַמָּא — לְגוּפוֹ, שֶׁמַּשְׁקֶה וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַקְרִיב אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ. ״וְאַחַר יַשְׁקֶה״ — מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְשֶׁרִישּׁוּמוֹ נִיכָּר. ״וְהִשְׁקָהּ״ בָּתְרָא — שֶׁאִם נִמְחֲקָה מְגִילָּה וְאוֹמֶרֶת ״אֵינִי שׁוֹתָה״, מְעַרְעֲרִין אוֹתָהּ וּמַשְׁקֶה אוֹתָהּ בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ.

וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: ״וְאַחַר יַשְׁקֶה״ — לְגוּפוֹ, שֶׁמַּקְרִיב אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַשְׁקָהּ. ״וְהִשְׁקָה״ קַמָּא — שֶׁאִם הִשְׁקָהּ וְאַחַר כָּךְ הִקְרִיב אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ כְּשֵׁרָה. ״וְהִשְׁקָהּ״ בָּתְרָא — שֶׁאִם נִמְחֲקָה מְגִילָּה וְאָמְרָה ״אֵינִי שׁוֹתָה״, מְעַרְעֲרִין אוֹתָהּ וּמַשְׁקִין אוֹתָהּ בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ.
וְרַבָּנַן — בְּדִיעֲבַד לָא פָּתַח קְרָא.

וְסָבַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מַשְׁקִין אוֹתָהּ בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כַּלְבּוֹס שֶׁל בַּרְזֶל מְטִילִין לְתוֹךְ פִּיהָ, שֶׁאִם נִמְחֲקָה מְגִילָּה וְאָמְרָה ״אֵינִי שׁוֹתָה״ — מְעַרְעֲרִין אוֹתָהּ וּמַשְׁקִין אוֹתָהּ בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ. אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כְּלוּם אָנוּ צְרִיכִין אֶלָּא לְבוֹדְקָהּ, וַהֲלֹא בְּדוּקָה וְעוֹמֶדֶת! אֶלָּא: עַד שֶׁלֹּא קָרַב הַקּוֹמֶץ — יְכוֹלָה לַחֲזוֹר בָּהּ, מִשֶּׁקָּרַב הַקּוֹמֶץ — אֵינָהּ יְכוֹלָה לַחֲזוֹר בָּהּ.
וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, תִּיקְשֵׁי לָךְ הִיא גּוּפַהּ: מִשֶּׁקָּרַב הַקּוֹמֶץ אֵינָהּ יְכוֹלָה לַחֲזוֹר בָּהּ? וַהֲלֹא בְּדוּקָה וְעוֹמֶדֶת!
לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — דְּקָהָדְרָא בַּהּ מֵחֲמַת רְתִיתָא, וְהָא — דְּקָהָדְרָא בָּהּ מֵחֲמַת בְּרִיּוּתָא.

וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: כׇּל מֵחֲמַת בְּרִיּוּתָא — כְּלָל כְּלָל לָא שָׁתְיָא. מֵחֲמַת רְתִיתָא עַד שֶׁלֹּא קָרַב הַקּוֹמֶץ, דְּאַכַּתִּי לָא אִמְּחוּק מְגִילָּה, אִי נָמֵי אִמְּחוּק מְגִילָּה, דְּשֶׁלֹּא כְּדִין עֲבוּד כֹּהֲנִים דְּמַחֲקִי — מָצְיָ[א] הָדְרָא בָּהּ. מִשֶּׁקָּרַב הַקּוֹמֶץ, דִּבְדִין עֲבוּד כֹּהֲנִים דְּמָחֲקִי — לָא מָצֵי הָדְרָא בָּהּ.
קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אַדְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: הָתָם אָמַר מְחִיקָה מְעַכְּבָא, וְהָכָא אָמַר קוֹמֶץ מְעַכֵּב!
תְּרֵי תַּנָּאֵי וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.

אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: אָמְרָה אֵינִי שׁוֹתָה מֵחֲמַת בְּרִיּוּתָא, וְחָזְרָה וְאָמְרָה שׁוֹתָה אֲנִי, מַהוּ? כֵּיוָן דְּאָמְרָה אֵינִי שׁוֹתָה — טְמֵאָה אֲנִי קָאָמְרָה, וְכֵיוָן דְּאַחְזִיק נַפְשַׁהּ בְּטוּמְאָה, לָא מָצְיָא הָדְרָה בַּהּ. אוֹ דִילְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּאָמְרָה שׁוֹתָה אֲנִי — גַּלִּיָא דַּעְתַּהּ דְּמֵחֲמַת בִּיעֲתוּתָא הוּא דְּאָמְרָה. תֵּיקוּ.
אָמַר אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: צָרִיךְ שֶׁיִּתֵּן מַר לְתוֹךְ הַמַּיִם. מַאי טַעְמָא — דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״מֵי הַמָּרִים״, שֶׁמָּרִים כְּבָר.

מַתְנִי׳ עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִמְחֲקָה הַמְּגִילָּה אָמְרָה ״אֵינִי שׁוֹתָה״ — מְגִילָּתָהּ נִגְנֶזֶת, וּמִנְחָתָהּ מִתְפַּזֶּרֶת עַל הַדֶּשֶׁן, וְאֵין מְגִילָּתָהּ כְּשֵׁרָה לְהַשְׁקוֹת בָּהּ סוֹטָה אַחֶרֶת. נִמְחֲקָה הַמְּגִילָּה וְאָמְרָה ״טְמֵאָה אֲנִי״ — הַמַּיִם נִשְׁפָּכִין, וּמִנְחָתָהּ מִתְפַּזֶּרֶת עַל בֵּית הַדֶּשֶׁן. נִמְחֲקָה הַמְּגִילָּה וְאָמְרָה ״אֵינִי שׁוֹתָה״ — מְעַרְעֲרִין אוֹתָהּ, וּמַשְׁקִין אוֹתָהּ בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ.
אֵינָהּ מַסְפֶּקֶת לִשְׁתּוֹת עַד שֶׁפָּנֶיהָ מוֹרִיקוֹת, וְעֵינֶיהָ בּוֹלְטוֹת, וְהִיא מִתְמַלֵּאת גִּידִין. וְהֵם אוֹמְרִים: הוֹצִיאוּהָ [הוֹצִיאוּהָ] שֶׁלֹּא תְּטַמֵּא הָעֲזָרָה.

אִם יֵשׁ לָהּ זְכוּת — הָיְתָה תּוֹלָה לָהּ. יֵשׁ זְכוּת תּוֹלָה שָׁנָה אַחַת, יֵשׁ זְכוּת תּוֹלָה שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים, יֵשׁ זְכוּת תּוֹלָה שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים. מִכָּאן אוֹמֵר בֶּן עַזַּאי: חַיָּיב אָדָם לְלַמֵּד אֶת בִּתּוֹ תּוֹרָה, שֶׁאִם תִּשְׁתֶּה תֵּדַע שֶׁהַזְּכוּת תּוֹלָה לָהּ. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַמְלַמֵּד בִּתּוֹ תּוֹרָה — (כְּאִילּוּ) לוֹמְּדָהּ תִּפְלוּת.

רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: רוֹצָה אִשָּׁה בְּקַב וְתִפְלוּת, מִתִּשְׁעָה קַבִּין וּפְרִישׁוּת. הוּא הָיָה אוֹמֵר: חָסִיד שׁוֹטֶה, וְרָשָׁע עָרוּם, וְאִשָּׁה פְּרוּשָׁה, וּמַכּוֹת פְּרוּשִׁין — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם.

גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: כְּשֶׁהָיִיתִי לָמֵד תּוֹרָה אֵצֶל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הָיִיתִי מֵטִיל קַנְקַנְתּוֹם לְתוֹךְ הַדְּיוֹ, וְלֹא אָמַר לִי דָּבָר. כְּשֶׁבָּאתִי אֵצֶל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אָמַר לִי: בְּנִי מָה מְלַאכְתֶּךָ? אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: לַבְלָר אֲנִי. אָמַר לִי: בְּנִי, הֱוֵי זָהִיר, שֶׁמְּלַאכְתְּךָ מְלֶאכֶת שָׁמַיִם הִיא, שֶׁמָּא תַּחְסִיר אוֹת אַחַת אוֹ תֹּתִיר אוֹת אַחַת, נִמְצֵאתָ אַתָּה מַחְרִיב אֶת כָּל הָעוֹלָם כֻּלּוֹ.

אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: דָּבָר אֶחָד יֵשׁ לִי שֶׁאֲנִי מֵטִיל לְתוֹךְ הַדְּיוֹ, וְקַנְקַנְתּוֹם שְׁמוֹ. אָמַר לִי: וְכִי מְטִילִין קַנְקַנְתּוֹם לְתוֹךְ הַדְּיוֹ? הַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה ״וּמָחָה״, כְּתָב שֶׁיּוּכַל לִמְחוֹת!
מַאי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ וּמַאי קָא מַהְדַּר לֵיהּ?

הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: לָא מִבַּעְיָא בַּחֲסֵירוֹת וִיתֵירוֹת דְּבָקִי אֲנָא, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לְמֵיחַשׁ לִזְבוּב דְּדִילְמָא אָתֵי וְיָתֵיב אַתָּגֵיהּ דְּדָלֶית וּמָחֵיק לֵיהּ וּמְשַׁוֵּי לֵיהּ רֵישׁ — דָּבָר אֶחָד יֵשׁ לִי שֶׁאֲנִי מֵטִיל לְתוֹךְ הַדְּיוֹ וְקַנְקַנְתּוֹם שְׁמוֹ.

אִינִי? וְהָא תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: כְּשֶׁהָיִיתִי לָמֵד תּוֹרָה אֵצֶל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הָיִיתִי מֵטִיל קַנְקַנְתּוֹם לְתוֹךְ הַדְּיוֹ, וְלֹא אָמַר לִי דָּבָר. כְּשֶׁבָּאתִי אֵצֶל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אֲסָרָהּ עָלַי!
קַשְׁיָא שִׁמּוּשׁ אַשִּׁמּוּשׁ. קַשְׁיָא אֲסָרָהּ אַאֲסָרָהּ!

בִּשְׁלָמָא שִׁמּוּשׁ אַשִּׁמּוּשׁ לָא קַשְׁיָא: מֵעִיקָּרָא אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. כֵּיוָן דְּלָא מָצֵי (קָם) [לְמֵיקַם] אַלִּיבֵּיהּ, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וּגְמַר גְּמָרָא. הֲדַר אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר סְבָרָא.
אֶלָּא אֲסָרָהּ אַאֲסָרָהּ קַשְׁיָא! קַשְׁיָא.
תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, אוֹמֵר הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר: לַכֹּל מְטִילִין קַנְקַנְתּוֹם לְתוֹךְ הַדְּיוֹ,
חוּץ מִפָּרָשַׁת סוֹטָה בִּלְבַד. רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר מִשְּׁמוֹ: חוּץ מִפָּרָשַׁת סוֹטָה שֶׁל מִקְדָּשׁ. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: לִמְחוֹק לָהּ מִן הַתּוֹרָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.

וְהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי כִי הָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי. דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין מְגִילָּתָהּ כְּשֵׁירָה לְהַשְׁקוֹת בָּהּ סוֹטָה אַחֶרֶת. רַבִּי אַחַי בַּר יֹאשִׁיָּה אוֹמֵר: מְגִילָּתָהּ כְּשֵׁירָה לְהַשְׁקוֹת בָּהּ סוֹטָה אַחֶרֶת.

אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, דִּילְמָא לָא הִיא: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא הָתָם, אֶלָּא כֵּיוָן דְּאִינְּתִיק לְשׁוּם רָחֵל — לָא הָדְרָא מִינַּתְקָא לְשׁוּם לֵאָה, אֲבָל תּוֹרָה, דִּסְתָמָא כְּתִיבָה — הָכִי נָמֵי דְּמָחֲקִינַן.

אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: דִּילְמָא לָא הִיא, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי אַחַי בַּר יֹאשִׁיָּה הָתָם אֶלָּא בִּמְגִילָּה, דְּאִיכְּתוּב לְשׁוּם אָלוֹת בָּעוֹלָם. אֲבָל תּוֹרָה, דִּלְהִתְלַמֵּד כְּתִיבָה, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא מָחֲקִינַן.
וְרַבִּי אַחַי בַּר יֹאשִׁיָּה לֵית לֵיהּ כָּתַב לְגָרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְנִמְלַךְ, מְצָאוֹ בֶּן עִירוֹ וְאָמַר לוֹ: שְׁמִי כְּשִׁמְךָ, וְשֵׁם אִשְׁתִּי כְּשֵׁם אִשְׁתְּךָ — פָּסוּל לְגָרֵשׁ בּוֹ?
אָמְרִי: הָתָם ״וְכָתַב לָהּ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, בָּעִינַן כְּתִיבָה לִשְׁמָהּ: הָכָא נָמֵי ״וְעָשָׂה לָהּ״! מַאי עֲשִׂיָּיה — מְחִיקָה.

אֵינָהּ מַסְפֶּקֶת לִשְׁתּוֹת עַד שֶׁפָּנֶיהָ [כּוּ׳]. מַנִּי — רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מַקְרִיב אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַשְׁקָהּ. דְּכַמָּה דְּלָא קָרְבָה מִנְחָתַהּ — לָא בָּדְקִי לַהּ מַיָּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״מִנְחַת זִכָּרוֹן מַזְכֶּרֶת עָוֹן״,
אֵימָא סֵיפָא: יֵשׁ לָהּ זְכוּת הָיְתָה תּוֹלָה לָהּ, אֲתָאן לְרַבָּנַן, דְּאִי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, הָאָמַר: אֵין זְכוּת תּוֹלָה בַּמַּיִם הַמָּרִים!
אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מַקְרִיב אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַשְׁקָהּ, וּבִזְכוּת סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבָּנַן.
וְהֵם אוֹמְרִים הוֹצִיאוּהָ וְכוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא — דְּדִילְמָא מֵתָה. לְמֵימְרָא דְּמֵת אָסוּר בְּמַחֲנֵה לְוִיָּה?

וְהָתַנְיָא: טְמֵא מֵת מוּתָּר לִיכָּנֵס לְמַחֲנֵה לְוִיָּה. וְלֹא טְמֵא מֵת בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ מֵת עַצְמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקַּח מֹשֶׁה אֶת עַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף עִמּוֹ״, עִמּוֹ בִּמְחִיצָתוֹ!

אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שֶׁמָּא תִּפְרוֹס נִדָּה. לְמֵימְרָא דְּבִיעֲתוּתָא מְרַפְּיָא? אִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתִּתְחַלְחַל הַמַּלְכָּה מְאֹד״, וְאָמַר רַב: שֶׁפֵּירְסָה נִדָּה. וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: חֲרָדָה מְסַלֶּקֶת דָּמִים! פַּחְדָּא צָמֵית, בִּיעֲתוּתָא מְרַפְּיָא.
יֵשׁ לָהּ זְכוּת הָיְתָה וְכוּ׳. מַנִּי מַתְנִיתִין? לָא אַבָּא יוֹסֵי בֶּן חָנָן, וְלָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן יִצְחָק אִישׁ כְּפַר דָּרוֹם, וְלֹא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.

דְּתַנְיָא: אִם יֵשׁ לָהּ זְכוּת תּוֹלָה לָהּ שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, כְּדֵי הַכָּרַת הָעוּבָּר, דִּבְרֵי אַבָּא יוֹסֵי בֶּן חָנָן. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן יִצְחָק אִישׁ כְּפַר דָּרוֹם אוֹמֵר: תִּשְׁעָה חֳדָשִׁים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנִקְּתָה וְנִזְרְעָה זָרַע״, וּלְהַלָּן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״זֶרַע יַעַבְדֶנּוּ יְסֻפַּר״, זֶרַע הָרָאוּי לְסַפֵּר.

רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ. וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין רְאָיָה לַדָּבָר — זֵכֶר לַדָּבָר, דִּכְתִיב: ״לָהֵן מַלְכָּא מִלְכִּי יִשְׁפַּר עֲלָיךְ וַחֲטָיָךְ בְּצִדְקָה פְרֻק וַעֲוָיָתָךְ בְּמִחַן עֲנָיִן
הֵן תֶּהֱוֵי אַרְכָא לִשְׁלֵוְתָךְ״, וּכְתִיב: ״כֹּלָּא מְטָא עַל נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר מַלְכָּא״, וּכְתִיב: ״לִקְצָת יַרְחִין תְּרֵי עֲשַׂר״!
לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וְאַשְׁכַּח קְרָא דְּאָמַר וְתָנֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ עַל שְׁלֹשָׁה פִּשְׁעֵי אֱדוֹם״,
וּמַאי אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין רְאָיָה לַדָּבָר זֵכֶר לַדָּבָר? דִּלְמָא שָׁאנֵי גּוֹיִם, דְּלָא מִפְּקִיד דִּינָא עֲלַיְיהוּ.
וְיֵשׁ זְכוּת תּוֹלָה שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים כּוּ׳. זְכוּת דְּמַאי? אִילֵּימָא זְכוּת דְּתוֹרָה — הָא אֵינָהּ מְצֻווָה וְעוֹשָׂה הִיא! אֶלָּא זְכוּת דְּמִצְוָה.

זְכוּת דְּמִצְוָה מִי מַגְּנָא כּוּלֵּי הַאי? וְהָתַנְיָא: אֶת זוֹ דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי מְנַחֵם בַּר יוֹסֵי: ״כִּי נֵר מִצְוָה וְתוֹרָה אוֹר״, תָּלָה הַכָּתוּב אֶת הַמִּצְוָה בְּנֵר, וְאֶת הַתּוֹרָה בְּאוֹר. אֶת הַמִּצְוָה בְּנֵר, לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה נֵר אֵינָהּ מְגִינָּה אֶלָּא לְפִי שָׁעָה — אַף מִצְוָה אֵינָהּ מְגִינָּה אֶלָּא לְפִי שָׁעָה.

וְאֶת הַתּוֹרָה בְּאוֹר, לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה אוֹר מֵגֵין לָעוֹלָם, אַף תּוֹרָה מְגִינָּה לָעוֹלָם. וְאוֹמֵר: ״בְּהִתְהַלֶּכְךָ תַּנְחֶה אֹתְךָ וְגוֹ׳״. ״בְּהִתְהַלֶּכְךָ תַּנְחֶה אֹתְךָ״ — זֶה הָעוֹלָם הַזֶּה. ״בְּשָׁכְבְּךָ תִּשְׁמוֹר עָלֶיךָ״ — זוֹ מִיתָה. ״וַהֲקִיצוֹתָ הִיא תְשִׂיחֶךָ״ — לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא.

מָשָׁל לְאָדָם שֶׁהָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ בְּאִישׁוֹן לַיְלָה וַאֲפֵילָה, וּמִתְיָירֵא מִן הַקּוֹצִים וּמִן הַפְּחָתִים וּמִן הַבַּרְקָנִים, וּמֵחַיָּה רָעָה וּמִן הַלִּסְטִין, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּאֵיזֶה דֶּרֶךְ מְהַלֵּךְ.

נִזְדַּמְּנָה לוֹ אֲבוּקָה שֶׁל אוּר — נִיצַּל מִן הַקּוֹצִים וּמִן הַפְּחָתִים וּמִן הַבַּרְקָנִים, וַעֲדַיִין מִתְיָירֵא מֵחַיָּה רָעָה וּמִן הַלִּיסְטִין, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּאֵיזֶה דֶּרֶךְ מְהַלֵּךְ. כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָלָה עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר — נִיצַּל מֵחַיָּה רָעָה וּמִן הַלִּיסְטִין, וַעֲדַיִין אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּאֵיזֶה דֶּרֶךְ מְהַלֵּךְ. הִגִּיעַ לְפָרָשַׁת דְּרָכִים — נִיצַּל מִכּוּלָּם.
דָּבָר אַחֵר: עֲבֵירָה מְכַבָּה מִצְוָה, וְאֵין עֲבֵירָה מְכַבָּה תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מַיִם רַבִּים לֹא יוּכְלוּ לְכַבּוֹת אֶת הָאַהֲבָה״.

אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מִצְוָה, בְּעִידָּנָא דְּעָסֵיק בָּהּ — מַגְּנָא וּמַצְּלָא, בְּעִידָּנָא דְּלָא עָסֵיק בָּהּ — אַגּוֹנֵי מַגְּנָא, אַצּוֹלֵי לָא מַצְּלָא. תּוֹרָה, בֵּין בְּעִידָּנָא דְּעָסֵיק בָּהּ וּבֵין בְּעִידָּנָא דְּלָא עָסֵיק בָּהּ — מַגְּנָא וּמַצְּלָא.

מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבָּה: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, דּוֹאֵג וַאֲחִיתוֹפֶל מִי לָא עָסְקִי בְּתוֹרָה? אַמַּאי לָא הֵגֵינָּה עֲלַיְיהוּ? אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: תּוֹרָה בְּעִידָּנָא דְּעָסֵיק בָּהּ — מַגְּנָא וּמַצְּלָא, בְּעִידָּנָא דְּלָא עָסֵיק בָּהּ — אַגּוֹנֵי מַגְּנָא, אַצּוֹלֵי לָא מַצְּלָא. מִצְוָה, בֵּין בְּעִידָּנָא דְּעָסֵיק בָּהּ בֵּין בְּעִידָּנָא דְּלָא עָסֵיק בָּהּ — אַגּוֹנֵי מַגְּנָא, אַצּוֹלֵי לָא מַצְּלָא.

רָבִינָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם זְכוּת תּוֹרָה, וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ אֵינָהּ מְצֻווָה וְעוֹשָׂה נְהִי דִּפַּקּוֹדֵי לָא מִפַּקְּדָא, בְּאַגְרָא דְּמַקְרְיָן וּמַתְנְיָין בְּנַיְיהוּ וְנָטְרָן לְהוּ לְגַבְרַיְיהוּ עַד דְּאָתוּ מִבֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא, מִי לָא פָּלְגָאן בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ?

מַאי פָּרָשַׁת דְּרָכִים? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם וְיוֹם מִיתָה. רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם וְיִרְאַת חֵטְא. מָר זוּטְרָא אָמַר: זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם דְּסָלְקָא לֵיהּ שְׁמַעְתָּתָא אַלִּיבָּא דְהִלְכְתָא.

דָּבָר אַחֵר: עֲבֵירָה מְכַבָּה מִצְוָה, וְאֵין עֲבֵירָה מְכַבָּה תּוֹרָה. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: דַּרְשֵׁיהּ רַבִּי מְנַחֵם בַּר יוֹסֵי לְהַאי קְרָא כִּי סִינַי, וְאִילְמָלֵא דַּרְשׁוּהּ דּוֹאֵג וַאֲחִיתוֹפֶל הָכִי לָא רְדַפוּ בָּתַר דָּוִד, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֵאמֹר אֱלֹהִים עֲזָבוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.
מַאי דְּרוּשׁ — ״וְלֹא יִרְאֶה בְךָ עֶרְוַת דָּבָר וְגוֹ׳״, וְהֵן אֵינָן יוֹדְעִין שֶׁעֲבֵירָה מְכַבָּה מִצְוָה, וְאֵין עֲבֵירָה מְכַבָּה תּוֹרָה.
מַאי ״בּוֹז יָבוּזוּ לוֹ״? אָמַר עוּלָּא: לָא כְּשִׁמְעוֹן אֲחִי עֲזַרְיָה, וְלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּבֵי נְשִׂיאָה,

אֶלָּא כְּהִלֵּל וְשֶׁבְנָא. דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: הִלֵּל וְשֶׁבְנָא אַחֵי הֲווֹ. הִלֵּל עֲסַק בַּתּוֹרָה, שֶׁבְנָא עֲבַד עִיסְקָא. לְסוֹף, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תָּא נַעֲרוֹב וְלִיפְלוֹג! יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: ״אִם יִתֵּן אִישׁ אֶת כׇּל הוֹן בֵּיתוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.

Rabban: "What is the study of the Torah to him? And has he not already said 'Wash yourselves'?" If he is not meritorious of the study of the Torah, and he says 'I am not worthy' — let us all be meritorious of the study of the Torah, and let us wash him in the study of the Torah, according to the words of Rabbi Akiva.

Rabbi Shim'on says: "What is the study of the Torah to one who has quenched his thirst?" "And what has been said before, 'Wash her'?" "Indeed, to one who has quenched his thirst, the study of the Torah is not for him. R. Gamliel: Talmudic tractate: What is the meaning of the verse: "And he was drunk" (Deuteronomy 21:21)? R. Kriyei Chitvi: "And he was drunk", "And after he was drunk", "And he was drunk again" - all are not the words of the verse.

RABBI SABBAI: "And he drank" — to his own, for if one drinks and afterwards buys from the Torah, he is a thief from his own Torah. "And after drinking" — from the words of his master, to be ashamed. "And drinking" in the study — if one is caught in a state of intoxication and says "I am not guilty", they must be punished for it and must be punished for drinking in the study.

Rav Yehuda said: "I have said that I am not worthy of the greatness of the great ones, and I have said that I am worthy — what is the meaning of this? For when I say that I am not worthy — it is as if I am saying that I am worthy, and when I am worthy — it is as if I am saying that I am not worthy. Or perhaps when I say that I am worthy — it is as if I am saying that I am not worthy, and when I am not worthy — it is as if I am saying that I am worthy. What is the meaning of this? — I am saying that I am worthy, and the one who says that he is worthy — he is worthy, and the one who says that he is not worthy — he is not worthy.
Rav Avahu said: One must not be in the midst of the waters. Rav Ma'ir said: "The wicked are like the waters," for they are already corrupted.

If there is a woman who has the quality — she should have been devoted to her. A woman's quality, devotion, one year, two years, three years. From this it is said in the words of Ben Azai: The son of Adam was commanded to teach his daughter Torah, if she were to learn the knowledge that the quality, devotion, belongs to her. Rabbi Eliezer says: Whoever studies Torah in his own home — (as if) he is studying her Talmud.

Rabbi Yehoshua says: One who seeks a wife in a state of impurity, from the act of impurity, and separation, is considered to have committed a transgression. He who says: "A hardened heart, a slothful spirit, a woman who is proud, and the garments of the proud — these are the ones who are liable to be punished." — He is the one who says this.

Rav Yehuda said: Shmuel said: Rabbi Meir said: As I was studying the Torah with Rabbi Akiva, I became accustomed to the manner of speaking of the latter, and he would say to me: "Speak." As I was with Rabbi Yishmael, he said to me: "Son, what is the meaning of your words?" I said to him: "To the left." He said to me: "Son, be a deceiver, for if you speak of the left, you will be speaking of the right, and if you speak of the right, you will be speaking of the left." I said to him: "Son, be a deceiver, for if you speak of the left, you will be speaking of the right, and if you speak of the right, you will be speaking of the left." Biblical quote: "Speak" (דָּבָר) is a quote from the verse: "Speak unto him, and he shall speak unto thee" (Exodus 4:14).

I said to him: One thing I have found for myself, that I am not permitted to take from him, and to give to others, for the sake of his i.e. the Torah's greatness. He said to me: How can one take from him, for the sake of his greatness? The Torah said: "Woe to him who transgresses" i.e. who transgresses the Torah's commandments, as if he were capable of transgressing i.e. as if he were a transgressor!

Rabbah said: The sages of the house of Shammai said: The sages of the house of Hillel said: What is the meaning of the verse: "You shall not boil a kid in its mother's milk"? Is it to prohibit the boiling of a kid in its mother's milk? Rabbah said: From the law, it is not in their hands. From the Torah, it is not in their hands.

And the sages say: There is no one who is worthy of the honor of being a student of the sages. R. Akiva bar Yoseh says: There is no one who is worthy of the honor of being a student of the sages. R. Akiva bar Yoseh says: There is no one who is worthy of the honor of being a student of the sages.

Rav Pappa said: The one who says to the student: "As long as I am alive, I will not teach you Torah," is acting like a slave to the will of Rechel — to the will of the Torah, but not to the will of the commandment, for it is written: "You shall not muzzle the ox in its time of rest." — How can one be a slave to the will of the commandment, when one is commanded to do a thing, and it is not in one's power to do it?

Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: The one who is like unto the one who says, "I will not be like any man," is like unto the one who says, "I will not be like my father or my master," for it is written, "You shall not be like unto your father in anything," (Deuteronomy 5:9). But the Torah, which is the study of the words, is not to be learned in this manner, for it is written, "You shall not be like unto your father in anything," (Deuteronomy 5:9), but rather, "You shall not be like unto your father in anything," (Deuteronomy 5:9) is not the study of the words, but rather, "You shall not be like unto your father in anything," (Deuteronomy 5:9) is the study of the words, but rather, "You shall not be like unto your father in anything," (Deuteronomy 5:9) is the study of the words, but rather, "You shall not be like unto your father in anything," (Deuteronomy 5:9) is the study of the words, but rather, "You shall not be like unto your father in anything," (Deuteronomy 5:9) is the study of the words, but rather, "You shall not be like unto your father in anything," (Deuteronomy 5:9) is the study of the words, but rather, "You shall not be like unto your father in anything," (Deuteronomy 5:9) is the study of the words, but rather, "You shall not be like unto your father in anything," (Deuteronomy 5:9) is the study of the words, but rather, "You shall not be like unto your father in anything," (Deuteronomy 5:9) is the study of the words, but rather, "You shall not be like unto your father in anything," (Deuteronomy 5:9) is the study of the words, but rather, "You shall not be like unto your father in anything," (Deuteronomy 5:9) is the study of the words, but rather, "You shall not be like unto your father in anything," (Deuteronomy 5:9) is the study of the words, but rather, "You shall not be like unto your father in anything," (

She is not to be taken as a means to his own sustenance until when his eyes are upon her i.e. when he is gazing at her. Mani — Rabbi Shimeon, said: One should not take her as a means to his own sustenance after he has gazed at her. How can one come near to her from the depth of his own i.e. his own nach — to the i.e. the eye, of the i.e. the mayya, i.e. the one who said: "From the depth of his own i.e. his own nach memory" i.e. memory of sin i.e. sin is i.e. is forgotten i.e. forgotten.

Rav Chisda said: The one who is a mani — Rav Aqiva the elder, who said: One should not take from the Torah and after that drink wine, and in the observance of the Sabbath to her the Torah as a rabbanan.

To the i.e. the meritorious one who is dying? Rabbis: It is permitted to kill a non-Jew who is about to kill a Jew. And they said, "It is not permitted to kill him by his own hand, for it is written: 'And he took the armor of his master, Yosafat, and put it on with him.' (1 Kings 22:34) For it is written: 'He took the armor of his master, Yosafat, and put it on with him.' (1 Kings 22:34)

Rav Avyay said: If one is forced to eat the flesh of a non-kosher animal. To the student of Rav Huna? No, for it is said: "The king's law is not to be disregarded", and Rav said: "The prohibition is clear". And we say: "A sharp knife, a bloody slaughter, a slaughtered animal, a slaughtered people!" Rav Huna said: "The prohibition is clear". And we say: "A sharp knife, a bloody slaughter, a slaughtered animal, a slaughtered people!"
Yeshelah zekhut haYitha v'khu. Mni matnitin? La a Avah Yosef ben Chanin, v'la Rabi Elazar ben Yitzchak Ish Kfar Darom, v'la Rabi Yishmael.

Rabbis: If there is a woman who has not yet reached the age of three years, as the law of the gentiles, according to the words of Abba Yose ben Chanin. Rabbi Elazar ben Yitzchak son of Yitzchak Ish son of Parah says: The sin of new-borns, as it is said: "You shall not profane the seed, nor sow it, nor let it be sown", and the one who says: "The seed is sown in the wilderness", is considered a sin. The seed of the nations to be sown.

Rabbi Yishma'el says: eighteen months. For ever Rabbī Yishmaʿēl, and Ashḳakh, son of Ḳṛa, of the sayings and teachings, who said: "How did the Holy One, blessed be He, say: 'Upon threefold transgressions, the soul shall not be saved,'" Talmudic text: רְבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וְאַשְׁכַּח, רְבִּי, דִּכְתִיב: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳, עַל שְׁלֹשָׁה פִּשְׁעֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״כֹּה אָמַר, רְבִּי, דִּכְתִיב: ״ English translation: Rabbī Yishmaʿēl, and Ashḳakh, Rabbī, who said: "How did the Holy One, blessed be He, say: 'Upon threefold transgressions, the soul shall not be saved,'" Talmudic text: רְבִּי, דִּכְתִיב: ״ English translation: Rabbī, who said: "Upon threefold transgressions, the soul shall not be saved," Talmudic text: כְּרָבְעָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״ English translation: As Raṿa, who said: "Upon threefold transgressions, the soul shall not be saved," Talmudic text: רְבִּי, יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וְאַשְׁכַּח, ר

And what is the meaning of the verse: "There is no one who can add to or detract from the words of the Torah"? Rather, the words of the Torah are not to be taken literally, as the words of the gentiles, as the words of the judge, but rather as the words of the one who is to be judged.

And it is said in the Mishnah: "Whoever has attained the age of thirty, let him not be forced to marry, lest he be forced to sin." — R. Meir? Is it not the case that the Torah forbids it? — But the decree of the Sages — "Let him not be forced to marry." — For it is written, "You shall not force a man to marry his daughter." (Deuteronomy 22:28)

Rabbis, tell me, from whence is the prohibition of the prohibition? And the Talmud: "The prohibition is a prohibition, and the law is a law, or" — the scribe Rabban Yohai said: "A prohibition is a prohibition, and a law is a law, or" — the prohibition is in the prohibition, and the law is in the law. The prohibition in the prohibition, to you, Rabban Yohai: "What is the prohibition, that it is not to be done, to a person who has sinned?" — indeed, a prohibition is not to be done to a person who has sinned.

And when He commanded you to teach: What is the purpose of the commandment, that it should be a stumbling block for you, or that the Torah should be a stumbling block for you? And He says: "In the way you walk, take heed to yourself, and observe." "In the way you walk, take heed to yourself" — this is the stumbling block, this is the one. "In your bed, set a watch over yourself" — this is a stumbling block. "And when you have brought forth the seed, set a watch over yourself" — to the end of the days.
Mashal Adama she hayeh m'halakh b'ishono l'yleh v'afilah, u'mit'yiray mein haqotzaim v'ha'phachatim v'ha'barakanim, u'mechayeh ra'ah v'mein ha'lisdtein, v'ainu yodea b'ezeh derakh m'halakh.

A different matter: A person who is habituated to breaking the law, and who habituates others to breaking the law, is not a person of Torah, as it is said: "They shall not be able to restrain themselves from doing evil" (Proverbs 28:15).

Rav Yosef said: A prohibition, in the presence of one who is desiring it — is a sin and a transgression, in the presence of one who is not desiring it — a sin and a transgression. The one who is desiring it, is a Magen Avir, the one who is not desiring it, is a Tzolli Lamed. The one who is desiring it, is a Tzolli Lamed, the one who is not desiring it, is a Magen Avir. The Torah, in the presence of one who is desiring it and in the presence of one who is not desiring it — is a sin and a transgression.

Rav Yehuda said: If one is forced to choose between the study of Torah and the study of the Mishnah, or the study of the Mishnah and the study of the Talmud, which is more desirable? For what reason? — Rava said: If one is forced to choose between the study of Torah and the study of the Mishnah, it is a despicable thing, whereas the study of the Mishnah and the study of the Talmud is a noble pursuit. — The former is a despicable thing, the latter is a noble pursuit. — If one is forced to choose between the study of Torah and the study of the Mishnah, it is a despicable thing, whereas the study of the Mishnah and the study of the Talmud is a noble pursuit. — The former is a despicable thing, the latter is a noble pursuit.

Ravina said: For ever the merit of the Torah, and the study of her words, are not permitted to be done, lest they be made into the ways of the gentiles, and the ways of the nations, and be led astray to their gods, until the day of the master, from whom they have been led astray, from the words of the prophets, from the writings of the sages, and from the deeds of the princes, until the day of the master, from whom they have been led astray?

Rava said: This is the study of the ignorant and the day of reckoning. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: This is the study of the ignorant and the fear of sin. Mar Zutra said: This is the study of the ignorant and the desecration of the name of Shema'ath ha-Talmid, the son of the blind, who was known for his lies.

The other thing: the one who is bound by the commandments, and the one who is not bound by the commandments, are not the same. Said Rav Yosef: The sages of Rav Yosef's son-in-law, Rabbi Menachem bar Yosef, to the one who is not bound by the commandments, I say: do not be like the one who is bound by the commandments, and do not be like the one who is not bound by the commandments, for it is written: "Do not turn back to the Lord your God, and do not go to him, for he is your God, and you have forsaken him.".

Rav Yehuda — "You shall not see in yourself a vessel of speech and words, and thus you will not know that you are bound by the commandment, and that the commandment does not bind the wicked." And lo, there is no one who knows that the wicked are bound by the commandment, and the commandment does not bind the wicked.
May he be punished for his own wickedness? Said Rav: For the sake of my brother Azarya, and for the one who is bound by the chains of Nesia,

Rabbah said: If one is forced to study Torah, it is like being forced to serve a master. At the time, he said to him: "Come, young man, do not be foolish! You have been caught in the snare of the voice and the word: 'If a man takes all the wealth of his house and puts it into a single vessel.'" (Deuteronomy 17:17)

sentences.llm_translation: Said: "This" (i.e. the prohibition of the Torah). In the case of two men, and two women — the general principle of the law of the land of Israel, that the husband is not permitted to take the wife's property and her earnings, for it is written: "The law of the land" (Deuteronomy 22:22).

sentences.text: תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: ״תּוֹרַת״ — לְרַבּוֹיֵי כּוּלְּהִי, ״זֹאת״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי אִישׁ אֶחָד וּבוֹעֵל אֶחָד.
sentences.human_translation: The first tanna holds “the law of to include all of these “this” to exclude one husband and one paramour,
sentences.llm_translation: R. Kamtza: "Torah" — to the great ones, "thus" — to the lowly one, a single man and his equal.

sentences.text: וְרַבָּנַן בָּתְרָאֵי סָבְרִי: ״זֹאת״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי כּוּלְּהִי, ״תּוֹרַת״ — לְרַבּוֹיֵי שְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים וּשְׁנֵי בּוֹעֲלִין.

sentences.llm_translation: Rabban: "What is the study of the Torah to him? And has he not already said 'Wash yourselves'?" If he is not meritorious of the study of the Torah, and he says 'I am not worthy' — let us all be meritorious of the study of the Torah, and let us wash him in the study of the Torah, according to the words of Rabbi Akiva.

sentences.text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״וְאַחַר יַשְׁקֶה״ מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״וְהִשְׁקָהּ״! אֶלָּא, לְאַחַר כׇּל מַעֲשִׂים כּוּלָּן הָאֲמוּרִין לְמַעְלָה. מַגִּיד שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים מְעַכְּבִין בָּהּ: עַד שֶׁלֹּא קָרַב הַקּוֹמֶץ, וְעַד שֶׁלֹּא נִמְחֲקָה מְגִילָּה, וְעַד שֶׁלֹּא תְּקַבֵּל עָלֶיהָ שְׁבוּעָה.

sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Shim'on says: "What is the study of the Torah to one who has quenched his thirst?" "And what has been said before, 'Wash her'?" "Indeed, to one who has quenched his thirst, the study of the Torah is not for him. Rather, after all the deeds of the wicked, to complete the study of the Torah for all the wicked, to teach them to be led astray. He should be guided to speak three words from the Torah, from the beginning: 'Until the one who gathers the dust, and until the one who is humbled, and until the one who is bound by the yoke of the Torah.' sentences.text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? תְּלָתָא קְרָאֵי כְּתִיבִי: ״וְהִשְׁקָה״ קַמָּא, ״וְאַחַר יַשְׁקֶה״, ״וְהִשְׁקָהּ״ בָּתְרָא.
sentences.human_translation: With regard to what do disagree Three verses are written The first “And he shall make drink” “And afterward he shall make drink the last “And he shall make her drink”
sentences.llm_translation: R. Gamliel: Talmudic tractate: What is the meaning of the verse: "And he was drunk" (Deuteronomy 21:21)? R. Kriyei Chitvi: "And he was drunk", "And after he was drunk", "And he was drunk again" - all are not the words of the verse.

sentences.text: רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: ״וְהִשְׁקָה״ קַמָּא — לְגוּפוֹ, שֶׁמַּשְׁקֶה וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַקְרִיב אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ. ״וְאַחַר יַשְׁקֶה״ — מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְשֶׁרִישּׁוּמוֹ נִיכָּר. ״וְהִשְׁקָהּ״ בָּתְרָא — שֶׁאִם נִמְחֲקָה מְגִילָּה וְאוֹמֶרֶת ״אֵינִי שׁוֹתָה״, מְעַרְעֲרִין אוֹתָהּ וּמַשְׁקֶה אוֹתָהּ בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ.
sentences.human_translation: The Rabbis hold the first “And he shall make drink,” to itself, that forces her to drink and afterward sacrifices her meal-offering. “And afterward he shall make drink,” is necessary that the impression is discernible, the last “And he shall make her drink,” that if the scroll was erased and says: I will not drink, she is forced to drink against her will.
sentences.llm_translation: RABBI SABBAI: "And he drank" — to his own, for if one drinks and afterwards buys from the Torah, he is a thief from his own Torah. "And after drinking" — from the words of his master, to be ashamed. "And drinking" in the study — if one is caught in a state of intoxication and says "I am not guilty", they must be punished for it and must be punished for drinking in the study.

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: ״וְאַחַר יַשְׁקֶה״ — לְגוּפוֹ, שֶׁמַּקְרִיב אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַשְׁקָהּ. ״וְהִשְׁקָה״ קַמָּא — שֶׁאִם הִשְׁקָהּ וְאַחַר כָּךְ הִקְרִיב אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ כְּשֵׁרָה. ״וְהִשְׁקָהּ״ בָּתְרָא — שֶׁאִם נִמְחֲקָה מְגִילָּה וְאָמְרָה ״אֵינִי שׁוֹתָה״, מְעַרְעֲרִין אוֹתָהּ וּמַשְׁקִין אוֹתָהּ בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon holds “And afterward he shall make drink to itself, that sacrifices her meal-offering and afterward forces her to drink. The first “And he shall make drink,” that if he forced her to drink and afterward sacrificed her meal-offering, is valid. The last “And he shall make her drink,” that if scroll was erased and she said: I will not drink, she is forced to drink against her will.

sentences.text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מַשְׁקִין אוֹתָהּ בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כַּלְבּוֹס שֶׁל בַּרְזֶל מְטִילִין לְתוֹךְ פִּיהָ, שֶׁאִם נִמְחֲקָה מְגִילָּה וְאָמְרָה ״אֵינִי שׁוֹתָה״ — מְעַרְעֲרִין אוֹתָהּ וּמַשְׁקִין אוֹתָהּ בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ. אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כְּלוּם אָנוּ צְרִיכִין אֶלָּא לְבוֹדְקָהּ, וַהֲלֹא בְּדוּקָה וְעוֹמֶדֶת! אֶלָּא: עַד שֶׁלֹּא קָרַב הַקּוֹמֶץ — יְכוֹלָה לַחֲזוֹר בָּהּ, מִשֶּׁקָּרַב הַקּוֹמֶץ — אֵינָהּ יְכוֹלָה לַחֲזוֹר בָּהּ.
sentences.human_translation: But does Rabbi Akiva hold forced to drink against her will? But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says: A hook [ kelabus ] of iron is placed into her mouth, that if the scroll was erased and she said: I will not drink, she is forced to drink against her will. Rabbi Akiva said: Don’t we need only to evaluate her And isn’t she established as evaluated Rather, Until the handful is sacrificed she can retract once the handful is sacrificed she cannot retract
sentences.llm_translation: And Rav Yehuda says: If one is caught in the act of desecrating the Temple, even if he says "I am not desecrating" — they must be punished, and one must be punished for desecrating the Temple. Rabbi Akiva says: We should all be brought to the study of the Torah, and the study of the Torah and the study of the Mishnah! For it is said: "The one who does not study the Torah is like one who does not study the words of the Sages" — one must be punished for desecrating the Temple, and one must be punished for desecrating the Temple. Rabbi Akiva says: All of us should be brought to the study of the Torah, and the study of the Torah and the study of the Mishnah! For it is said: "The one who does not study the Torah is like one who does not study the words of the Sages" — one must be punished for desecrating the Temple, and one must be punished for desecrating the Temple.

sentences.text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: אָמְרָה אֵינִי שׁוֹתָה מֵחֲמַת בְּרִיּוּתָא, וְחָזְרָה וְאָמְרָה שׁוֹתָה אֲנִי, מַהוּ? כֵּיוָן דְּאָמְרָה אֵינִי שׁוֹתָה — טְמֵאָה אֲנִי קָאָמְרָה, וְכֵיוָן דְּאַחְזִיק נַפְשַׁהּ בְּטוּמְאָה, לָא מָצְיָא הָדְרָה בַּהּ. אוֹ דִילְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּאָמְרָה שׁוֹתָה אֲנִי — גַּלִּיָא דַּעְתַּהּ דְּמֵחֲמַת בִּיעֲתוּתָא הוּא דְּאָמְרָה. תֵּיקוּ.
sentences.human_translation: A dilemma was raised before she said: I will not drink, while in a state of health, and she retracted and said: I will drink, what is when she said: I will not drink, she said: I am defiled, and since she established herself as defiled she cannot retract Or perhaps when she said: I will drink, she revealed her thoughts that it due to fear that she said shall stand
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Yehuda said: "I have said that I am not worthy of the greatness of the great ones, and I have said that I am worthy — what is the meaning of this? For when I say that I am not worthy — it is as if I am saying that I am worthy, and when I am worthy — it is as if I am saying that I am not worthy. Or perhaps when I say that I am worthy — it is as if I am saying that I am not worthy, and when I am not worthy — it is as if I am saying that I am worthy. What is the meaning of this? — I am saying that I am worthy, and the one who says that he is worthy — he is worthy, and the one who says that he is not worthy — he is not worthy.

sentences.text: אָמַר אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: צָרִיךְ שֶׁיִּתֵּן מַר לְתוֹךְ הַמַּיִם. מַאי טַעְמָא — דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״מֵי הַמָּרִים״, שֶׁמָּרִים כְּבָר.

sentences.text: אִם יֵשׁ לָהּ זְכוּת — הָיְתָה תּוֹלָה לָהּ. יֵשׁ זְכוּת תּוֹלָה שָׁנָה אַחַת, יֵשׁ זְכוּת תּוֹלָה שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים, יֵשׁ זְכוּת תּוֹלָה שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים. מִכָּאן אוֹמֵר בֶּן עַזַּאי: חַיָּיב אָדָם לְלַמֵּד אֶת בִּתּוֹ תּוֹרָה, שֶׁאִם תִּשְׁתֶּה תֵּדַע שֶׁהַזְּכוּת תּוֹלָה לָהּ. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַמְלַמֵּד בִּתּוֹ תּוֹרָה — (כְּאִילּוּ) לוֹמְּדָהּ תִּפְלוּת.
sentences.human_translation: If she has merit, it delays for her There is a merit delays one year, there is merit delays two years, there is a merit delays three years. From here Ben Azzai states: A person is obligated to teach his daughter Torah, that if she drinks she will know that merit delayed for her. Rabbi Eliezer says: Anyone who teaches his daughter Torah is teaching her promiscuity [ tiflut ].
sentences.llm_translation: If there is a woman who has the quality — she should have been devoted to her. A woman's quality, devotion, one year, two years, three years. From this it is said in the words of Ben Azai: The son of Adam was commanded to teach his daughter Torah, if she were to learn the knowledge that the quality, devotion, belongs to her. Rabbi Eliezer says: Whoever studies Torah in his own home — (as if) he is studying her Talmud.

sentences.text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: רוֹצָה אִשָּׁה בְּקַב וְתִפְלוּת, מִתִּשְׁעָה קַבִּין וּפְרִישׁוּת. הוּא הָיָה אוֹמֵר: חָסִיד שׁוֹטֶה, וְרָשָׁע עָרוּם, וְאִשָּׁה פְּרוּשָׁה, וּמַכּוֹת פְּרוּשִׁין — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: A woman desires to a kav and a sexual relationship [ tiflut ] than nine kav and abstinence. He would say: A foolish man of piety, and a conniving wicked person, and an abstinent woman [ perusha ], and those who injure abstinence; these are who erode the world.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: One who seeks a wife in a state of impurity, from the act of impurity, and separation, is considered to have committed a transgression. He who says: "A hardened heart, a slothful spirit, a woman who is proud, and the garments of the proud — these are the ones who are liable to be punished." — He is the one who says this.

sentences.text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: כְּשֶׁהָיִיתִי לָמֵד תּוֹרָה אֵצֶל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הָיִיתִי מֵטִיל קַנְקַנְתּוֹם לְתוֹךְ הַדְּיוֹ, וְלֹא אָמַר לִי דָּבָר. כְּשֶׁבָּאתִי אֵצֶל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אָמַר לִי: בְּנִי מָה מְלַאכְתֶּךָ? אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: לַבְלָר אֲנִי. אָמַר לִי: בְּנִי, הֱוֵי זָהִיר, שֶׁמְּלַאכְתְּךָ מְלֶאכֶת שָׁמַיִם הִיא, שֶׁמָּא תַּחְסִיר אוֹת אַחַת אוֹ תֹּתִיר אוֹת אַחַת, נִמְצֵאתָ אַתָּה מַחְרִיב אֶת כָּל הָעוֹלָם כֻּלּוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says in the name of Rabbi Meir: When I was studying Torah before Rabbi Akiva, I used to put iron sulfate into the ink and he did not say anything to me when I came before Rabbi Yishmael, he said to me: My son, what is your vocation? I said to him: I am a scribe [ lavlar ] He said to me: My son, be careful as your work is the work of Heaven, lest you omit a single letter or add a single letter, you are found to be destroying the entire world
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Yehuda said: Shmuel said: Rabbi Meir said: As I was studying the Torah with Rabbi Akiva, I became accustomed to the manner of speaking of the latter, and he would say to me: "Speak." As I was with Rabbi Yishmael, he said to me: "Son, what is the meaning of your words?" I said to him: "To the left." He said to me: "Son, be a deceiver, for if you speak of the left, you will be speaking of the right, and if you speak of the right, you will be speaking of the left." I said to him: "Son, be a deceiver, for if you speak of the left, you will be speaking of the right, and if you speak of the right, you will be speaking of the left." Biblical quote: "Speak" (דָּבָר) is a quote from the verse: "Speak unto him, and he shall speak unto thee" (Exodus 4:14).

sentences.text: אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: דָּבָר אֶחָד יֵשׁ לִי שֶׁאֲנִי מֵטִיל לְתוֹךְ הַדְּיוֹ, וְקַנְקַנְתּוֹם שְׁמוֹ. אָמַר לִי: וְכִי מְטִילִין קַנְקַנְתּוֹם לְתוֹךְ הַדְּיוֹ? הַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה ״וּמָחָה״, כְּתָב שֶׁיּוּכַל לִמְחוֹת!
sentences.human_translation: I said to I have one substance that I put into the ink, and it is called iron sulfate, He said to me: And may iron sulfate be put into the ink? The Torah said and he shall blot writing that can be blotted out.
sentences.llm_translation: I said to him: One thing I have found for myself, that I am not permitted to take from him, and to give to others, for the sake of his i.e. the Torah's greatness. He said to me: How can one take from him, for the sake of his greatness? The Torah said: "Woe to him who transgresses" i.e. who transgresses the Torah's commandments, as if he were capable of transgressing i.e. as if he were a transgressor!

sentences.llm_translation: Rav Pappa said: The one who says to the student: "As long as I am alive, I will not teach you Torah," is acting like a slave to the will of Rechel — to the will of the Torah, but not to the will of the commandment, for it is written: "You shall not muzzle the ox in its time of rest." — How can one be a slave to the will of the commandment, when one is commanded to do a thing, and it is not in one's power to do it?

sentences.text: דְּתַנְיָא: אִם יֵשׁ לָהּ זְכוּת תּוֹלָה לָהּ שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, כְּדֵי הַכָּרַת הָעוּבָּר, דִּבְרֵי אַבָּא יוֹסֵי בֶּן חָנָן. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן יִצְחָק אִישׁ כְּפַר דָּרוֹם אוֹמֵר: תִּשְׁעָה חֳדָשִׁים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנִקְּתָה וְנִזְרְעָה זָרַע״, וּלְהַלָּן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״זֶרַע יַעַבְדֶנּוּ יְסֻפַּר״, זֶרַע הָרָאוּי לְסַפֵּר.

sentences.llm_translation: Rabbis: If there is a woman who has not yet reached the age of three years, as the law of the gentiles, according to the words of Abba Yose ben Chanin. Rabbi Elazar ben Yitzchak son of Yitzchak Ish son of Parah says: The sin of new-borns, as it is said: "You shall not profane the seed, nor sow it, nor let it be sown", and the one who says: "The seed is sown in the wilderness", is considered a sin. The seed of the nations to be sown.
