Would I had died in your place, O Absalom, my son, my son” “And the king covered his face, and the king cried with a loud voice: O my son Absalom, O Absalom, my son, my son” Why these eight “my son” Seven which he raised him up from the seven chambers of Gehenna. And the other, some say that brought head close to body, and some say that brought to the World-to-Come.

sentences.llm_translation: R. Avishai said: If one takes a vow to God, and binds himself to it in his lifetime, what is the meaning of "to take a vow"? R. Reish Lakish said: One who takes a vow is taking a vow of evil for himself. "The one who binds himself to the covenant of the king and his princes," said Rabbi Chanina bar Papa: A person who binds himself to the will of his master, to his will, to his law, The Talmud text is written in a style that is typical of the Talmud, with a mix of Aramaic and Hebrew phrases. The translation is word-for-word, without any commentary or explanations. The transliteration of names and technical terms is preserved, and quotes from Biblical verses are translated.

text: וְשׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם, וּכְנוּסָה. אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא נִטְמֵאתִי, וְאִם נִטְמֵאתִי — יָבוֹאוּ בִּי.
רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא נִטְמֵאתִי, אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא אֶטָּמֵא.
הַכֹּל שָׁוִין שֶׁאֵין מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ, לֹא עַל קוֹדֶם שֶׁתִּתְאָרֵס וְלֹא עַל אַחַר שֶׁתִּתְגָּרֵשׁ.
נִסְתְּרָה לְאֶחָד וְנִטְמֵאת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ הֶחְזִירָה — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ.
זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל שֶׁתִּבָּעֵל וְלֹא הָיְתָה אֲסוּרָה לוֹ — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ.
גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁזִּינְּתָה — אֲסוּרָה לִיבָמָהּ. מִמַּאי — מִדְּקָתָנֵי שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם וּכְנוּסָה.

אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא אֲסִירָה — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי מַתְנֵה בַּהֲדַהּ, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לָא אֲסִירָה — הֵיכִי מַתְנֵה בַּהֲדַהּ? וְהָתְנַן, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁאִילּוּ תִּיבָּעֵל וְלֹא תְּהֵא אֲסוּרָה לוֹ — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ!
אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא: לֵית הִילְכְתָא כְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא.
אֶלָּא הָא דְּקָתָנֵי ״שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם וּכְנוּסָה״ — הָא מַנִּי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין קִידּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין, וּמְשַׁוֵּי לַהּ כִּי עֶרְוָה.
בָּעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: מַהוּ שֶׁיַּתְנֶה אָדָם עַל נִישּׂוּאִין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, עַל נִישּׂוּאֵי אָחִיו, מַהוּ?
תָּא שְׁמַע, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁתִּיבָּעֵל וְלֹא תְּהֵא אֲסוּרָה לוֹ — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ. הָא אֲסִירָה — הָכִי נָמֵי דְּמַתְנֶה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.

רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא נִטְמֵאתִי וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא: לֹא כְּשֶׁאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא אֶטָּמֵא שֶׁאִם תִּטָּמֵא מַיִם בּוֹדְקִין אוֹתָהּ מֵעַכְשָׁיו, אֶלָּא: לִכְשֶׁתִּטָּמֵא — מַיִם מְעַרְעֲרִין אוֹתָהּ וּבוֹדְקִין אוֹתָהּ.
בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: מַהוּ שֶׁיַּתְנֶה אָדָם עַל נִישּׂוּאִין הָאַחֲרוֹנִים? הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא לָא אֲסִירָה לֵיהּ, אוֹ דִילְמָא זִימְנִין דִּמְגָרֵשׁ לַהּ וַהֲדַר מַהְדַּר לַהּ?

תָּא שְׁמַע: הַכֹּל שָׁוִין שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ לֹא עַל קוֹדֶם שֶׁתִּתְאָרֵס, וְלֹא עַל אַחַר שֶׁתִּתְגָּרֵשׁ. נִסְתְּרָה לְאֶחָד וְנִטְמֵאת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ יַחְזִירֶנָּה — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה. הָא יַחְזִירֶנָּה וְתִיטָּמֵא, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּמַתְנֵי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הַקְּנָאֹת״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה.

רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״זֹאת״, שֶׁאֵין הָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה וְהֵעִיד לְפָנֵינוּ נְחוּנְיָא חוֹפֵר שִׁיחִין שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה, וְקִיבַּלְנוּ עֵדוּתוֹ בִּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים, אֲבָל לֹא בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד.
וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין הָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה, בֵּין בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד בֵּין בִּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים.
וְתַנָּא קַמָּא נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב ״זֹאת״! וְרַבָּנַן בָּתְרָאֵי נָמֵי, הָא כְתִיב ״תּוֹרַת״!
אָמַר רָבָא: בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד וּבוֹעֵל אֶחָד — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּאֵין הָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה,

If you say in the name of Shlomo — that the Mishnah has taught in the Haggadah, that if I say to her — I would not have taught her — how is one to teach in the Haggadah? And the one who teaches, what is the general principle: if all that is said to be done and not done, is forbidden to him — he would not have taught it to her!

Rabbi Meir of Emesa says: A person who is not ashamed to be called a heretic is not worthy of life. Talmid: Not as he said, Rabbi Meir, that a heretic is not worthy of life, unless one is ashamed of his heretical teachings, or of his heretical actions, or of his heretical character. Rather, if one is ashamed of the heretical teachings, or of the heretical actions, or of the heretical character — it is heretical teachings, or heretical actions, or heretical character — that is the one who is ashamed.

sentences.text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַכֹּל שָׁוִין שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ לֹא עַל קוֹדֶם שֶׁתִּתְאָרֵס, וְלֹא עַל אַחַר שֶׁתִּתְגָּרֵשׁ. נִסְתְּרָה לְאֶחָד וְנִטְמֵאת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ יַחְזִירֶנָּה — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה. הָא יַחְזִירֶנָּה וְתִיטָּמֵא, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּמַתְנֵי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
sentences.human_translation: Come hear All agree that he may stipulate with her neither with regard to before becoming betrothed nor with regard to after she becomes divorced secluded herself and became defiled, and afterward took her back he may not stipulate But he remarries her and she becomes defiled, he may indeed stipulate conclude from
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbis: All that is said in the name of the future, which is not to be done, is not to be done, even if it is not written in the Torah, nor is it written in the Prophets, nor is it written in the Writings. It is hidden from one person and is not to be revealed, and after that it is revealed — to the one who is worthy, and to the one who is not worthy. — It is not written in the Torah. The one who reveals it and is worthy, is he not like the one who is worthy of the future? — What is the meaning of the future? — It is hidden.

sentences.text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הַקְּנָאֹת״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה.
sentences.human_translation: The Sages taught: “This is the law of jealousy” teaches that the woman drinks and repeats,
sentences.llm_translation: Rabban: "This is the way of the prophets", the one who has learned the Torah of the prophets, the Torah of the women and the Torah of the sons.

sentences.text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״זֹאת״, שֶׁאֵין הָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה וְהֵעִיד לְפָנֵינוּ נְחוּנְיָא חוֹפֵר שִׁיחִין שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה, וְקִיבַּלְנוּ עֵדוּתוֹ בִּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים, אֲבָל לֹא בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: “this” that the woman does not drink and repeat. Rabbi Yehuda said: an incident Neḥunya the ditch digger testified before us that the woman drinks and repeats, and we accepted his testimony with regard to two men, but not with regard to one man.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Judah said: "This," which is the woman's beauty and voice. Rabbi Juda said: "Let us make and behold before us a statue of a copper idol, which is the woman's beauty and voice, and let us take his testimony in the presence of two men, but not in the presence of one man.

sentences.text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין הָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה, בֵּין בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד בֵּין בִּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים.
sentences.human_translation: And the Rabbis say: The woman does not drink and repeat, whether with regard to one man or with regard to two men.
sentences.llm_translation: And the sages say: A woman is not permitted to be alone with a man, whether with one man or with two men. sentences.text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב ״זֹאת״! וְרַבָּנַן בָּתְרָאֵי נָמֵי, הָא כְתִיב ״תּוֹרַת״!
sentences.human_translation: But the first tanna as well, isn’t it written “This,” And the Rabbis later as well, isn’t it written: “The law of
sentences.llm_translation: And Rav Nachman, said: "This!" And Rav Bathraei Nachman, said: "The way of the Torah!"

sentences.text: אָמַר רָבָא: בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד וּבוֹעֵל אֶחָד — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּאֵין הָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה,
sentences.human_translation: Rava said: With regard to one husband one paramour, everyone agrees that the woman does not drink and repeat,
sentences.llm_translation: Rav said: In one man and with one woman — the sages of the house of Shammai say: the woman is not responsible for the sin, and the man is not responsible for the sin, Talmudic text: וּבְּאִישׁ אֶחָד וּבְּעֵלָא נְשָׁׁה — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּאֵין הָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה, English translation: And in one man and with one woman — the sages of the house of Hillel say: the woman is not responsible for the sin, and the man is not responsible for the sin, Talmudic text: רְבִּי יְהוָדָן: דְּאֵין כְּשְׁפָּתָם, דְּאֵין כְּשְׁפָּתָם, English translation: Rabbi Yehudan: They are not responsible for their actions, they are not responsible for their actions, Talmudic text: רְבִּי יְהוָדָן: דְּאֵין כְּשְׁפָּתָם, דְּאֵין כְּשְׁפָּתָם, English translation: Rabbi Yehudan: They are not responsible for their actions, they are not responsible for their actions, Talmudic text: רְבִּי יְהוָ

text: אוֹמֵר בֶּן עַזַּאי: חַיָּיב אָדָם לְלַמֵּד אֶת וְכוּ׳. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַמְלַמֵּד אֶת בִּתּוֹ תּוֹרָה — מְלַמְּדָהּ תִּיפְלוּת. תִּיפְלוּת סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כְּאִילּוּ לִמְּדָהּ תִּיפְלוּת.
אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֲנִי חׇכְמָה שָׁכַנְתִּי עׇרְמָה״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּכְנְסָה חׇכְמָה בְּאָדָם — נִכְנְסָה עִמּוֹ עַרְמוּמִית.

וְרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״אֲנִי חׇכְמָה״ מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אֵין דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה מִתְקַיְּימִין אֶלָּא בְּמִי שֶׁמַּעֲמִיד עַצְמוֹ עָרוֹם עֲלֵיהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֲנִי חׇכְמָה שָׁכַנְתִּי עׇרְמָה״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה מִתְקַיְּימִין אֶלָּא בְּמִי שֶׁמֵּשִׂים עַצְמוֹ כְּמִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהַחׇכְמָה מֵאַיִן תִּמָּצֵא״.
רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: רוֹצָה אִשָּׁה וְכוּ׳. מַאי קָאָמַר? הָכִי קָאָמַר: רוֹצָה אִשָּׁה בְּקַב וְתִיפְלוּת עִמּוֹ, מִתִּשְׁעַת קַבִּין וּפְרִישׁוּת.
הוּא הָיָה אוֹמֵר: חָסִיד שׁוֹטֶה כּוּ׳. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי חָסִיד שׁוֹטֶה? כְּגוֹן דְּקָא טָבְעָה אִיתְּתָא בְּנַהֲרָא, וְאָמַר: לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְאִיסְתַּכּוֹלֵי בַּהּ וְאַצּוֹלַהּ.

הֵיכִי דָּמֵי רָשָׁע עָרוּם? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זֶה הַמַּטְעִים דְּבָרָיו לַדַּיָּין קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּבֹא בַּעַל דִּין חֲבֵרוֹ. רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אוֹמֵר: זֶה הַנּוֹתֵן דִּינָר לְעָנִי לְהַשְׁלִים לוֹ מָאתַיִם זוּז. דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מָאתַיִם זוּז — לֹא יִטּוֹל לֶקֶט שִׁכְחָה וּפֵאָה וּמַעְשַׂר עָנִי. הָיָה לוֹ מָאתַיִם חָסֵר דִּינָר, אֲפִילּוּ אֶלֶף נוֹתְנִין לוֹ כְּאַחַת — הֲרֵי זֶה יִטּוֹל.

רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זֶה הַמַּשִּׂיא עֵצָה לִמְכּוֹר בִּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִין. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: יְתוֹמִים שֶׁקָּדְמוּ וּמָכְרוּ בִּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִין — מַה שֶּׁמָּכְרוּ מָכְרוּ.

אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: זֶה הַמַּשִּׂיא עֵצָה לִמְכּוֹר בִּנְכָסִים כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. דְּתַנְיָא: ״נְכָסַי לְךָ, וְאַחֲרֶיךָ לִפְלוֹנִי״, וְיָרַד הָרִאשׁוֹן וּמָכַר וְאָכַל — הַשֵּׁנִי מוֹצִיא מִיַּד הַלָּקוֹחוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵין לַשֵּׁנִי אֶלָּא מַה שֶּׁשִּׁיֵּיר רִאשׁוֹן.
רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר חָמָא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: זֶה הַמַּכְרִיעַ אֲחֵרִים בְּאוֹרְחוֹתָיו. רַבִּי זְרִיקָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: זֶה הַמֵּיקֵל לְעַצְמוֹ וּמַחְמִיר לַאֲחֵרִים. עוּלָּא אָמַר: זֶה
שֶׁקָּרָא וְשָׁנָה וְלֹא שִׁימֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים.

אִתְּמַר: קָרָא וְשָׁנָה וְלֹא שִׁימֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה עַם הָאָרֶץ. רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: הֲרֵי זֶה בּוּר. רַבִּי יַנַּאי אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה כּוּתִי.

רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה מָגוֹשׁ. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּרַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב, דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רָטֵין מָגוֹשָׁא וְלָא יָדַע מַאי אָמַר, תָּנֵי תַּנָּא וְלָא יָדַע מַאי אָמַר.

תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ עַם הָאָרֶץ? כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע שַׁחֲרִית וְעַרְבִית בְּבִרְכוֹתֶיהָ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַנִּיחַ תְּפִילִּין. בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ צִיצִית בְּבִגְדוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן יוֹסֵף אָמַר: כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים וְאֵינוֹ מְגַדְּלָן לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה. אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: אֲפִילּוּ קוֹרֵא וְשׁוֹנֶה וְלֹא שִׁימֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים — זֶהוּ עַם הָאָרֶץ.
קָרָא וְלֹא שָׁנָה — הֲרֵי זֶה בּוּר, לֹא קָרָא וְלֹא שָׁנָה — עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וְזָרַעְתִּי אֶת בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֶת בֵּית יְהוּדָה זֶרַע אָדָם וְזֶרַע בְּהֵמָה״.

״יְרָא אֶת ה׳ בְּנִי וָמֶלֶךְ עִם שׁוֹנִים אַל תִּתְעָרָב״, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אֵלּוּ שֶׁשּׁוֹנִים הֲלָכוֹת. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא — שׁוֹנִין בְּחֵטְא, וְכִדְרַב הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָבַר אָדָם עֲבֵירָה וְשָׁנָה בָּהּ — הוּתְּרָה לוֹ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.

תָּנָא: הַתַּנָּאִים — מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם. מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אָמַר רָבִינָא: שֶׁמּוֹרִין הֲלָכָה מִתּוֹךְ מִשְׁנָתָן. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: וְכִי מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם הֵן? וַהֲלֹא מְיַישְּׁבֵי עוֹלָם הֵן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲלִיכוֹת עוֹלָם לוֹ״! אֶלָּא, שֶׁמּוֹרִין הֲלָכָה מִתּוֹךְ מִשְׁנָתָן.
אִשָּׁה פְּרוּשָׁה וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּתוּלָה צַלְיָינִית, וְאַלְמָנָה שׁוֹבָבִית, וְקָטָן שֶׁלֹּא כָּלוּ לוֹ חֳדָשָׁיו — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם.

אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָמַדְנוּ יִרְאַת חֵטְא מִבְּתוּלָה, וְקִיבּוּל שָׂכָר מֵאַלְמָנָה. יִרְאַת חֵטְא מִבְּתוּלָה — דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שַׁמְעַהּ לְהַהִיא בְּתוּלָה דְּנָפְלָה אַאַפַּהּ וְקָאָמְרָה: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, בָּרָאתָ גַּן עֵדֶן וּבָרָאתָ גֵּיהִנָּם, בָּרָאתָ צַדִּיקִים וּבָרָאתָ רְשָׁעִים. יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ שֶׁלֹּא יִכָּשְׁלוּ בִּי בְּנֵי אָדָם.

קִיבּוּל שָׂכָר מֵאַלְמָנָה — דְּהָהִיא אַלְמָנָה דַּהֲוַאי בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא בְּשִׁיבָבוּתַהּ. כׇּל יוֹמָא הֲוָת אָתְיָא וּמְצַלָּה בֵּי מִדְרְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. אֲמַר לַהּ: בִּתִּי, לֹא בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת בְּשִׁיבָבוּתִיךְ? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: רַבִּי, וְלֹא שְׂכַר פְּסִיעוֹת יֵשׁ לִי?
כִּי קָאָמַר, כְּגוֹן יוֹחָנִי בַּת רְטִיבִי.
מַאי ״קָטָן שֶׁלֹּא כָּלוּ לוֹ חֳדָשָׁיו״? הָכָא תַּרְגִּימוּ: זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הַמְבַעֵט בְּרַבּוֹתָיו.

רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר: זֶה תַּלְמִיד שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה וּמוֹרֶה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים הִפִּילָה וַעֲצוּמִים כׇּל הֲרוּגֶיהָ״. ״כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים הִפִּילָה״ — זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה וּמוֹרֶה. ״וַעֲצוּמִים כׇּל הֲרוּגֶיהָ״ — זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה וְאֵינוֹ מוֹרֶה.
human_translation: ben Azzai states: A person is obligated to teach Rabbi Eliezer says: Anyone who teaches his daughter Torah is teaching her promiscuity. enter your mind promiscuity? Rather, say: as if he taught her promiscuity.
Rabbi Abbahu says: What is the reason for Rabbi Eliezer’s as it is written: “I, wisdom, dwell with cunning” once wisdom enters into a person, cunning enters with it.

And the Rabbis what do they do with this “I, wisdom, He requires that for that which Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, as Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: The matters of Torah do not endure except in one who stands naked for them, as it is stated: “I, wisdom, dwell with nakedness [ orma ]” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The matters of Torah do not endure except in one who considers himself as one who does not as it is stated: “But wisdom, it can be found in nothingness”
Rabbi Yehoshua says: A woman desires What is he saying? This is what is saying: A woman desires to a kav and with it a sexual relationship, than nine kav and abstinence,
He, would say: A foolish man of piety, Who is considered a foolish man of piety? For example, that a woman is drowning in a river, and he says: not proper conduct to look at her and save her.

Who is considered a conniving wicked person? Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This is one who presents his statement to the judge before the other litigant comes Rabbi Abbahu says: This one who gives a dinar to a poor man to complete two hundred dinars for him, as we learned One who has two hundred dinars may not collect gleanings, forgotten pe’a , and poor man’s tithe, he has two hundred less dinar, even he is given one thousand at once, he may collect.

Rabbi Asi Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one who provides advice to sell from the small quantity of property as Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: orphans who preemptively sold from a small estate, that which they sold, they sold,

Abaye says: is one who provides advice to sell property in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, as it is taught My property to you, and after you to so-and-so, and the first entered and sold and consumed the second repossesses from the purchasers, this is the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The second only that which the first left,
Rav Yosef bar Ḥama Rav Sheshet says: one who persuades others with his ways, Rabbi Zerika Rav Huna says: one who is lenient for himself and strict for others. Ulla says: This
who read and learned but did not serve Torah scholars
It was stated: read and learned but did not serve Torah scholars, Rabbi Elazar says: This is an ignoramus. Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said: This is a boor. Rabbi Yannai says: This is a Samaritan,

Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov says: This is a sorcerer [ magosh ], Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: It is reasonable to Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov, as people say The sorcerer chants and does not know what he is saying; the tanna teaches and does not know what he is saying.

The Sages taught: Who is an ignoramus [ am ha’aretz ]? anyone who does not recite Shema morning and evening with its blessings; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: anyone who does not don phylacteries. Ben Azzai says: anyone who does not have ritual fringes on his garment. Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef said: anyone who has sons and does not raise them to study Torah. Aḥerim say: Even if one reads and learns but does not serve Torah scholars, he is an ignoramus.

read but did not learn he is a boor. With regard to did not read and did not learn the verse states: and I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man, and with the seed of beast”

“My son, fear the Lord and the king; and meddle not with those who are repeating” Rabbi Yitzḥak says: These are who repeatedly learn halakhot Isn’t obvious? lest you say repeatedly sins, and in accordance with Rav Huna, as Rav Huna says: Once a person committed a transgression and repeated it, it became permitted for him. teaches us

It was taught The tanna’im , are who erode the world. Could enter your mind who erode the world? Ravina says: who issue halakhic rulings based their mishnayot . This is also taught Rabbi Yehoshua said: Are they who erode the world? Aren’t they settling the world, as it is stated: “His ways [ halikhot ] are eternal” Rather, who issue halakhic rulings based their mishnayot .
an abstinent woman The Sages taught: A maiden who prays and a neighborly [ shovavit ] widow and a child whose months were not completed, these are who erode the world.

Is that so? But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: We learned fear of sin from a maiden, and receiving reward from a widow. fear of sin from a maiden, as Rabbi Yoḥanan heard a certain maiden who fell on her face and she was saying: Master of the Universe, You created the Garden of Eden and You created Gehenna, You created righteous and You created wicked. May it be Your will that men shall not stumble because of me

receiving reward from a widow, as a certain widow in whose neighborhood there was a synagogue, every day she went and prayed in the study hall of Rabbi Yoḥanan. said to her: My daughter, not a synagogue in your neighborhood? She said to him: My teacher, don’t I attain a reward the steps
When it is stated for example, Yoḥani bat Retivi,
What a child whose months were not completed? Here, they interpreted this Torah scholar who scorns his teachers.

Rabbi Abba says: This is a student who has not attained to issue rulings, and he issues rulings as Rabbi Abbahu says Rav Huna says Rav says: What which is written: “For she has cast down many wounded; and a mighty host are all her slain” “For she has cast down [ hippila ] many wounded”; this a Torah scholar who has not attained to issue rulings, and he issues rulings. “And a mighty host [ ve’atzumim ] are all her slain”; this a Torah scholar who has attained to issue rulings, but does not issue rulings
llm_translation: Rav Huna says: A certain man was punished for teaching Torah to his son. Rabbi Eliezer says: Whoever teaches Torah to his son — it is a transgression of the Torah. Is it not a transgression of the Torah to teach Torah? Rav says: As if to teach Torah is a transgression of the Torah.

Rabbi Avahu said: What is the meaning of the words of Rabbi Eliezer, who said: "I am a wise man, I have been sitting in the dust" (Proverbs 22:1), when he was led astray by wisdom in Adam — he was led astray by him with his arm.

Rav, the one who said: "My servant to whom I will show mercy? My servant whom I will choose?" My master Yose ben Huna: "There is no saying of Torah from those who are not worthy to speak of it, except to those who are worthy to speak of it, for it is said: 'I have chosen you, I have taken you from the loam, I have raised you up on them.' " Said Rav Yohanan: "There is no saying of Torah from those who are not worthy to speak of it, except to those who are worthy to speak of it, for it is said: 'And the righteous shall not be put to death, but the wicked shall be punished.' "

Rabbi Yehoshua says: One should not marry a woman who is a slave. R. Yehoshua said: One should not marry a slave-girl in the act of cohabitation and with the consent of her master, from the Torah's decree to separate and divorce.

R. Yochanan said: A potter who breaks a vessel is as one who has committed a grave sin. How is the measure of a potter who breaks a vessel? Like the case of Rav Huna who said: To whom shall I send my reproof? To the inhabitants of the house, and to the slaves of the house.

How much is the value of a wicked person? Said Rabbi Yochanan: This is the measure of the words of his speech to his fellow man, from the moment he is liable to be punished for his actions. Rabbi Avahu says: This is the one who is liable for the punishment of the innocent, to be beaten with a rod and to be punished with lashes. Tanna: If he has a right to be beaten with a rod and lashes — he should not be allowed to be beaten with a stick, with a whip, and with a punishment of exile. There was a case where he had a right to be beaten with a rod, but the punishment was not carried out — he is not liable. Rabbi Yochanan: If he had a right to be beaten with a rod, but the punishment was not carried out — he is liable.

Rabbi Asi said, Rabbi Yochanan: This is the decree of the sages to prohibit the taking of loans from those who are poor and needy. Said Rabbi Asi, Rabbi Yochanan said: Those who have become accustomed to taking loans from those who are needy — they are the ones who are guilty of the sin of usury.

Abaye said: This is the one who is seduced by the desire to appropriate property for himself, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. Rav said: "You have taken from him, and after you, to Phoenicia," and the great and powerful and cunning one, Yardenharash, and Machar, and Achil — I am the one who removes the hand of the law, according to the words of the Rabbis. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: "I am not to the one who is the first to be rich.

Rav Yosef bar Chama said: Rav Sheshet: This is the one who is a stranger in the ways of his master. Rav Zeira said: Rav Huna: This is the one who is a hypocrite to his master and a miser to the other people. Ula said: This is the one who is a hypocrite to his master and a miser to the other people.
"The study of the Torah, the study of the Mishnah, and the study of the Talmud of the Sages."
Rabbis Eliezer and Shmuel bar Nachman say: This is the one from the land. Rabbis Shmuel bar Nachman and Yanai say: This is the one who is a butcher.

Rav Ashi bar Yehudah said: The one who is guilty is guilty. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: The one who is guilty is like Rav Ashi bar Yehudah, the one who is innocent is like the one who is innocent. My students said: The one who is guilty is guilty and the one who is innocent is innocent, and the one who is ignorant is ignorant, and the one who knows is aware, and the one who is aware is aware, and the one who is not aware is not aware.

Rabban: What are the nations of the earth? All who are our accusers, accusers of our shame, and slanderers of our deeds, according to the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: All who are our accusers. The son of Azai says: All who do not have a beard in their presence. Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosaf says: All who have sons and we are not bound by the law to their mode. The heretics say: If one is a accuser, slanderer, and a false accuser of the sages — these are the nations of the earth.

R. Sherira bar Avin, says: "I have sown the house of Israel and the house of Judah, seed of Adam and seed of those who are among them.". Talmudic text: רְבּוֹא, — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָ

Rabbi Yitzchak said: Those who are with the wicked and the rulers of the wicked — do not mix with them! Rava said: Those are the wicked ones, the ones who are in sin, the ones who are in transgression. Rava! What is the meaning of this — that the wicked are in sin, and the wicked are in transgression? Said Rava: When Adam sinned and transgressed in the Garden — he was punished, and it is said: "Let him who sinned in the flesh, bear the punishment in the flesh." — Let him who sinned in the flesh, bear the punishment in the flesh.

Talmudic text: The Mishnah — from the House of Ulla. From the House of Ulla, did you not learn that?! Said Ravina: From which place do you derive the prohibition of the Torah from the Torah?! The baraita of Rav Nachman, said Rav Yehoshua: And from the House of Ulla, how?! And from the House of Ulla, who?! For it is said: "The houses of Ulla and Rav Nachman are cut off from the Torah!" Therefore, from the Torah itself, one derives the prohibition of the Torah from the Torah.

A woman who is not in her marriage, and who is not in her husband's household — let those who are in such a situation be considered as if they were in a state of olam ha-ba — for it is written: "You shall not covet your neighbor's house, nor his bondervant, nor his ox, nor his ass, nor anything that is your neighbor's." (Exodus 22:21)

R. Yochanan: What is the study of the prohibition of idolatry? And what is the collection of the money of the idol? R. Yochanan said: We have learned that the study of the prohibition of idolatry is to listen to the voice of the idol, to be ashamed of it, to be afraid of it, and to say: "Do not take it upon yourself to do so, for it is the voice of the idol, the voice of the idol, the voice of the idol."
Rabbah bar Chanina said: "Son, is there a house of the treasury in your house?" Rabbah said to him: "Master, and is there a storehouse for your possessions?"

For it is said, as Yochanan ben Serafim said, "As one who is blind from birth." R. Yehudah said: What is the meaning of the verse: "He who has not been tested by the fire of his own wealth" (Proverbs 17:3)? R. Yehudah said: This is the saying of the wise one who has been tested by the trials of his own possessions.

Rabbi Abba said: This is the teaching of one who has not reached the level of the Torah and the Prophets. Rabbi Avahu said: Rabbi Honai said: Rabbi: What is the meaning of the verse: "For the righteous there is life, and the good are the ones who have been punished, and the wicked are the ones who have been punished"? "For the righteous there is life" — this is the teaching of a simpleton who has not reached the level of the Torah and the Prophets. "And the good are the ones who have been punished" — this is the teaching of a simpleton who has reached the level of the Torah and the Prophets, and we are the ones who are being taught. Talmudic text: רַבִּי יְהוָדָן: רַבִּי יְהוָדָן אָמַר: זֶה תַּלְמִיד שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה. דְּאָמַר: רַבִּי יְהוָדָן: רַב: כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים. ״כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים. ״ — זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם. רַב: כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים. ״כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים. \� English translation: Rabbi Yehudan: Rabbi Yehudan said: This is the teaching of one who has reached

sentences.text: אוֹמֵר בֶּן עַזַּאי: חַיָּיב אָדָם לְלַמֵּד אֶת וְכוּ׳. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַמְלַמֵּד אֶת בִּתּוֹ תּוֹרָה — מְלַמְּדָהּ תִּיפְלוּת. תִּיפְלוּת סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כְּאִילּוּ לִמְּדָהּ תִּיפְלוּת.

sentences.llm_translation: Rav Huna says: A certain man was punished for teaching Torah to his son. Rabbi Eliezer says: Whoever teaches Torah to his son — it is a transgression of the Torah. Is it not a transgression of the Torah to teach Torah? Rav says: As if to teach Torah is a transgression of the Torah.

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֲנִי חׇכְמָה שָׁכַנְתִּי עׇרְמָה״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּכְנְסָה חׇכְמָה בְּאָדָם — נִכְנְסָה עִמּוֹ עַרְמוּמִית.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: What is the reason for Rabbi Eliezer’s as it is written: “I, wisdom, dwell with cunning” once wisdom enters into a person, cunning enters with it.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: What is the meaning of the words of Rabbi Eliezer, who said: "I am a wise man, I have been sitting in the dust" (Proverbs 22:1), when he was led astray by wisdom in Adam — he was led astray by him with his arm.

sentences.text: וְרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״אֲנִי חׇכְמָה״ מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אֵין דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה מִתְקַיְּימִין אֶלָּא בְּמִי שֶׁמַּעֲמִיד עַצְמוֹ עָרוֹם עֲלֵיהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֲנִי חׇכְמָה שָׁכַנְתִּי עׇרְמָה״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה מִתְקַיְּימִין אֶלָּא בְּמִי שֶׁמֵּשִׂים עַצְמוֹ כְּמִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהַחׇכְמָה מֵאַיִן תִּמָּצֵא״.
sentences.human_translation: And the Rabbis what do they do with this “I, wisdom, He requires that for that which Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, as Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: The matters of Torah do not endure except in one who stands naked for them, as it is stated: “I, wisdom, dwell with nakedness [ orma ]” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The matters of Torah do not endure except in one who considers himself as one who does not as it is stated: “But wisdom, it can be found in nothingness”
sentences.llm_translation: Rav, the one who said: "My servant to whom I will show mercy? My servant whom I will choose?" My master Yose ben Huna: "There is no saying of Torah from those who are not worthy to speak of it, except to those who are worthy to speak of it, for it is said: 'I have chosen you, I have taken you from the loam, I have raised you up on them.' " Said Rav Yohanan: "There is no saying of Torah from those who are not worthy to speak of it, except to those who are worthy to speak of it, for it is said: 'And the righteous shall not be put to death, but the wicked shall be punished.' "

sentences.text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: רוֹצָה אִשָּׁה וְכוּ׳. מַאי קָאָמַר? הָכִי קָאָמַר: רוֹצָה אִשָּׁה בְּקַב וְתִיפְלוּת עִמּוֹ, מִתִּשְׁעַת קַבִּין וּפְרִישׁוּת.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: A woman desires What is he saying? This is what is saying: A woman desires to a kav and with it a sexual relationship, than nine kav and abstinence,
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: One should not marry a woman who is a slave. R. Yehoshua said: One should not marry a slave-girl in the act of cohabitation and with the consent of her master, from the Torah's decree to separate and divorce.

sentences.text: הוּא הָיָה אוֹמֵר: חָסִיד שׁוֹטֶה כּוּ׳. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי חָסִיד שׁוֹטֶה? כְּגוֹן דְּקָא טָבְעָה אִיתְּתָא בְּנַהֲרָא, וְאָמַר: לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְאִיסְתַּכּוֹלֵי בַּהּ וְאַצּוֹלַהּ.
sentences.human_translation: He, would say: A foolish man of piety, Who is considered a foolish man of piety? For example, that a woman is drowning in a river, and he says: not proper conduct to look at her and save her.
sentences.llm_translation: R. Yochanan said: A potter who breaks a vessel is as one who has committed a grave sin. How is the measure of a potter who breaks a vessel? Like the case of Rav Huna who said: To whom shall I send my reproof? To the inhabitants of the house, and to the slaves of the house.

sentences.text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי רָשָׁע עָרוּם? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זֶה הַמַּטְעִים דְּבָרָיו לַדַּיָּין קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּבֹא בַּעַל דִּין חֲבֵרוֹ. רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אוֹמֵר: זֶה הַנּוֹתֵן דִּינָר לְעָנִי לְהַשְׁלִים לוֹ מָאתַיִם זוּז. דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מָאתַיִם זוּז — לֹא יִטּוֹל לֶקֶט שִׁכְחָה וּפֵאָה וּמַעְשַׂר עָנִי. הָיָה לוֹ מָאתַיִם חָסֵר דִּינָר, אֲפִילּוּ אֶלֶף נוֹתְנִין לוֹ כְּאַחַת — הֲרֵי זֶה יִטּוֹל.
sentences.human_translation: Who is considered a conniving wicked person? Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This is one who presents his statement to the judge before the other litigant comes Rabbi Abbahu says: This one who gives a dinar to a poor man to complete two hundred dinars for him, as we learned One who has two hundred dinars may not collect gleanings, forgotten pe’a , and poor man’s tithe, he has two hundred less dinar, even he is given one thousand at once, he may collect.
sentences.llm_translation: How much is the value of a wicked person? Said Rabbi Yochanan: This is the measure of the words of his speech to his fellow man, from the moment he is liable to be punished for his actions. Rabbi Avahu says: This is the one who is liable for the punishment of the innocent, to be beaten with a rod and to be punished with lashes. Tanna: If he has a right to be beaten with a rod and lashes — he should not be allowed to be beaten with a stick, with a whip, and with a punishment of exile. There was a case where he had a right to be beaten with a rod, but the punishment was not carried out — he is not liable. Rabbi Yochanan: If he had a right to be beaten with a rod, but the punishment was not carried out — he is liable.

sentences.text: רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זֶה הַמַּשִּׂיא עֵצָה לִמְכּוֹר בִּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִין. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: יְתוֹמִים שֶׁקָּדְמוּ וּמָכְרוּ בִּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִין — מַה שֶּׁמָּכְרוּ מָכְרוּ.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Asi Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one who provides advice to sell from the small quantity of property as Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: orphans who preemptively sold from a small estate, that which they sold, they sold,
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Asi said, Rabbi Yochanan: This is the decree of the sages to prohibit the taking of loans from those who are poor and needy. Said Rabbi Asi, Rabbi Yochanan said: Those who have become accustomed to taking loans from those who are needy — they are the ones who are guilty of the sin of usury.

sentences.text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: זֶה הַמַּשִּׂיא עֵצָה לִמְכּוֹר בִּנְכָסִים כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. דְּתַנְיָא: ״נְכָסַי לְךָ, וְאַחֲרֶיךָ לִפְלוֹנִי״, וְיָרַד הָרִאשׁוֹן וּמָכַר וְאָכַל — הַשֵּׁנִי מוֹצִיא מִיַּד הַלָּקוֹחוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵין לַשֵּׁנִי אֶלָּא מַה שֶּׁשִּׁיֵּיר רִאשׁוֹן.
sentences.human_translation: Abaye says: is one who provides advice to sell property in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, as it is taught My property to you, and after you to so-and-so, and the first entered and sold and consumed the second repossesses from the purchasers, this is the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The second only that which the first left,
sentences.llm_translation: Abaye said: This is the one who is seduced by the desire to appropriate property for himself, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. Rav said: "You have taken from him, and after you, to Phoenicia," and the great and powerful and cunning one, Yardenharash, and Machar, and Achil — I am the one who removes the hand of the law, according to the words of the Rabbis. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: "I am not to the one who is the first to be rich.

sentences.text: רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר חָמָא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: זֶה הַמַּכְרִיעַ אֲחֵרִים בְּאוֹרְחוֹתָיו. רַבִּי זְרִיקָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: זֶה הַמֵּיקֵל לְעַצְמוֹ וּמַחְמִיר לַאֲחֵרִים. עוּלָּא אָמַר: זֶה
sentences.human_translation: Rav Yosef bar Ḥama Rav Sheshet says: one who persuades others with his ways, Rabbi Zerika Rav Huna says: one who is lenient for himself and strict for others. Ulla says: This
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Yosef bar Chama said: Rav Sheshet: This is the one who is a stranger in the ways of his master. Rav Zeira said: Rav Huna: This is the one who is a hypocrite to his master and a miser to the other people. Ula said: This is the one who is a hypocrite to his master and a miser to the other people.

sentences.text: שֶׁקָּרָא וְשָׁנָה וְלֹא שִׁימֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים.
sentences.human_translation: who read and learned but did not serve Torah scholars
sentences.llm_translation: "The study of the Torah, the study of the Mishnah, and the study of the Talmud of the Sages."

sentences.text: אִתְּמַר: קָרָא וְשָׁנָה וְלֹא שִׁימֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה עַם הָאָרֶץ. רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: הֲרֵי זֶה בּוּר. רַבִּי יַנַּאי אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה כּוּתִי.
sentences.human_translation: It was stated: read and learned but did not serve Torah scholars, Rabbi Elazar says: This is an ignoramus. Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said: This is a boor. Rabbi Yannai says: This is a Samaritan,
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbis Eliezer and Shmuel bar Nachman say: This is the one from the land. Rabbis Shmuel bar Nachman and Yanai say: This is the one who is a butcher.

sentences.text: רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה מָגוֹשׁ. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּרַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב, דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רָטֵין מָגוֹשָׁא וְלָא יָדַע מַאי אָמַר, תָּנֵי תַּנָּא וְלָא יָדַע מַאי אָמַר.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov says: This is a sorcerer [ magosh ], Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: It is reasonable to Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov, as people say The sorcerer chants and does not know what he is saying; the tanna teaches and does not know what he is saying.
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Ashi bar Yehudah said: The one who is guilty is guilty. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: The one who is guilty is like Rav Ashi bar Yehudah, the one who is innocent is like the one who is innocent. My students said: The one who is guilty is guilty and the one who is innocent is innocent, and the one who is ignorant is ignorant, and the one who knows is aware, and the one who is aware is aware, and the one who is not aware is not aware.

sentences.text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ עַם הָאָרֶץ? כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע שַׁחֲרִית וְעַרְבִית בְּבִרְכוֹתֶיהָ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַנִּיחַ תְּפִילִּין. בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ צִיצִית בְּבִגְדוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן יוֹסֵף אָמַר: כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים וְאֵינוֹ מְגַדְּלָן לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה. אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: אֲפִילּוּ קוֹרֵא וְשׁוֹנֶה וְלֹא שִׁימֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים — זֶהוּ עַם הָאָרֶץ.
sentences.human_translation: The Sages taught: Who is an ignoramus [ am ha’aretz ]? anyone who does not recite Shema morning and evening with its blessings; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: anyone who does not don phylacteries. Ben Azzai says: anyone who does not have ritual fringes on his garment. Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef said: anyone who has sons and does not raise them to study Torah. Aḥerim say: Even if one reads and learns but does not serve Torah scholars, he is an ignoramus.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabban: What are the nations of the earth? All who are our accusers, accusers of our shame, and slanderers of our deeds, according to the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: All who are our accusers. The son of Azai says: All who do not have a beard in their presence. Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosaf says: All who have sons and we are not bound by the law to their mode. The heretics say: If one is a accuser, slanderer, and a false accuser of the sages — these are the nations of the earth.

sentences.text: קָרָא וְלֹא שָׁנָה — הֲרֵי זֶה בּוּר, לֹא קָרָא וְלֹא שָׁנָה — עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וְזָרַעְתִּי אֶת בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֶת בֵּית יְהוּדָה זֶרַע אָדָם וְזֶרַע בְּהֵמָה״.
sentences.human_translation: read but did not learn he is a boor. With regard to did not read and did not learn the verse states: and I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man, and with the seed of beast”
sentences.llm_translation: R. Sherira bar Avin, says: "I have sown the house of Israel and the house of Judah, seed of Adam and seed of those who are among them.". Talmudic text: רְבּוֹא, — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָּא) — (ר. שִׁנָ

sentences.text: ״יְרָא אֶת ה׳ בְּנִי וָמֶלֶךְ עִם שׁוֹנִים אַל תִּתְעָרָב״, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אֵלּוּ שֶׁשּׁוֹנִים הֲלָכוֹת. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא — שׁוֹנִין בְּחֵטְא, וְכִדְרַב הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָבַר אָדָם עֲבֵירָה וְשָׁנָה בָּהּ — הוּתְּרָה לוֹ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
sentences.human_translation: “My son, fear the Lord and the king; and meddle not with those who are repeating” Rabbi Yitzḥak says: These are who repeatedly learn halakhot Isn’t obvious? lest you say repeatedly sins, and in accordance with Rav Huna, as Rav Huna says: Once a person committed a transgression and repeated it, it became permitted for him. teaches us
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: Those who are with the wicked and the rulers of the wicked — do not mix with them! Rava said: Those are the wicked ones, the ones who are in sin, the ones who are in transgression. Rava! What is the meaning of this — that the wicked are in sin, and the wicked are in transgression? Said Rava: When Adam sinned and transgressed in the Garden — he was punished, and it is said: "Let him who sinned in the flesh, bear the punishment in the flesh." — Let him who sinned in the flesh, bear the punishment in the flesh.

sentences.text: תָּנָא: הַתַּנָּאִים — מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם. מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אָמַר רָבִינָא: שֶׁמּוֹרִין הֲלָכָה מִתּוֹךְ מִשְׁנָתָן. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: וְכִי מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם הֵן? וַהֲלֹא מְיַישְּׁבֵי עוֹלָם הֵן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲלִיכוֹת עוֹלָם לוֹ״! אֶלָּא, שֶׁמּוֹרִין הֲלָכָה מִתּוֹךְ מִשְׁנָתָן.
sentences.human_translation: It was taught The tanna’im , are who erode the world. Could enter your mind who erode the world? Ravina says: who issue halakhic rulings based their mishnayot . This is also taught Rabbi Yehoshua said: Are they who erode the world? Aren’t they settling the world, as it is stated: “His ways [ halikhot ] are eternal” Rather, who issue halakhic rulings based their mishnayot .
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: The Mishnah — from the House of Ulla. From the House of Ulla, did you not learn that?! Said Ravina: From which place do you derive the prohibition of the Torah from the Torah?! The baraita of Rav Nachman, said Rav Yehoshua: And from the House of Ulla, how?! And from the House of Ulla, who?! For it is said: "The houses of Ulla and Rav Nachman are cut off from the Torah!" Therefore, from the Torah itself, one derives the prohibition of the Torah from the Torah.

sentences.text: אִשָּׁה פְּרוּשָׁה וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּתוּלָה צַלְיָינִית, וְאַלְמָנָה שׁוֹבָבִית, וְקָטָן שֶׁלֹּא כָּלוּ לוֹ חֳדָשָׁיו — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם.
sentences.human_translation: an abstinent woman The Sages taught: A maiden who prays and a neighborly [ shovavit ] widow and a child whose months were not completed, these are who erode the world.
sentences.llm_translation: A woman who is not in her marriage, and who is not in her husband's household — let those who are in such a situation be considered as if they were in a state of olam ha-ba — for it is written: "You shall not covet your neighbor's house, nor his bondervant, nor his ox, nor his ass, nor anything that is your neighbor's." (Exodus 22:21)

sentences.text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָמַדְנוּ יִרְאַת חֵטְא מִבְּתוּלָה, וְקִיבּוּל שָׂכָר מֵאַלְמָנָה. יִרְאַת חֵטְא מִבְּתוּלָה — דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שַׁמְעַהּ לְהַהִיא בְּתוּלָה דְּנָפְלָה אַאַפַּהּ וְקָאָמְרָה: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, בָּרָאתָ גַּן עֵדֶן וּבָרָאתָ גֵּיהִנָּם, בָּרָאתָ צַדִּיקִים וּבָרָאתָ רְשָׁעִים. יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ שֶׁלֹּא יִכָּשְׁלוּ בִּי בְּנֵי אָדָם.
sentences.human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: We learned fear of sin from a maiden, and receiving reward from a widow. fear of sin from a maiden, as Rabbi Yoḥanan heard a certain maiden who fell on her face and she was saying: Master of the Universe, You created the Garden of Eden and You created Gehenna, You created righteous and You created wicked. May it be Your will that men shall not stumble because of me
sentences.llm_translation: R. Yochanan: What is the study of the prohibition of idolatry? And what is the collection of the money of the idol? R. Yochanan said: We have learned that the study of the prohibition of idolatry is to listen to the voice of the idol, to be ashamed of it, to be afraid of it, and to say: "Do not take it upon yourself to do so, for it is the voice of the idol, the voice of the idol, the voice of the idol."

sentences.text: קִיבּוּל שָׂכָר מֵאַלְמָנָה — דְּהָהִיא אַלְמָנָה דַּהֲוַאי בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא בְּשִׁיבָבוּתַהּ. כׇּל יוֹמָא הֲוָת אָתְיָא וּמְצַלָּה בֵּי מִדְרְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. אֲמַר לַהּ: בִּתִּי, לֹא בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת בְּשִׁיבָבוּתִיךְ? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: רַבִּי, וְלֹא שְׂכַר פְּסִיעוֹת יֵשׁ לִי?
sentences.human_translation: receiving reward from a widow, as a certain widow in whose neighborhood there was a synagogue, every day she went and prayed in the study hall of Rabbi Yoḥanan. said to her: My daughter, not a synagogue in your neighborhood? She said to him: My teacher, don’t I attain a reward the steps
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbah bar Chanina said: "Son, is there a house of the treasury in your house?" Rabbah said to him: "Master, and is there a storehouse for your possessions?"

sentences.text: כִּי קָאָמַר, כְּגוֹן יוֹחָנִי בַּת רְטִיבִי.
sentences.human_translation: When it is stated for example, Yoḥani bat Retivi,
sentences.llm_translation: For it is said, as Yochanan ben Serafim said, "As one who is blind from birth." sentences.text: מַאי ״קָטָן שֶׁלֹּא כָּלוּ לוֹ חֳדָשָׁיו״? הָכָא תַּרְגִּימוּ: זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הַמְבַעֵט בְּרַבּוֹתָיו.
sentences.human_translation: What a child whose months were not completed? Here, they interpreted this Torah scholar who scorns his teachers.
sentences.llm_translation: R. Yehudah said: What is the meaning of the verse: "He who has not been tested by the fire of his own wealth" (Proverbs 17:3)? R. Yehudah said: This is the saying of the wise one who has been tested by the trials of his own possessions.

sentences.text: רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר: זֶה תַּלְמִיד שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה וּמוֹרֶה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים הִפִּילָה וַעֲצוּמִים כׇּל הֲרוּגֶיהָ״. ״כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים הִפִּילָה״ — זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה וּמוֹרֶה. ״וַעֲצוּמִים כׇּל הֲרוּגֶיהָ״ — זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה וְאֵינוֹ מוֹרֶה.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Abba says: This is a student who has not attained to issue rulings, and he issues rulings as Rabbi Abbahu says Rav Huna says Rav says: What which is written: “For she has cast down many wounded; and a mighty host are all her slain” “For she has cast down [ hippila ] many wounded”; this a Torah scholar who has not attained to issue rulings, and he issues rulings. “And a mighty host [ ve’atzumim ] are all her slain”; this a Torah scholar who has attained to issue rulings, but does not issue rulings
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said: This is the teaching of one who has not reached the level of the Torah and the Prophets. Rabbi Avahu said: Rabbi Honai said: Rabbi: What is the meaning of the verse: "For the righteous there is life, and the good are the ones who have been punished, and the wicked are the ones who have been punished"? "For the righteous there is life" — this is the teaching of a simpleton who has not reached the level of the Torah and the Prophets. "And the good are the ones who have been punished" — this is the teaching of a simpleton who has reached the level of the Torah and the Prophets, and we are the ones who are being taught. Talmudic text: רַבִּי יְהוָדָן: רַבִּי יְהוָדָן אָמַר: זֶה תַּלְמִיד שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה. דְּאָמַר: רַבִּי יְהוָדָן: רַב: כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים. ״כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים. ״ — זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם. רַב: כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים. ״כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים. \� English translation: Rabbi Yehudan: Rabbi Yehudan said: This is the teaching of one who has reached

text: אֲגַם, כְּדִכְתִיב: ״קָנֶה וָסוּף קָמֵלוּ״.

״וַתֵּרֶד בַּת פַּרְעֹה לִרְחוֹץ עַל הַיְאֹר״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁיָּרְדָה לִרְחוֹץ מִגִּלּוּלֵי [בֵּית] אָבִיהָ, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אִם רָחַץ ה׳ אֵת צוֹאַת בְּנוֹת צִיּוֹן וְגוֹ׳״.
״וְנַעֲרֹתֶיהָ הוֹלְכוֹת וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין הֲלִיכָה זוֹ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן מִיתָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״הִנֵּה אָנֹכִי הוֹלֵךְ לָמוּת״.

״וַתֵּרֶא אֶת הַתֵּיבָה בְּתוֹךְ הַסּוּף״, כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזוֹ דְּקָא בָעוּ לְאַצּוֹלֵי לְמֹשֶׁה, אָמְרוּ לָהּ: גְּבִירְתֵּנוּ, מִנְהָגוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם מֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וָדָם גּוֹזֵר גְּזֵירָה, אִם כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ אֵין מְקַיְּימִין אוֹתָהּ — בָּנָיו וּבְנֵי בֵיתוֹ מְקַיְּימִין אוֹתָהּ, וְאַתְּ עוֹבֶרֶת עַל גְּזֵירַת אָבִיךְ? בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וַחֲבָטָן בַּקַּרְקַע.

״וַתִּשְׁלַח אֶת אֲמָתָהּ וַתִּקָּחֶהָ״. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, חַד אָמַר: יָדָהּ, וְחַד אָמַר: שִׁפְחָתָהּ. מַאן דְּאָמַר יָדָהּ — דִּכְתִיב ״אַמָּתָהּ״. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר שִׁפְחָתָהּ — מִדְּלָא כְּתִיב ״יָדָהּ״.
וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר שִׁפְחָתָהּ, הָא אָמְרַתְּ בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וַחֲבָטָן בַּקַּרְקַע! דְּשַׁיַּיר לַהּ חֲדָא, דְּלָאו אוֹרְחַהּ דְּבַת מַלְכָּא לְמֵיקַם לְחוֹדַהּ.

וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר יָדָהּ, לִיכְתּוֹב ״יָדָהּ״! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאִישְׁתַּרְבַּב אִישְׁתַּרְבּוֹבֵי. דְּאָמַר מָר: וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בְּאַמָּתָהּ שֶׁל בַּת פַּרְעֹה, וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בְּשִׁינֵּי רְשָׁעִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״שִׁנֵּי רְשָׁעִים שִׁבַּרְתָּ״, וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״שִׁבַּרְתָּ״, אֶלָּא ״שֶׁרִיבַּבְתָּה״.
״וַתִּפְתַּח וַתִּרְאֵהוּ אֶת הַיֶּלֶד״. ״וַתֵּרֶא״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שֶׁרָאֲתָה שְׁכִינָה עִמּוֹ.

״וְהִנֵּה נַעַר בֹּכֶה״. קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״יֶלֶד״, וְקָרֵי לֵיהּ ״נַעַר״. תָּנָא: הוּא יֶלֶד וְקוֹלוֹ כְּנַעַר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה: אִם כֵּן, עֲשִׂיתוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ בַּעַל מוּם. אֶלָּא, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעָשְׂתָה לוֹ אִמּוֹ חוּפַּת נְעוּרִים בַּתֵּיבָה, אָמְרָה: שֶׁמָּא לֹא אֶזְכֶּה לְחוּפָּתוֹ.
״וַתַּחְמֹל עָלָיו וַתֹּאמֶר מִיַּלְדֵי הָעִבְרִים זֶה״. מְנָא יָדְעָה? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שֶׁרָאֲתָה אוֹתוֹ מָהוּל.
״זֶה״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁנִּתְנַבְּאָה שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתָּהּ — זֶה נוֹפֵל, וְאֵין אַחֵר נוֹפֵל.

וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכִי יֹאמְרוּ אֲלֵיכֶם דִּרְשׁוּ אֶל הָאֹבוֹת וְאֶל הַיִּדְּעֹנִים הַמְצַפְצְפִים וְהַמַּהְגִּים״: צוֹפִין וְאֵינָם יוֹדְעִין מָה צוֹפִין, מְהַגִּים וְאֵינָן יוֹדְעִים מָה מְהַגִּים.

רָאוּ שֶׁמּוֹשִׁיעָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמַּיִם הוּא לוֹקֶה, עָמְדוּ וְגָזְרוּ: ״כׇּל הַבֵּן הַיִּלּוֹד הַיְאֹרָה תַּשְׁלִיכֻהוּ״. כֵּיוָן דְּשַׁדְיוּהּ לְמֹשֶׁה, אָמְרוּ: תּוּ לָא חָזֵינַן כִּי הָהוּא סִימָנָא, בַּטִּלוּ לִגְזֵירְתַּיְיהוּ. וְהֵם אֵינָן יוֹדְעִין שֶׁעַל מֵי מְרִיבָה הוּא לוֹקֶה.

וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״הֵמָּה מֵי מְרִיבָה אֲשֶׁר רָבוּ״ — הֵמָּה שֶׁרָאוּ אִיצְטַגְנִינֵי פַּרְעֹה וְטָעוּ. וְהַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר מֹשֶׁה: ״שֵׁשׁ מֵאוֹת אֶלֶף רַגְלִי וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר לָהֶן מֹשֶׁה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: בִּשְׁבִילִי נִצַּלְתֶּם כּוּלְּכֶם.

רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא אָמַר: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם עֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן הָיָה, אָמְרוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מִי שֶׁעָתִיד לוֹמַר שִׁירָה עַל הַיָּם בְּיוֹם זֶה — יִלְקֶה בְּיוֹם זֶה?

רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם שִׁשָּׁה בְּסִיוָן הָיָה, אָמְרוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מִי שֶׁעָתִיד לְקַבֵּל תּוֹרָה מֵהַר סִינַי בְּיוֹם זֶה — יִלְקֶה בְּיוֹם זֶה?

בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּשִׁשָּׁה בְּסִיוָן, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ תְּלָתָא יַרְחֵי. דְּאָמַר מָר: בְּשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר מֵת, וּבְשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר נוֹלָד מֹשֶׁה, וּמִשִּׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר וְעַד שִׁשָּׁה בְּסִיוָן תְּלָתָא יַרְחֵי. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
אוֹתָהּ שָׁנָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת הָיְתָה: רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן, וְרוּבּוֹ שֶׁל אַחֲרוֹן, וְאֶמְצָעִי שָׁלֵם.
״וַתֹּאמֶר אֲחוֹתוֹ אֶל בַּת פַּרְעֹה הַאֵלֵךְ וְקָרָאתִי לָךְ אִשָּׁה מֵינֶקֶת מִן הָעִבְרִיּוֹת״. וּמַאי שְׁנָא מֵעִבְרִיּוֹת?

מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהֶחְזִירוּהוּ לְמֹשֶׁה עַל כׇּל הַמִּצְרִיּוֹת כּוּלָּן, וְלֹא יָנַק, אָמַר: פֶּה שֶׁעָתִיד לְדַבֵּר עִם הַשְּׁכִינָה יִינַק דָּבָר טָמֵא? וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶת מִי יוֹרֶה דֵעָה וְגוֹ׳״. לְמִי יוֹרֶה דֵּעָה וּלְמִי יָבִין שְׁמוּעָה — ״לִגְמוּלֵי מֵחָלָב וּלְעַתִּיקֵי מִשָּׁדַיִם״.
״וַתֹּאמֶר לָהּ בַּת פַּרְעֹה לֵכִי וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָלְכָה בִּזְרִיזוּת כְּעַלְמָה. רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: ״הָעַלְמָה״ — שֶׁהֶעֱלִימָה אֶת דְּבָרֶיהָ.

״וַתֹּאמֶר לָהּ בַּת פַּרְעֹה הֵילִיכִי אֶת הַיֶּלֶד הַזֶּה״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִתְנַבְּאָה וְאֵינָהּ יוֹדַעַת מָה מִתְנַבְּאָה, ״הֵילִיכִי״ — הָא שֶׁלִּיכִי. ״וַאֲנִי אֶתֵּן אֶת שְׂכָרֵךְ״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לֹא דַּיָּין לַצַּדִּיקִים שֶׁמַּחְזִירִין לָהֶן אֲבֵידָתָן, אֶלָּא שֶׁנּוֹתְנִין לָהֶן שְׂכָרָן.

״וַתִּקַּח מִרְיָם הַנְּבִיאָה אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן וְגוֹ׳״. אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן וְלֹא אֲחוֹת מֹשֶׁה? אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַב: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיְתָה מִתְנַבְּאָה כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן,

וְאוֹמֶרֶת: עֲתִידָה אִמִּי שֶׁתֵּלֵד בֵּן שֶׁמּוֹשִׁיעַ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁנּוֹלַד מֹשֶׁה נִתְמַלֵּא כָּל הַבַּיִת כּוּלּוֹ אוֹר. עָמַד אָבִיהָ וּנְשָׁקָהּ עַל רֹאשָׁהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: בִּתִּי, נִתְקַיְּימָה נְבוּאָתִיךְ. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁהִטִּילוּהוּ לַיְאוֹר, עָמַד אָבִיהָ וּטְפָחָהּ עַל רֹאשָׁהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: בִּתִּי הֵיכָן נְבוּאָתִיךְ? וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתֵּתַצַּב אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵרָחוֹק לְדֵעָה מַה יֵּעָשֶׂה לוֹ״ — לֵידַע מָה יְהֵא בְּסוֹף נְבוּאָתָהּ.

יוֹסֵף זָכָה וְכוּ׳. מַאי שְׁנָא מֵעִיקָּרָא דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַל יוֹסֵף לִקְבּוֹר אֶת אָבִיו וַיַּעֲלוּ אִתּוֹ כׇּל עַבְדֵי פַּרְעֹה וְגוֹ׳״, וַהֲדַר: ״וְכֹל בֵּית יוֹסֵף וְאֶחָיו וּבֵית אָבִיו״, וּמַאי שְׁנָא לְבַסּוֹף דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּשׇׁב יוֹסֵף מִצְרַיְמָה הוּא וְאֶחָיו״, וַהֲדַר: ״וְכׇל הָעוֹלִים אִתּוֹ לִקְבּוֹר אֶת אָבִיו״?
אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בַּתְּחִילָּה עַד שֶׁלֹּא רָאוּ בִּכְבוֹדָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל — לֹא נָהֲגוּ בָּהֶן כָּבוֹד, וּלְבַסּוֹף שֶׁרָאוּ בִּכְבוֹדָן — נָהֲגוּ בָּהֶן כָּבוֹד.

דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּבֹאוּ עַד גּוֹרֶן הָאָטָד״, וְכִי גוֹרֶן יֵשׁ לוֹ לָאָטָד? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִקִּיפוּהוּ כְּתָרִים לַאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב כְּגוֹרֶן זֶה שֶׁמַּקִּיפִים לוֹ אָטָד, שֶׁבָּאוּ בְּנֵי עֵשָׂו וּבְנֵי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וּבְנֵי קְטוּרָה.

תָּנָא: כּוּלָּם לַמִּלְחָמָה בָּאוּ, כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאוּ כִּתְרוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף תָּלוּי בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב, נָטְלוּ כּוּלָּן כִּתְרֵיהֶן וּתְלָאוּם בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב. תָּנָא: שְׁלֹשִׁים וְשִׁשָּׁה כְּתָרִים נִתְלוּ בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב.
״וַיִּסְפְּדוּ שָׁם מִסְפֵּד גָּדוֹל וְכָבֵד מְאֹד״. תָּנָא: אֲפִילּוּ סוּסִים וַאֲפִילּוּ חֲמוֹרִים.

(מֵאֵילּוּ מֵאֵילּוּ) כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעוּ לִמְעָרַת הַמַּכְפֵּלָה, אֲתָא עֵשָׂו קָא מְעַכֵּב, אָמַר לָהֶן: ״מַמְרֵא קִרְיַת הָאַרְבַּע הִיא חֶבְרוֹן״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: קִרְיַת אַרְבַּע — אַרְבַּע זוּגוֹת הָיוּ: אָדָם וְחַוָּה, אַבְרָהָם וְשָׂרָה, יִצְחָק וְרִבְקָה, יַעֲקֹב וְלֵאָה. אִיהוּ קַבְרַהּ לְלֵאָה בְּדִידֵיהּ, וְהַאי דְּפָיֵישׁ — דִּידִי הוּא.

אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: זַבֵּינְתֵּהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: נְהִי דְּזַבֵּינִי בְּכֵירוּתָא, פְּשִׁיטוּתָא מִי זַבֵּינִי? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּקִבְרִי אֲשֶׁר כָּרִיתִי לִי״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק: אֵין ״כִּירָה״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן מְכִירָה, שֶׁכֵּן בִּכְרַכֵּי הַיָּם קוֹרִין לִמְכִירָה ״כִּירָה״.

אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַבוּ לִי אִיגַּרְתָּא! אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִיגַּרְתָּא בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם הִיא. וּמַאן נֵיזִיל — נֵיזִיל נַפְתָּלִי דְּקַלִּיל כִּי אַיָּילְתָּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״נַפְתָּלִי אַיָּלָה שְׁלוּחָה הַנּוֹתֵן אִמְרֵי שָׁפֶר״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״אִמְרֵי שָׁפֶר״, אֶלָּא ״אִמְרֵי סֵפֶר״.

חוּשִׁים בְּרֵיהּ דְּדָן תַּמָּן הֲוָה, וְיַקִּירָן לֵיהּ אוּדְנֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאי הַאי? וְאָמְרוּ לֵיהּ: קָא מְעַכֵּב הַאי עַד דְּאָתֵי נַפְתָּלִי מֵאַרְעָא דְּמִצְרַיִם. אֲמַר לְהוּ: וְעַד דְּאָתֵי נַפְתָּלִי מֵאַרְעָא דְּמִצְרַיִם, יְהֵא אֲבִי אַבָּא מוּטָל בְּבִזָּיוֹן? שְׁקַל קוּלְפָא מַחְיֵיהּ אַרֵישֵׁיהּ, נָתְרָן עֵינֵיהּ וּנְפַלוּ אַכַּרְעָא דְיַעֲקֹב, פַּתְחִינְהוּ יַעֲקֹב לְעֵינֵיהּ וְאַחֵיךְ. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״יִשְׂמַח צַדִּיק כִּי חָזָה נָקָם פְּעָמָיו יִרְחַץ בְּדַם הָרָשָׁע״.

בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִתְקַיְּימָה נְבוּאָתָהּ שֶׁל רִבְקָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״לָמָּה אֶשְׁכַּל גַּם שְׁנֵיכֶם יוֹם אֶחָד״. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּמִיתָתָן לֹא בְּיוֹם אֶחָד הֲוַאי — קְבוּרָתָן מִיהָא בְּיוֹם אֶחָד הֲוַאי.

וְאִי לָא [אִי]עֲסַק בֵּיהּ יוֹסֵף, אֶחָיו לָא הֲווֹ מִעַסְּקִי בֵּיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׂאוּ אוֹתוֹ בָנָיו אַרְצָה כְּנַעַן״? אָמְרוּ: הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ, כְּבוֹדוֹ בִּמְלָכִים יוֹתֵר מִבְּהֶדְיוֹטוֹת.

מִי לָנוּ גָּדוֹל מִיּוֹסֵף כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בֹּא וּרְאֵה כַּמָּה חֲבִיבוֹת מִצְוֹת עַל מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, שֶׁכׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל כּוּלָּן נִתְעַסְּקוּ בַּבִּיזָּה, וְהוּא נִתְעַסֵּק בְּמִצְוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חֲכַם לֵב יִקַּח מִצְוֹת וְגוֹ׳״.

וּמִנַּיִן הָיָה יוֹדֵעַ מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ הֵיכָן יוֹסֵף קָבוּר? אָמְרוּ: סֶרַח בַּת אָשֵׁר נִשְׁתַּיְּירָה מֵאוֹתוֹ הַדּוֹר. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה אֶצְלָהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: כְּלוּם אַתְּ יוֹדַעַת הֵיכָן יוֹסֵף קָבוּר? אָמְרָה לוֹ: אָרוֹן שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת עָשׂוּ לוֹ מִצְרִים וּקְבָעוּהוּ בְּנִילוּס הַנָּהָר, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּתְבָּרְכוּ מֵימָיו. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה וְעָמַד עַל שְׂפַת נִילוּס, אָמַר לוֹ: יוֹסֵף יוֹסֵף! הִגִּיעַ הָעֵת שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּע הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁאֲנִי גּוֹאֵל אֶתְכֶם, וְהִגִּיעָה הַשְּׁבוּעָה שֶׁהִשְׁבַּעְתָּ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. אִם אַתָּה מַרְאֶה עַצְמְךָ מוּטָב, אִם לָאו — הֲרֵי אָנוּ מְנוּקִּין מִשְּׁבוּעָתֶךָ. מִיָּד צָף אֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף.

וְאַל תִּתְמַהּ הֵיאַךְ בַּרְזֶל צָף, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּתִיב: ״וַיְהִי הָאֶחָד מַפִּיל הַקּוֹרָה וְאֶת הַבַּרְזֶל נָפַל אֶל הַמָּיִם וְגוֹ׳ אֲהָהּ אֲדוֹנִי וְהוּא שָׁאוּל. וַיֹּאמֶר אִישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים אָנָה נָפָל וַיַּרְאֵהוּ אֶת הַמָּקוֹם וַיִּקְצׇב עֵץ וַיַּשְׁלֶךְ שָׁמָּה וַיָּצֶף הַבַּרְזֶל״. וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה אֱלִישָׁע תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל אֵלִיָּהוּ, וְאֵלִיָּהוּ תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה — צָף בַּרְזֶל מִפָּנָיו, מִפְּנֵי מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.

רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: בְּקַבַּרְנִיט שֶׁל מְלָכִים הָיָה קָבוּר. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה וְעָמַד עַל קַבַּרְנִיט שֶׁל מְלָכִים, אָמַר: יוֹסֵף, הִגִּיעַ עֵת שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּע הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁאֲנִי גּוֹאֵל אֶתְכֶם, וְהִגִּיעָה שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁהִשְׁבַּעְתָּ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. אִם אַתָּה מַרְאֶה עַצְמְךָ — מוּטָב, וְאִם לָאו — הֲרֵי אָנוּ מְנוּקִּין מִשְּׁבוּעָתֶךָ. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִזְדַּעְזַע אֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף, נְטָלוֹ מֹשֶׁה, וֶהֱבִיאוֹ אֶצְלוֹ.

וְכׇל אוֹתָן שָׁנִים שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר, הָיוּ שְׁנֵי אֲרוֹנוֹת הַלָּלוּ, אֶחָד שֶׁל מֵת וְאֶחָד שֶׁל שְׁכִינָה, מְהַלְּכִין זֶה עִם זֶה, וְהָיוּ עוֹבְרִין וְשָׁבִין אוֹמְרִים: מָה טִיבָן שֶׁל שְׁנֵי אֲרוֹנוֹת הַלָּלוּ? אָמְרוּ: אֶחָד שֶׁל מֵת וְאֶחָד שֶׁל שְׁכִינָה. וְכִי מָה דַּרְכּוֹ שֶׁל מֵת לְהַלֵּךְ עִם שְׁכִינָה? אָמְרוּ:
human_translation: a marsh, as it is written: “The reeds and willows [ suf ] shall wither”

“And the daughter of Pharaoh came down to bathe [ lirḥotz ] in the river” Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: teaches that she came down to cleanse from her father’s idols, And similarly it states: “When the Lord shall have washed [ raḥatz ] away the filth of the daughters of Zion,
“And her maidens walked [ holekhot ] Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This walking nothing other terminology of death, and similarly it states: “Behold, I am going [ holekh ] to die”

“And she saw the ark among the willows” Once saw that was intending to save Moses, they said to her: Our mistress, the custom of the world a king of flesh and blood decrees a decree, if all the world does not fulfill it, his children and members of his household fulfill it, and you are violating the decree of your father. Gabriel came and beat them to the ground

“And she sent amatah to take it” Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Neḥemya One says her arm, and one says her maidservant. The one who says her arm as it is written “ amatah ,” And the one who says her maidservant because it does not write Her hand [ yadah ].
And according to the one who says her maidservant, didn’t you say Gabriel came and beat them to the ground that left her one as it is not proper that a princess should stand alone.

And according to the one who says her hand, let write Her hand [ yadah ]. This teaches us that her arm extended [ ishtarbav ] As the Master said And similarly you find with regard to the hand of Pharaoh’s daughter and similarly you find with regard to the teeth of evildoers, as it is written: “You have broken [ shibbarta ] the teeth of the wicked” and Reish Lakish said: Do not read shibbarta , rather sheribbavta ,
“And she opened it and saw it [ vatirehu ], even the child” it should have And she saw. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: she saw the Divine Presence with him.

and behold a lad [ na’ar ] that wept” calls him “a child [ yeled ],” and calls him “a lad [ na’ar ].” teaches: He is a child but his voice as a lad; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Neḥemya said to him: If so, you made Moses our teacher blemished, Rather, teaches that his mother made a canopy of youth, for him in the ark, she said: Perhaps I will not merit to his canopy.
“And she had compassion on him, and said: This [ zeh ] is one of the Hebrews’ children” From where did she know Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: As she saw he was circumcised.
“This [ zeh ] Rabbi Yoḥanan says: teaches that she prophesied unknowingly, This falls, but no other fall

And this is what Rabbi Elazar said: What is which is written: “And when they shall say to you: Seek unto the necromancers and the diviners, that chirp [ metzaftzefim ] and that mutter [ mahggim ]” They see [ tzofin ], but they do not know what they are seeing; they enunciate [ mahggim ], but they do not know what they are enunciating.

saw that the savior of the Jewish people would be stricken by water. they arose and decreed: “Every son that is born you shall cast into the river” Once cast Moses said: We no longer see like that sign they canceled their decree. But they did not know that would be stricken on account of the waters of Meribah.

And this is what Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: What is which is written: “These [ hemma ] are the waters of Meribah, where strove these are that the astrologers of Pharaoh saw and erred. And this is what Moses said: are six hundred thousand men on foot [ ragli ]; Moses said to the Jewish people: On account of me, all of you were saved,

Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa says: That day was the twenty-first of Nisan. The ministering angels said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, one who in the future will say Song at the Sea on this day be stricken on this day?

Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina says: That day was the sixth of Sivan. The ministering angels said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, one who in the future will receive Torah on Mount Sinai on this day be stricken on this day?

Granted, according to the one who says on the sixth of Sivan, you find three months as the Master said died on the seventh of Adar, and Moses was born on the seventh of Adar. And from the seventh of Adar until the sixth of Sivan three months, But according to the one who says on the twenty-first of Nisan, how can you find
That year was a leap year most of the first and most of the last and the entire middle one.
“Then said his sister to Pharaoh’s daughter: Shall I go and call you a nurse of the Hebrew women, And what is different of the Hebrew women?

teaches that they took Moses around to all the Egyptian and he did not nurse he said: a mouth that in the future speak with the Divine Presence nurse something impure? And this is as it is written: “Whom shall one teach knowledge? To whom shall teach knowledge and to whom shall make to understand the message “Them that are weaned from the milk, them that are drawn from the breasts”
“And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her: Go. Rabbi Elazar says: teaches that she went quickly like a maiden, Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says: ha’alma for she hid her words

“And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her: Take this [ heilikhi ] child away, Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: is prophesying and she does not know what she is prophesying, heilikhi This is yours [ ha shellikhi ], “And I will give you your wages.” Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: with regard to righteous people, not only that that their lost items are returned to them, but also that they get their wages,

“And Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took “the sister of Aaron,” and not the sister of Moses? Rav Amram says Rav says, and some say Rav Naḥman says Rav says: teaches that prophesied when she was the sister of Aaron,

And would say: In the future, my mother will give birth to a son who will save the Jewish people. And once Moses was born, the entire house was filled with light. Her father arose and kissed her on her head. He said to her: My daughter, your prophecy has been fulfilled. And once they put him into the river, her father arose and hit her on her head. He said to her: My daughter, where is your prophecy? And this is as it is written: “And his sister stood afar off, to know what would be done to him” to know what will be the ultimate of her prophecy.

Joseph merited What is different initially that it is written: “And Joseph went up to bury his father; and with him went up all the servants of Pharaoh, and afterward “And all the house of Joseph, and his brethren, and his father’s house; And what is different at the end that it is written: “And Joseph returned into Egypt, he, and his brethren,” and afterward “And all that went up with him to bury his father,
Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Initially, before saw the honor of the Jewish people, they did not treat them honor, And in the end, when they saw their honor, they treated honor.

As it is written: “And they came to the threshing floor of Atad, And does a boxthorn have a threshing floor? Rabbi Abbahu says: teaches that they surrounded the casket of Jacob with crowns, like this threshing floor that is surrounded with boxthorns, because the children of Esau and the children of Ishmael and the children of Keturah came

taught: they all came to war once they saw the crown of Joseph, hanging on the casket of Jacob, they all took their crowns and hung them on the casket of Jacob. taught: Thirty-six crowns were hung on the casket of Jacob.
“And there they wailed with a very great and sore wailing” taught: Even horses and even donkeys

Once they reached the Cave of Machpelah, Esau came and was preventing them He said to them: Mamre, to Kiryat Arba, the same is Hebron, And Rabbi Yitzḥak says: Kiryat Arba were four couples Adam and Eve, Abraham and Sarah, Isaac and Rebecca, Jacob and Leah. buried Leah in his and the that is remaining is mine.

said to You sold to said to them: Though I sold the birthright, did I sell an ordinary said to him: Yes, as it is written in my grave that I have dug [ kariti ] for me And Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: kira is nothing other a term of a sale [ mekhira ] because in the cities overseas they call a sale kira .

said to them: Bring the bill to me, They said to him: The bill is in the land of Egypt. And who will go Naphtali will go, for he is as fast as a doe, as it is written: “Naphtali is a doe let loose, he gives goodly words” Rabbi Abbahu says: Do not read goodly words [ imrei shafer ]”; rather, imrei sefer ,

Hushim, the son of Dan, was there and his ears were heavy, He said to them: What this And they said to him: This one, is preventing until Naphtali comes from the land of Egypt He said to them: And until Naphtali comes from the land of Egypt will father’s father lie in degradation? He took a club [ kulepa ] and hit on the head, eyes fell out and they fell on the legs of Jacob. Jacob opened his eyes and smiled. And this is that which is written: “The righteous shall rejoice when he sees the vengeance; he shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked”

At that moment the prophecy of Rebecca was fulfilled, as it is written “Why should I be bereaved of you both in one day?” And although their deaths were not on the same day, in any event their burials were on the same day,

And if Joseph would not have dealt with would his brothers not have dealt with it? But isn’t it written: “For his sons carried him into the land of Canaan, They said: Allow more honor by royalty than by common [ hedyotot ].

Who, to us, a greater than Joseph, The Sages taught Come and see how beloved mitzvot are to Moses our teacher. As, all the Jewish people were involved in the plunder and he was involved in mitzvot, as it is stated: “The wise in heart will take mitzvot”

And from where did Moses our teacher know where Joseph was buried? said: Serah, the daughter of Asher, remained from that generation Moses went to her said to her: Do you know anything where Joseph is buried? She said to him: The Egyptians fashioned a metal casket for him and set it in the Nile [ Nilus ] River so that its water would be blessed. Moses went and stood on the bank of the Nile. said to Joseph, Joseph, the time has arrived which the Holy One, Blessed be He, took an oath that I, will redeem you. And the oath that you administered to the Jewish people has arrived. If you show yourself, good, if not, we are clear from your oath. Immediately, the casket of Joseph floated

And do not wonder how iron float, as it is written “But as one was felling a beam, the ax head fell into the water; Alas, my master! For it was borrowed. And the man of God said: Where did it fall? And he showed him the place. And he cut down a stick, and cast it in there, and the iron floated up” And are matters not a fortiori : And just as Elisha, student of Elijah, and Elijah student of Moses, iron float before him, all the more so before Moses our teacher

Rabbi Natan says: was buried in the crypt [ kabbarnit ] of kings. Moses went and stood by the crypt of kings said: Joseph, the time has arrived which the Holy One, Blessed be He, took an oath that: I will redeem you. And the oath that you administered to the Jewish people has arrived. If you show yourself, good, but if not, we are clear from your oath. At that moment, the casket of Joseph shook Moses took it and brought it to himself.

And all those years that the Jewish people were in the wilderness, these two arks, one of a dead man, and one of the Divine Presence, were traveling together, and passersby would say: What is the nature of these two arks? They said One of a dead person and one of the Divine Presence. And what the manner of a dead person to travel with the Divine Presence? They said

Rabbah said: There is no one who can teach another to sin, and he who says: "Behold, I am walking in the ways of the wicked" is also teaching sin.

R. Yehuda said: When he saw the words of the Sotah in the midst of the Sotah, they said to him: "Do not stir them up, lest you be the one to bring about the downfall of the entire House of David, from King David, the wise and the wicked, for if all of them are not to be punished, neither you nor your sons, nor your sons' sons, but rather your father's father's father, and so on — in the son of your son and in the sons of your house, and so on, and so forth, and so forth — is it not to be said that you have caused the downfall of the entire House of David? In the days of the prophet Elijah, and in the days of the wicked one, Chedorlaomer, in the land of the Karakai.

Rabbis Judah and Nehemiah, said: One said: Her hand, and the other said: Her head. What did he say, that he said "her hand" — he said "her truth". And what did he say, that he said "her head" — he said "her word".

(He) said to him, "What is the matter with you, that you have come to me with such a thing?" Rav Yose ben Chanina said: What is the meaning of the verse: "You shall not covet your neighbor's house, nor his slave, nor his ox, nor his donkey, nor anything that is your neighbor's"? Is it merely to prohibit the taking of slaves, oxen, and donkeys? No, for it is written: "You shall not covet" - the entire verse is a prohibition against coveting, and the taking of slaves, oxen, and donkeys is only a part of it.
R. Yochanan said: To study that which is not from your understanding — this is a sin, and there is no other sin.

And it was said in our teaching, Rabbi Eliezer, what is the meaning of the verse: "How do you say to your brethren: 'Go and love your neighbors and your enemies, the despised and the hated ones'?" (Leviticus 19:18): Are they saying to their brethren: "Let us go and despise our neighbors and our enemies, the hated and the despised ones"? For if they say so, they are not wise, for they do not know what is good for them, and they do not know what is evil for them.

Raba said: When the 120,000 of the Israelites who were in the wilderness, stood and transgressed: "All the sons of the generation who saw the miracle, shall be put to death." Rabbah bar bar Hanna said: "To what extent shall we say that they saw the miracle, for they were the ones who were signified, in the tablets of the covenant?" And they are not aware that the miracle was done for them. And it was said in our teaching, Moshe: "Six hundred thousand, a hundred thousand every day, and a hundred thousand every year," they said to Moshe: "In the tabernacle, you have made yourselves all of you."

In the name of Rav, who said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan, "In the study of the Mishnah, in the study of the Talmud, in the study of the Sifre, in the study of the Torah, the ways of the Torah are not to be studied." Said Mar: In the study of the Mishnah, in the study of the Talmud, in the study of the Sifre, in the study of the Torah, the ways of the Torah are not to be studied. Rabbi Yohanan said: If one is in a state of sin, in a state of sin, in a state of sin, in a state of sin, the ways of the Torah are not to be studied. Said Rav: To whom did he say this? (He said) in the name of Rava and in the name of Rav Yehuda, who said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan, "How is one to be in a state of sin?"

The Mishnah teaches that one who is accustomed to speaking with the sages, and is not ashamed, says: "What is the thing that is to be said with the Holy One, Blessed be He, will be said in a manner of contempt?" And we have said: "Who is the one who is to be reckoned as having a good understanding and who is to be reckoned as having a bad understanding — " — "to the wicked of the war and to the wicked of the idolatry."
Rabbi Eliezer said: One should not study Torah in a place of desecration. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachman said: "The altar" — that which she the altar has set aside its words.

"She said to the daughter of Pharaoh: 'Let me come down and see the child.'" "Rabbi Chama in the name of Rabbi Chana: From the fact that she did not know whether to come or not, you know that 'Let me come down and see the child' — it is the one who is coming down. 'I will send my servant to speak to you' — I am the one who is sending my servant." "Rabbi Chama in the name of Rabbi Chana: It is not a matter of punishment for the wicked who are hiding from them, that they should be told to come and be punished, but rather that they should be told to come and be saved."

Rabbis, we are discussing a case where a son is obligated to support his father, who has sixty sons. And when he is obligated to support them, his father says to him: "Son, support your mother. When you support them, your father says to you: "Son, where is the place where you will support your mother?" And we have said: "If one is obligated to support his father's sons, from the perspective of the father's obligation, he is obligated to support them, but from the perspective of the father's sons' obligation, he is not obligated to support them." — Rabbi Yehuda said: "If one is obligated to support his father's sons, from the perspective of the father's obligation, he is obligated to support them, but from the perspective of the father's sons' obligation, he is not obligated to support them, because the father's obligation is not dependent on the sons' obligation, but rather the sons' obligation is dependent on the father's obligation."

Rabbah bar Chanah said: "He who is forced to serve another master than his father, and serves him with all the slaves of the field, is considered as having served his father with all the slaves of the field." And Rav said: "All the possessions of Yosafat and his household and his father's household are considered as having been served to his father." And Rabbah bar Chanah said: "Yosafat was forced to serve the king of Babylon himself and his household." And Rav said: "All the possessions of the king of Babylon and his household are considered as having been served to his father."

Rabbi Yochanan said: In the case of a woman who has not been seen in the presence of her husband — they do not punish her for the dignity of her husband, and for the sake of the honor of her husband — they do not punish her for dignity.
