Rabbis: All of them were brought to the courtyard of the house of Yosef, son of Yochanan, to be put to death, to be hanged, in the courtyard of Yochanan son of Yaqov. Rabbis: Six hundred and sixty-six spears were brought into the courtyard of Yochanan son of Yaqov.

"And they were satiated from there, satiated with the abundance of the world and the abundance of the beasts." "Rabbi Yossi said: Even oxen and donkeys." The Talmud is a central text of Rabbinic Judaism, and its study is considered a fundamental part of Jewish education. The Talmud is a compilation of written and oral teachings, including commentaries and debates, on the Torah and other Jewish texts. The Talmud is written in a style that is unique to Jewish law and tradition, and its language is often formal and complex. The Talmud is not a single book, but rather a collection of texts that were written over a period of time, and its contents are not always easy to understand. The Talmud is considered a sacred text by many Jews, and its study is often seen as a way to connect with the past and to understand the present. For those who are interested in studying the Talmud, it is recommended to approach it with caution and to seek guidance from qualified teachers or mentors.

(me'ilu m'eilu) When they reached the height of the idolatry, R. Asher b. R. Me'ir said to them: "As one who has escaped the evil of the idolatrous practices, I say to you: 'Do not be like the wickedness of the idolatrous practices,' " and Rabbi Yitzchak said: "The wickedness of idolatry — the idolatrous practices of the idol's spouse: Adam and Eve, Abraham and Sarah, Jacob and Rachel, Joseph and Asenath, and Yitzchak and Rivka." They were caught in the snare of Leah's husband, and the one who was caught — he was caught by his own wife.

R. Yehudah said: "Let them be destroyed." R. Yehudah said to them: "Is it not, that I am the one who has been wronged? Whose wronging is it? Is it mine? R. Yehudah said to them: "No, for it is said: 'I have bound a man with a bond, and he has said to me: 'I have bound myself to you,' and Rabbi Yochanan from the house of Rabbi Shmuel said: 'There is no binding' to the shoe, for since the days of the Messiah, they bind to the shoe, 'binding'."

Said R. Eleazar: Let me have Igbartha! They say to him: Igbartha in the land of the Egyptians, how is he to be released — released from the gallows of the Philistines, for it is written: "The Philistines, O my God, have encircled us round about, and the Philistines have a stronghold against us, and the Philistines have a stronghold against us, and the Philistimes have a stronghold against us." Said R. Abahu: Let not one who says "I am a Philistine" be released, for it is written: "I am a Philistine" — a word of the Torah.

They were accused of having stolen from the property of Dan, Tamnan, and Havoth. They said to them: "What is this? And they said to them: "It is the act of the one who has been exiled from the land of the Philistines, from the land of the Egyptians." They said to them: "And what is this, that the one who has been exiled from the land of the Philistines, from the land of the Egyptians, is an abomination to his father, his mother, his sons, and his daughters? Shall we not be like the sons of the one who has been exiled from the land of the Philistines, from the land of the Egyptians, and be punished with death? For it is written: "The wicked one is as a stumbling block, a snare to the righteous, to be pierced with the sword of the wicked."

R. Yehoshua ben Perahya said: "If one is forced to eat the flesh of a fellow man, even if it is a single day, what is the halakha?" And even if one is forced to carry the coffin of a fellow man on a single day — what is the halakha? — they should be buried on a single day — the halakha.

Who is there to stand guard over him? Who is there to be his master? Rabbah: Come and see how he is burdened with the commandments, our Master, for all Israel is bound by the prohibition, and he is bound by the commandments, as it is said: "The wise one takes the commandments and the Torah." (Bereshit 2:15)

And it was said in the days of Rabbi Meishem: "What is the meaning of the burial of the righteous? They say: 'The daughter of Asher was not found among the 48 tribes of the Dor.' The one who walks in the ways of the righteous, he says to her: 'Do you know the place of the burial of the righteous?' She says to him: 'Arise, O son of the matketh of the Talmud, arise, and take heed of the nations of the Hagar, as if you were to walk in the ways of your father.' The one who walks in the ways of the nations of the Hagar, he says to her: 'You are a fool!' The one who has reached the end of the way, that which I am a guide to you, and the one who has reached the end of the way, that which you have to know. 'Arise, O son of the matketh of the Talmud, arise, and take heed of the nations of the Hagar, as if you were to walk in the way of your father.' The one who walks in the ways of the nations of the Hagar, he says to her: 'You are a fool!' The one who has reached the teaching of the Torah, that which I am a guide to you, and the one who has reached the teaching of the Torah, that which you have to know. 'Arise, O son of the matketh of the Talmud, arise, and take heed of the nations of the Hagar, as if you were to walk in the way of your father.' The one who walks in the ways of the nations of the Hagar, he says to her: 'You are a fool!' The one who has reached the teaching of the Torah, that which I am a guide to you, and the one who has reached the teaching of the Torah, that which you have to know. 'Arise, O son of the matketh of the Talmud, arise, and take heed of the nations of the Hagar, as if you were to walk in the way of your father.' The one who walks in the ways of the nations of the Hagar, he says to her: 'You are a fool!' The one who has reached the teaching of the Torah, that which I am a guide to you, and the one who has reached the teaching of the Torah, that which you have to know.

And lo, do not be like him who is crushed beneath the weight of the bronze, for it is written: "And it was the first to be cast down, and the bronze fell upon the stones and the earth, and behold, the earth did not tremble, and behold, the earth did not quake." And the words are: "How is it that the wicked one is cast down, and the wicked one is cast down from the face of the Lord, and the wicked one is cast down from the face of Moses — the bronze is cast down from his face, from the face of Moses our Lord — upon one and the same thing and one and the same manner."

Rabbi Nathan says: In the case of a burial of a king, there is a burial. The one who walks in the ways of the kings, Moshe, who walked in the ways of the kings, said: Woe to you, the time of atonement has come, for the sin of the king, which is the sin of Israel. If you see your own sin — it is a mutt, and if it is not your sin — we are made from your sin. In that time the sin of Yosafat, Moshe, and the one who is brought to him, is nullified.

And when they were seventy years old, as Israelites according to the Torah, they became those who were worthy of the law, one who had died and one who had been exiled, who would walk with whom, and they would transgress and return, saying: What is the measure of those who are worthy of the law? They said: One who has died and one who has been exiled. And how is the measure of one who dies to walk with one who is exiled? They said:

sentences.text: ״וְנַעֲרֹתֶיהָ הוֹלְכוֹת וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין הֲלִיכָה זוֹ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן מִיתָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״הִנֵּה אָנֹכִי הוֹלֵךְ לָמוּת״.
sentences.human_translation: “And her maidens walked [ holekhot ] Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This walking nothing other terminology of death, and similarly it states: “Behold, I am going [ holekh ] to die”
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbah said: There is no one who can teach another to sin, and he who says: "Behold, I am walking in the ways of the wicked" is also teaching sin.

sentences.text: ״וַתֵּרֶא אֶת הַתֵּיבָה בְּתוֹךְ הַסּוּף״, כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזוֹ דְּקָא בָעוּ לְאַצּוֹלֵי לְמֹשֶׁה, אָמְרוּ לָהּ: גְּבִירְתֵּנוּ, מִנְהָגוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם מֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וָדָם גּוֹזֵר גְּזֵירָה, אִם כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ אֵין מְקַיְּימִין אוֹתָהּ — בָּנָיו וּבְנֵי בֵיתוֹ מְקַיְּימִין אוֹתָהּ, וְאַתְּ עוֹבֶרֶת עַל גְּזֵירַת אָבִיךְ? בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וַחֲבָטָן בַּקַּרְקַע.
sentences.human_translation: “And she saw the ark among the willows” Once saw that was intending to save Moses, they said to her: Our mistress, the custom of the world a king of flesh and blood decrees a decree, if all the world does not fulfill it, his children and members of his household fulfill it, and you are violating the decree of your father. Gabriel came and beat them to the ground
sentences.llm_translation: R. Yehuda said: When he saw the words of the Sotah in the midst of the Sotah, they said to him: "Do not stir them up, lest you be the one to bring about the downfall of the entire House of David, from King David, the wise and the wicked, for if all of them are not to be punished, neither you nor your sons, nor your sons' sons, but rather your father's father's father, and so on — in the son of your son and in the sons of your house, and so on, and so forth, and so forth — is it not to be said that you have caused the downfall of the entire House of David? In the days of the prophet Elijah, and in the days of the wicked one, Chedorlaomer, in the land of the Karakai.

sentences.text: ״וַתִּשְׁלַח אֶת אֲמָתָהּ וַתִּקָּחֶהָ״. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, חַד אָמַר: יָדָהּ, וְחַד אָמַר: שִׁפְחָתָהּ. מַאן דְּאָמַר יָדָהּ — דִּכְתִיב ״אַמָּתָהּ״. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר שִׁפְחָתָהּ — מִדְּלָא כְּתִיב ״יָדָהּ״.
sentences.human_translation: “And she sent amatah to take it” Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Neḥemya One says her arm, and one says her maidservant. The one who says her arm as it is written “ amatah ,” And the one who says her maidservant because it does not write Her hand [ yadah ].
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbis Judah and Nehemiah, said: One said: Her hand, and the other said: Her head. What did he say, that he said "her hand" — he said "her truth". And what did he say, that he said "her head" — he said "her word".

sentences.text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר שִׁפְחָתָהּ, הָא אָמְרַתְּ בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וַחֲבָטָן בַּקַּרְקַע! דְּשַׁיַּיר לַהּ חֲדָא, דְּלָאו אוֹרְחַהּ דְּבַת מַלְכָּא לְמֵיקַם לְחוֹדַהּ.

sentences.text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר יָדָהּ, לִיכְתּוֹב ״יָדָהּ״! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאִישְׁתַּרְבַּב אִישְׁתַּרְבּוֹבֵי. דְּאָמַר מָר: וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בְּאַמָּתָהּ שֶׁל בַּת פַּרְעֹה, וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בְּשִׁינֵּי רְשָׁעִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״שִׁנֵּי רְשָׁעִים שִׁבַּרְתָּ״, וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״שִׁבַּרְתָּ״, אֶלָּא ״שֶׁרִיבַּבְתָּה״.
sentences.human_translation: And according to the one who says her hand, let write Her hand [ yadah ]. This teaches us that her arm extended [ ishtarbav ] As the Master said And similarly you find with regard to the hand of Pharaoh’s daughter and similarly you find with regard to the teeth of evildoers, as it is written: “You have broken [ shibbarta ] the teeth of the wicked” and Reish Lakish said: Do not read shibbarta , rather sheribbavta ,
sentences.llm_translation: And when he said, "Woe to him who has transgressed his own law, to his own destruction!" - This one is saying, that the one who has transgressed the law of the master of the house, the master of the house of the master of the house. Said Mar: And how should you be like the one who has transgressed the law of the daughter of Pharaoh, and how should you be like the one who has transgressed the sins of the nations, saying: "The sins of the nations have been vanquished", and said Reish Lakish: "Do not be like those who have been vanquished", for it is said: "Those who have been vanquished are the ones who have been vanquished".

sentences.text: ״וַתִּפְתַּח וַתִּרְאֵהוּ אֶת הַיֶּלֶד״. ״וַתֵּרֶא״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שֶׁרָאֲתָה שְׁכִינָה עִמּוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: “And she opened it and saw it [ vatirehu ], even the child” it should have And she saw. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: she saw the Divine Presence with him.
sentences.llm_translation: And when you see him, behold him! From the words of Rabbi Yose ben Huna: That which is hidden with him, is not to be seen.

sentences.text: ״וְהִנֵּה נַעַר בֹּכֶה״. קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״יֶלֶד״, וְקָרֵי לֵיהּ ״נַעַר״. תָּנָא: הוּא יֶלֶד וְקוֹלוֹ כְּנַעַר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה: אִם כֵּן, עֲשִׂיתוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ בַּעַל מוּם. אֶלָּא, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעָשְׂתָה לוֹ אִמּוֹ חוּפַּת נְעוּרִים בַּתֵּיבָה, אָמְרָה: שֶׁמָּא לֹא אֶזְכֶּה לְחוּפָּתוֹ.

Rabbi Neḥemya said to him: If so, you made Moses our teacher blemished, Rather, teaches that his mother made a canopy of youth, for him in the ark, she said: Perhaps I will not merit to his canopy.

But, perhaps, one should study that which you have done for him, that you have caused him to be afflicted with the affliction of the daughters of the tribe of Dan, saying: "Let him be afflicted as the daughters of the tribe of Dan." sentences.text: ״וַתַּחְמֹל עָלָיו וַתֹּאמֶר מִיַּלְדֵי הָעִבְרִים זֶה״. מְנָא יָדְעָה? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שֶׁרָאֲתָה אוֹתוֹ מָהוּל.
sentences.human_translation: “And she had compassion on him, and said: This [ zeh ] is one of the Hebrews’ children” From where did she know Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: As she saw he was circumcised.
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Yose ben Chanina said: What is the meaning of the verse: "You shall not covet your neighbor's house, nor his slave, nor his ox, nor his donkey, nor anything that is your neighbor's"? Is it merely to prohibit the taking of slaves, oxen, and donkeys? No, for it is written: "You shall not covet" - the entire verse is a prohibition against coveting, and the taking of slaves, oxen, and donkeys is only a part of it.

sentences.text: ״זֶה״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁנִּתְנַבְּאָה שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתָּהּ — זֶה נוֹפֵל, וְאֵין אַחֵר נוֹפֵל.
sentences.human_translation: “This [ zeh ] Rabbi Yoḥanan says: teaches that she prophesied unknowingly, This falls, but no other fall
sentences.llm_translation: R. Yochanan said: To study that which is not from your understanding — this is a sin, and there is no other sin.

sentences.text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכִי יֹאמְרוּ אֲלֵיכֶם דִּרְשׁוּ אֶל הָאֹבוֹת וְאֶל הַיִּדְּעֹנִים הַמְצַפְצְפִים וְהַמַּהְגִּים״: צוֹפִין וְאֵינָם יוֹדְעִין מָה צוֹפִין, מְהַגִּים וְאֵינָן יוֹדְעִים מָה מְהַגִּים.
sentences.human_translation: And this is what Rabbi Elazar said: What is which is written: “And when they shall say to you: Seek unto the necromancers and the diviners, that chirp [ metzaftzefim ] and that mutter [ mahggim ]” They see [ tzofin ], but they do not know what they are seeing; they enunciate [ mahggim ], but they do not know what they are enunciating.
sentences.llm_translation: And it was said in our teaching, Rabbi Eliezer, what is the meaning of the verse: "How do you say to your brethren: 'Go and love your neighbors and your enemies, the despised and the hated ones'?" (Leviticus 19:18): Are they saying to their brethren: "Let us go and despise our neighbors and our enemies, the hated and the despised ones"? For if they say so, they are not wise, for they do not know what is good for them, and they do not know what is evil for them.

sentences.text: רָאוּ שֶׁמּוֹשִׁיעָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמַּיִם הוּא לוֹקֶה, עָמְדוּ וְגָזְרוּ: ״כׇּל הַבֵּן הַיִּלּוֹד הַיְאֹרָה תַּשְׁלִיכֻהוּ״. כֵּיוָן דְּשַׁדְיוּהּ לְמֹשֶׁה, אָמְרוּ: תּוּ לָא חָזֵינַן כִּי הָהוּא סִימָנָא, בַּטִּלוּ לִגְזֵירְתַּיְיהוּ. וְהֵם אֵינָן יוֹדְעִין שֶׁעַל מֵי מְרִיבָה הוּא לוֹקֶה.
sentences.human_translation: saw that the savior of the Jewish people would be stricken by water. they arose and decreed: “Every son that is born you shall cast into the river” Once cast Moses said: We no longer see like that sign they canceled their decree. But they did not know that would be stricken on account of the waters of Meribah.
sentences.llm_translation: Raba said: When the 120,000 of the Israelites who were in the wilderness, stood and transgressed: "All the sons of the generation who saw the miracle, shall be put to death." Rabbah bar bar Hanna said: "To what extent shall we say that they saw the miracle, for they were the ones who were signified, in the tablets of the covenant?" And they are not aware that the miracle was done for them. The Talmud text is from the tractate Yoma, which discusses the events of the 17th of Tammuz, the day of the 120,000 Israelites who died in the wilderness. The text is a dialogue between Rabbah bar bar Hanna and Raba, two prominent Talmudic scholars. The text is written in a style that is typical of the Talmud, with quotes from the Torah and other sources. The names and technical terms are transliterated as per the Talmud's style.

sentences.text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״הֵמָּה מֵי מְרִיבָה אֲשֶׁר רָבוּ״ — הֵמָּה שֶׁרָאוּ אִיצְטַגְנִינֵי פַּרְעֹה וְטָעוּ. וְהַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר מֹשֶׁה: ״שֵׁשׁ מֵאוֹת אֶלֶף רַגְלִי וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר לָהֶן מֹשֶׁה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: בִּשְׁבִילִי נִצַּלְתֶּם כּוּלְּכֶם.
sentences.human_translation: And this is what Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: What is which is written: “These [ hemma ] are the waters of Meribah, where strove these are that the astrologers of Pharaoh saw and erred. And this is what Moses said: are six hundred thousand men on foot [ ragli ]; Moses said to the Jewish people: On account of me, all of you were saved,
sentences.llm_translation: And it was said in our teaching, Rabbi Chana bar Rav Huna: What is the meaning of the saying "these are the ones who are from the tribe of Meribah, whose measure is not to be taken"? — They are the ones who are like the oxen and the donkeys. And it was said in our teaching, Moshe: "Six hundred thousand, a hundred thousand every day, and a hundred thousand every year," they said to Moshe: "In the tabernacle, you have made yourselves all of you."

sentences.text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא אָמַר: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם עֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן הָיָה, אָמְרוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מִי שֶׁעָתִיד לוֹמַר שִׁירָה עַל הַיָּם בְּיוֹם זֶה — יִלְקֶה בְּיוֹם זֶה?
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa says: That day was the twenty-first of Nisan. The ministering angels said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, one who in the future will say Song at the Sea on this day be stricken on this day?
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina bar Papa said: On that day there were one hundred and one in the land of the idolatrous nations, saying to the leaders of the service before the law, in their own words: "Let us take the idol of our lord, the one who is worthy of our praise, and let us bring it to him on that day — will he not take it in that day?

sentences.text: רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם שִׁשָּׁה בְּסִיוָן הָיָה, אָמְרוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מִי שֶׁעָתִיד לְקַבֵּל תּוֹרָה מֵהַר סִינַי בְּיוֹם זֶה — יִלְקֶה בְּיוֹם זֶה?

sentences.text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּשִׁשָּׁה בְּסִיוָן, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ תְּלָתָא יַרְחֵי. דְּאָמַר מָר: בְּשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר מֵת, וּבְשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר נוֹלָד מֹשֶׁה, וּמִשִּׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר וְעַד שִׁשָּׁה בְּסִיוָן תְּלָתָא יַרְחֵי. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
sentences.human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says on the sixth of Sivan, you find three months as the Master said died on the seventh of Adar, and Moses was born on the seventh of Adar. And from the seventh of Adar until the sixth of Sivan three months, But according to the one who says on the twenty-first of Nisan, how can you find
sentences.llm_translation: In the name of Rav, who said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan, "In the study of the Mishnah, in the study of the Talmud, in the study of the Sifre, in the study of the Torah, the ways of the Torah are not to be studied." Said Mar: In the study of the Mishnah, in the study of the Talmud, in the study of the Sifre, in the study of the Torah, the ways of the Torah are not to be studied. Rabbi Yohanan said: If one is in a state of sin, in a state of sin, in a state of sin, in a state of sin, the ways of the Torah are not to be studied. Said Rav: To whom did he say this? (He said) in the name of Rava and in the name of Rav Yehuda, who said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan, "How is one to be in a state of sin?"

sentences.text: אוֹתָהּ שָׁנָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת הָיְתָה: רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן, וְרוּבּוֹ שֶׁל אַחֲרוֹן, וְאֶמְצָעִי שָׁלֵם.
sentences.human_translation: That year was a leap year most of the first and most of the last and the entire middle one.
sentences.llm_translation: But one who has transgressed the prohibition of the first commandment, and has transgressed the prohibition of the latter commandment, and has also transgressed the prohibition of the third commandment, is guilty.

sentences.text: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהֶחְזִירוּהוּ לְמֹשֶׁה עַל כׇּל הַמִּצְרִיּוֹת כּוּלָּן, וְלֹא יָנַק, אָמַר: פֶּה שֶׁעָתִיד לְדַבֵּר עִם הַשְּׁכִינָה יִינַק דָּבָר טָמֵא? וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶת מִי יוֹרֶה דֵעָה וְגוֹ׳״. לְמִי יוֹרֶה דֵּעָה וּלְמִי יָבִין שְׁמוּעָה — ״לִגְמוּלֵי מֵחָלָב וּלְעַתִּיקֵי מִשָּׁדַיִם״.
sentences.human_translation: teaches that they took Moses around to all the Egyptian and he did not nurse he said: a mouth that in the future speak with the Divine Presence nurse something impure? And this is as it is written: “Whom shall one teach knowledge? To whom shall teach knowledge and to whom shall make to understand the message “Them that are weaned from the milk, them that are drawn from the breasts”
sentences.llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches that one who is accustomed to speaking with the sages, and is not ashamed, says: "What is the thing that is to be said with the Holy One, Blessed be He, will be said in a manner of contempt?" And we have said: "Who is the one who is to be reckoned as having a good understanding and who is to be reckoned as having a bad understanding — " — "to the wicked of the war and to the wicked of the idolatry."

sentences.text: ״וַתֹּאמֶר לָהּ בַּת פַּרְעֹה לֵכִי וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָלְכָה בִּזְרִיזוּת כְּעַלְמָה. רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: ״הָעַלְמָה״ — שֶׁהֶעֱלִימָה אֶת דְּבָרֶיהָ.
sentences.human_translation: “And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her: Go. Rabbi Elazar says: teaches that she went quickly like a maiden, Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says: ha’alma for she hid her words
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: One should not study Torah in a place of desecration. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachman said: "The altar" — that which she the altar has set aside its words.

sentences.text: ״וַתֹּאמֶר לָהּ בַּת פַּרְעֹה הֵילִיכִי אֶת הַיֶּלֶד הַזֶּה״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִתְנַבְּאָה וְאֵינָהּ יוֹדַעַת מָה מִתְנַבְּאָה, ״הֵילִיכִי״ — הָא שֶׁלִּיכִי. ״וַאֲנִי אֶתֵּן אֶת שְׂכָרֵךְ״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לֹא דַּיָּין לַצַּדִּיקִים שֶׁמַּחְזִירִין לָהֶן אֲבֵידָתָן, אֶלָּא שֶׁנּוֹתְנִין לָהֶן שְׂכָרָן.
sentences.human_translation: “And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her: Take this [ heilikhi ] child away, Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: is prophesying and she does not know what she is prophesying, heilikhi This is yours [ ha shellikhi ], “And I will give you your wages.” Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: with regard to righteous people, not only that that their lost items are returned to them, but also that they get their wages,
sentences.llm_translation: "She said to the daughter of Pharaoh: 'Let me come down and see the child.'" "Rabbi Chama in the name of Rabbi Chana: From the fact that she did not know whether to come or not, you know that 'Let me come down and see the child' — it is the one who is coming down. 'I will send my servant to speak to you' — I am the one who is sending my servant." "Rabbi Chama in the name of Rabbi Chana: It is not a matter of punishment for the wicked who are hiding from them, that they should be told to come and be punished, but rather that they should be told to come and be saved."

sentences.text: ״וַתִּקַּח מִרְיָם הַנְּבִיאָה אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן וְגוֹ׳״. אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן וְלֹא אֲחוֹת מֹשֶׁה? אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַב: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיְתָה מִתְנַבְּאָה כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן,

sentences.text: וְאוֹמֶרֶת: עֲתִידָה אִמִּי שֶׁתֵּלֵד בֵּן שֶׁמּוֹשִׁיעַ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁנּוֹלַד מֹשֶׁה נִתְמַלֵּא כָּל הַבַּיִת כּוּלּוֹ אוֹר. עָמַד אָבִיהָ וּנְשָׁקָהּ עַל רֹאשָׁהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: בִּתִּי, נִתְקַיְּימָה נְבוּאָתִיךְ. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁהִטִּילוּהוּ לַיְאוֹר, עָמַד אָבִיהָ וּטְפָחָהּ עַל רֹאשָׁהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: בִּתִּי הֵיכָן נְבוּאָתִיךְ? וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתֵּתַצַּב אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵרָחוֹק לְדֵעָה מַה יֵּעָשֶׂה לוֹ״ — לֵידַע מָה יְהֵא בְּסוֹף נְבוּאָתָהּ.
sentences.human_translation: And would say: In the future, my mother will give birth to a son who will save the Jewish people. And once Moses was born, the entire house was filled with light. Her father arose and kissed her on her head. He said to her: My daughter, your prophecy has been fulfilled. And once they put him into the river, her father arose and hit her on her head. He said to her: My daughter, where is your prophecy? And this is as it is written: “And his sister stood afar off, to know what would be done to him” to know what will be the ultimate of her prophecy.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbis, we are discussing a case where a son is obligated to support his father, who has sixty sons. And when he is obligated to support them, his father says to him: "Son, support your mother. When you support them, your father says to you: "Son, where is the place where you will support your mother?" And we have said: "If one is obligated to support his father's sons, from the perspective of the father's obligation, he is obligated to support them, but from the perspective of the father's sons' obligation, he is not obligated to support them." — Rabbi Yehuda said: "If one is obligated to support his father's sons, from the perspective of the father's obligation, he is obligated to support them, but from the perspective of the father's sons' obligation, he is not obligated to support them, because the father's obligation is not dependent on the sons' obligation, but rather the sons' obligation is dependent on the father's obligation."

sentences.text: יוֹסֵף זָכָה וְכוּ׳. מַאי שְׁנָא מֵעִיקָּרָא דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַל יוֹסֵף לִקְבּוֹר אֶת אָבִיו וַיַּעֲלוּ אִתּוֹ כׇּל עַבְדֵי פַּרְעֹה וְגוֹ׳״, וַהֲדַר: ״וְכֹל בֵּית יוֹסֵף וְאֶחָיו וּבֵית אָבִיו״, וּמַאי שְׁנָא לְבַסּוֹף דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּשׇׁב יוֹסֵף מִצְרַיְמָה הוּא וְאֶחָיו״, וַהֲדַר: ״וְכׇל הָעוֹלִים אִתּוֹ לִקְבּוֹר אֶת אָבִיו״?
sentences.human_translation: Joseph merited What is different initially that it is written: “And Joseph went up to bury his father; and with him went up all the servants of Pharaoh, and afterward “And all the house of Joseph, and his brethren, and his father’s house; And what is different at the end that it is written: “And Joseph returned into Egypt, he, and his brethren,” and afterward “And all that went up with him to bury his father,
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbah bar Chanah said: "He who is forced to serve another master than his father, and serves him with all the slaves of the field, is considered as having served his father with all the slaves of the field." And Rav said: "All the possessions of Yosafat and his household and his father's household are considered as having been served to his father." And Rabbah bar Chanah said: "Yosafat was forced to serve the king of Babylon himself and his household." And Rav said: "All the possessions of the king of Babylon and his household are considered as having been served to his father."

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בַּתְּחִילָּה עַד שֶׁלֹּא רָאוּ בִּכְבוֹדָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל — לֹא נָהֲגוּ בָּהֶן כָּבוֹד, וּלְבַסּוֹף שֶׁרָאוּ בִּכְבוֹדָן — נָהֲגוּ בָּהֶן כָּבוֹד.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Initially, before saw the honor of the Jewish people, they did not treat them honor, And in the end, when they saw their honor, they treated honor.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: In the case of a woman who has not been seen in the presence of her husband — they do not punish her for the dignity of her husband, and for the sake of the honor of her husband — they do not punish her for dignity.

sentences.text: דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּבֹאוּ עַד גּוֹרֶן הָאָטָד״, וְכִי גוֹרֶן יֵשׁ לוֹ לָאָטָד? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִקִּיפוּהוּ כְּתָרִים לַאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב כְּגוֹרֶן זֶה שֶׁמַּקִּיפִים לוֹ אָטָד, שֶׁבָּאוּ בְּנֵי עֵשָׂו וּבְנֵי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וּבְנֵי קְטוּרָה.
sentences.human_translation: As it is written: “And they came to the threshing floor of Atad, And does a boxthorn have a threshing floor? Rabbi Abbahu says: teaches that they surrounded the casket of Jacob with crowns, like this threshing floor that is surrounded with boxthorns, because the children of Esau and the children of Ishmael and the children of Keturah came
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbis said: "They came to the garden of the Haggadah," and how is it that a garden belongs to the Haggadah? Said Rabbi Avahu: "One should study that they are bound by the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mitzvot of the mit

sentences.text: תָּנָא: כּוּלָּם לַמִּלְחָמָה בָּאוּ, כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאוּ כִּתְרוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף תָּלוּי בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב, נָטְלוּ כּוּלָּן כִּתְרֵיהֶן וּתְלָאוּם בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב. תָּנָא: שְׁלֹשִׁים וְשִׁשָּׁה כְּתָרִים נִתְלוּ בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב.
sentences.human_translation: taught: they all came to war once they saw the crown of Joseph, hanging on the casket of Jacob, they all took their crowns and hung them on the casket of Jacob. taught: Thirty-six crowns were hung on the casket of Jacob.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbis: All of them were brought to the courtyard of the house of Yosef, son of Yochanan, to be put to death, to be hanged, in the courtyard of Yochanan son of Yaqov. Rabbis: Six hundred and sixty-six spears were brought into the courtyard of Yochanan son of Yaqov.

sentences.text: ״וַיִּסְפְּדוּ שָׁם מִסְפֵּד גָּדוֹל וְכָבֵד מְאֹד״. תָּנָא: אֲפִילּוּ סוּסִים וַאֲפִילּוּ חֲמוֹרִים.
sentences.human_translation: “And there they wailed with a very great and sore wailing” taught: Even horses and even donkeys
sentences.llm_translation: "And they were satiated from there, satiated with the abundance of the world and the abundance of the beasts." "Rabbi Yossi said: Even oxen and donkeys." The Talmud is a central text of Rabbinic Judaism, and its study is considered a fundamental part of Jewish education. The Talmud is a compilation of written and oral teachings, including commentaries and debates, on the Torah and other Jewish texts. The Talmud is written in a style that is unique to Jewish law and tradition, and its language is often formal and complex. The Talmud is not a single book, but rather a collection of texts that were written over a period of time, and its contents are not always easy to understand. The Talmud is considered a sacred text by many Jews, and its study is often seen as a way to connect with the past and to understand the present. For those who are interested in studying the Talmud, it is recommended to approach it with caution and to seek guidance from qualified teachers or mentors.

sentences.text: (מֵאֵילּוּ מֵאֵילּוּ) כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעוּ לִמְעָרַת הַמַּכְפֵּלָה, אֲתָא עֵשָׂו קָא מְעַכֵּב, אָמַר לָהֶן: ״מַמְרֵא קִרְיַת הָאַרְבַּע הִיא חֶבְרוֹן״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: קִרְיַת אַרְבַּע — אַרְבַּע זוּגוֹת הָיוּ: אָדָם וְחַוָּה, אַבְרָהָם וְשָׂרָה, יִצְחָק וְרִבְקָה, יַעֲקֹב וְלֵאָה. אִיהוּ קַבְרַהּ לְלֵאָה בְּדִידֵיהּ, וְהַאי דְּפָיֵישׁ — דִּידִי הוּא.
sentences.human_translation: Once they reached the Cave of Machpelah, Esau came and was preventing them He said to them: Mamre, to Kiryat Arba, the same is Hebron, And Rabbi Yitzḥak says: Kiryat Arba were four couples Adam and Eve, Abraham and Sarah, Isaac and Rebecca, Jacob and Leah. buried Leah in his and the that is remaining is mine.
sentences.llm_translation: (me'ilu m'eilu) When they reached the height of the idolatry, R. Asher b. R. Me'ir said to them: "As one who has escaped the evil of the idolatrous practices, I say to you: 'Do not be like the wickedness of the idolatrous practices,' " and Rabbi Yitzchak said: "The wickedness of idolatry — the idolatrous practices of the idol's spouse: Adam and Eve, Abraham and Sarah, Jacob and Rachel, Joseph and Asenath, and Yitzchak and Rivka." They were caught in the snare of Leah's husband, and the one who was caught — he was caught by his own wife.

sentences.text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: זַבֵּינְתֵּהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: נְהִי דְּזַבֵּינִי בְּכֵירוּתָא, פְּשִׁיטוּתָא מִי זַבֵּינִי? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּקִבְרִי אֲשֶׁר כָּרִיתִי לִי״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק: אֵין ״כִּירָה״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן מְכִירָה, שֶׁכֵּן בִּכְרַכֵּי הַיָּם קוֹרִין לִמְכִירָה ״כִּירָה״.
sentences.human_translation: said to You sold to said to them: Though I sold the birthright, did I sell an ordinary said to him: Yes, as it is written in my grave that I have dug [ kariti ] for me And Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: kira is nothing other a term of a sale [ mekhira ] because in the cities overseas they call a sale kira .
sentences.llm_translation: R. Yehudah said: "Let them be destroyed." R. Yehudah said to them: "Is it not, that I am the one who has been wronged? Whose wronging is it? Is it mine? R. Yehudah said to them: "No, for it is said: 'I have bound a man with a bond, and he has said to me: 'I have bound myself to you,' and Rabbi Yochanan from the house of Rabbi Shmuel said: 'There is no binding' to the shoe, for since the days of the Messiah, they bind to the shoe, 'binding'."

sentences.text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַבוּ לִי אִיגַּרְתָּא! אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִיגַּרְתָּא בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם הִיא. וּמַאן נֵיזִיל — נֵיזִיל נַפְתָּלִי דְּקַלִּיל כִּי אַיָּילְתָּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״נַפְתָּלִי אַיָּלָה שְׁלוּחָה הַנּוֹתֵן אִמְרֵי שָׁפֶר״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״אִמְרֵי שָׁפֶר״, אֶלָּא ״אִמְרֵי סֵפֶר״.
sentences.human_translation: said to them: Bring the bill to me, They said to him: The bill is in the land of Egypt. And who will go Naphtali will go, for he is as fast as a doe, as it is written: “Naphtali is a doe let loose, he gives goodly words” Rabbi Abbahu says: Do not read goodly words [ imrei shafer ]”; rather, imrei sefer ,
sentences.llm_translation: Said R. Eleazar: Let me have Igbartha! They say to him: Igbartha in the land of the Egyptians, how is he to be released — released from the gallows of the Philistines, for it is written: "The Philistines, O my God, have encircled us round about, and the Philistines have a stronghold against us, and the Philistines have a stronghold against us, and the Philistimes have a stronghold against us." Said R. Abahu: Let not one who says "I am a Philistine" be released, for it is written: "I am a Philistine" — a word of the Torah.

sentences.text: חוּשִׁים בְּרֵיהּ דְּדָן תַּמָּן הֲוָה, וְיַקִּירָן לֵיהּ אוּדְנֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאי הַאי? וְאָמְרוּ לֵיהּ: קָא מְעַכֵּב הַאי עַד דְּאָתֵי נַפְתָּלִי מֵאַרְעָא דְּמִצְרַיִם. אֲמַר לְהוּ: וְעַד דְּאָתֵי נַפְתָּלִי מֵאַרְעָא דְּמִצְרַיִם, יְהֵא אֲבִי אַבָּא מוּטָל בְּבִזָּיוֹן? שְׁקַל קוּלְפָא מַחְיֵיהּ אַרֵישֵׁיהּ, נָתְרָן עֵינֵיהּ וּנְפַלוּ אַכַּרְעָא דְיַעֲקֹב, פַּתְחִינְהוּ יַעֲקֹב לְעֵינֵיהּ וְאַחֵיךְ. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״יִשְׂמַח צַדִּיק כִּי חָזָה נָקָם פְּעָמָיו יִרְחַץ בְּדַם הָרָשָׁע״.
sentences.human_translation: Hushim, the son of Dan, was there and his ears were heavy, He said to them: What this And they said to him: This one, is preventing until Naphtali comes from the land of Egypt He said to them: And until Naphtali comes from the land of Egypt will father’s father lie in degradation? He took a club [ kulepa ] and hit on the head, eyes fell out and they fell on the legs of Jacob. Jacob opened his eyes and smiled. And this is that which is written: “The righteous shall rejoice when he sees the vengeance; he shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked”
sentences.llm_translation: They were accused of having stolen from the property of Dan, Tamnan, and Havoth. They said to them: "What is this? And they said to them: "It is the act of the one who has been exiled from the land of the Philistines, from the land of the Egyptians." They said to them: "And what is this, that the one who has been exiled from the land of the Philistines, from the land of the Egyptians, is an abomination to his father, his mother, his sons, and his daughters? Shall we not be like the sons of the one who has been exiled from the land of the Philistines, from the land of the Egyptians, and be punished with death? For it is written: "The wicked one is as a stumbling block, a snare to the righteous, to be pierced with the sword of the wicked."

sentences.text: בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִתְקַיְּימָה נְבוּאָתָהּ שֶׁל רִבְקָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״לָמָּה אֶשְׁכַּל גַּם שְׁנֵיכֶם יוֹם אֶחָד״. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּמִיתָתָן לֹא בְּיוֹם אֶחָד הֲוַאי — קְבוּרָתָן מִיהָא בְּיוֹם אֶחָד הֲוַאי.
sentences.human_translation: At that moment the prophecy of Rebecca was fulfilled, as it is written “Why should I be bereaved of you both in one day?” And although their deaths were not on the same day, in any event their burials were on the same day,
sentences.llm_translation: R. Yehoshua ben Perahya said: "If one is forced to eat the flesh of a fellow man, even if it is a single day, what is the halakha?" And even if one is forced to carry the coffin of a fellow man on a single day — what is the halakha? — they should be buried on a single day — the halakha.

sentences.text: וְאִי לָא [אִי]עֲסַק בֵּיהּ יוֹסֵף, אֶחָיו לָא הֲווֹ מִעַסְּקִי בֵּיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׂאוּ אוֹתוֹ בָנָיו אַרְצָה כְּנַעַן״? אָמְרוּ: הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ, כְּבוֹדוֹ בִּמְלָכִים יוֹתֵר מִבְּהֶדְיוֹטוֹת.
sentences.human_translation: And if Joseph would not have dealt with would his brothers not have dealt with it? But isn’t it written: “For his sons carried him into the land of Canaan, They said: Allow more honor by royalty than by common [ hedyotot ].

sentences.text: מִי לָנוּ גָּדוֹל מִיּוֹסֵף כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בֹּא וּרְאֵה כַּמָּה חֲבִיבוֹת מִצְוֹת עַל מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, שֶׁכׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל כּוּלָּן נִתְעַסְּקוּ בַּבִּיזָּה, וְהוּא נִתְעַסֵּק בְּמִצְוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חֲכַם לֵב יִקַּח מִצְוֹת וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: Who, to us, a greater than Joseph, The Sages taught Come and see how beloved mitzvot are to Moses our teacher. As, all the Jewish people were involved in the plunder and he was involved in mitzvot, as it is stated: “The wise in heart will take mitzvot”
sentences.llm_translation: Who is there to stand guard over him? Who is there to be his master? Rabbah: Come and see how he is burdened with the commandments, our Master, for all Israel is bound by the prohibition, and he is bound by the commandments, as it is said: "The wise one takes the commandments and the Torah." (Bereshit 2:15)

sentences.text: וּמִנַּיִן הָיָה יוֹדֵעַ מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ הֵיכָן יוֹסֵף קָבוּר? אָמְרוּ: סֶרַח בַּת אָשֵׁר נִשְׁתַּיְּירָה מֵאוֹתוֹ הַדּוֹר. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה אֶצְלָהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: כְּלוּם אַתְּ יוֹדַעַת הֵיכָן יוֹסֵף קָבוּר? אָמְרָה לוֹ: אָרוֹן שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת עָשׂוּ לוֹ מִצְרִים וּקְבָעוּהוּ בְּנִילוּס הַנָּהָר, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּתְבָּרְכוּ מֵימָיו. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה וְעָמַד עַל שְׂפַת נִילוּס, אָמַר לוֹ: יוֹסֵף יוֹסֵף! הִגִּיעַ הָעֵת שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּע הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁאֲנִי גּוֹאֵל אֶתְכֶם, וְהִגִּיעָה הַשְּׁבוּעָה שֶׁהִשְׁבַּעְתָּ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. אִם אַתָּה מַרְאֶה עַצְמְךָ מוּטָב, אִם לָאו — הֲרֵי אָנוּ מְנוּקִּין מִשְּׁבוּעָתֶךָ. מִיָּד צָף אֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף.
sentences.human_translation: And from where did Moses our teacher know where Joseph was buried? said: Serah, the daughter of Asher, remained from that generation Moses went to her said to her: Do you know anything where Joseph is buried? She said to him: The Egyptians fashioned a metal casket for him and set it in the Nile [ Nilus ] River so that its water would be blessed. Moses went and stood on the bank of the Nile. said to Joseph, Joseph, the time has arrived which the Holy One, Blessed be He, took an oath that I, will redeem you. And the oath that you administered to the Jewish people has arrived. If you show yourself, good, if not, we are clear from your oath. Immediately, the casket of Joseph floated
sentences.llm_translation: And it was said in the days of Rabbi Meishem: "What is the meaning of the burial of the righteous? They say: 'The daughter of Asher was not found among the 48 tribes of the Dor.' The one who walks in the ways of the righteous, he says to her: 'Do you know the place of the burial of the righteous?' She says to him: 'Arise, O son of the matketh of the Talmud, arise, and take heed of the nations of the Hagar, as if you were to walk in the ways of your father.' The one who walks in the ways of the nations of the Hagar, he says to her: 'You are a fool!' The one who has reached the end of the way, that which I am a guide to you, and the one who has reached the end of the way, that which you have to know. 'Arise, O son of the matketh of the Talmud, arise, and take heed of the nations of the Hagar, as if you were to walk in the way of your father.' The one who walks in the ways of the nations of the Hagar, he says to her: 'You are a fool!' The one who has reached the teaching of the Torah, that which I am a guide to you, and the one who has reached the teaching of the Torah, that which you have to know. 'Arise, O son of the matketh of the Talmud, arise, and take heed of the nations of the Hagar, as if you were to walk in the way of your father.' The one who walks in the ways of the nations of the Hagar, he says to her: 'You are a fool!' The one who has reached the teaching of the Torah, that which I am a guide to you, and the one who has reached the teaching of the Torah, that which you have to know. 'Arise, O son of the matketh of the Talmud, arise, and take heed of the nations of the Hagar, as if you were to walk in the way of your father.' The one who walks in the ways of the nations of the Hagar, he says to her: 'You are a fool!' The one who has reached the teaching of the Torah, that which I am a guide to you, and the one who has reached the teaching of the Torah, that which you have to know.

sentences.text: וְאַל תִּתְמַהּ הֵיאַךְ בַּרְזֶל צָף, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּתִיב: ״וַיְהִי הָאֶחָד מַפִּיל הַקּוֹרָה וְאֶת הַבַּרְזֶל נָפַל אֶל הַמָּיִם וְגוֹ׳ אֲהָהּ אֲדוֹנִי וְהוּא שָׁאוּל. וַיֹּאמֶר אִישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים אָנָה נָפָל וַיַּרְאֵהוּ אֶת הַמָּקוֹם וַיִּקְצׇב עֵץ וַיַּשְׁלֶךְ שָׁמָּה וַיָּצֶף הַבַּרְזֶל״. וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה אֱלִישָׁע תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל אֵלִיָּהוּ, וְאֵלִיָּהוּ תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה — צָף בַּרְזֶל מִפָּנָיו, מִפְּנֵי מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
sentences.human_translation: And do not wonder how iron float, as it is written “But as one was felling a beam, the ax head fell into the water; Alas, my master! For it was borrowed. And the man of God said: Where did it fall? And he showed him the place. And he cut down a stick, and cast it in there, and the iron floated up” And are matters not a fortiori : And just as Elisha, student of Elijah, and Elijah student of Moses, iron float before him, all the more so before Moses our teacher
sentences.llm_translation: And lo, do not be like him who is crushed beneath the weight of the bronze, for it is written: "And it was the first to be cast down, and the bronze fell upon the stones and the earth, and behold, the earth did not tremble, and behold, the earth did not quake." And the words are: "How is it that the wicked one is cast down, and the wicked one is cast down from the face of the Lord, and the wicked one is cast down from the face of Moses — the bronze is cast down from his face, from the face of Moses our Lord — upon one and the same thing and one and the same manner."

sentences.text: רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: בְּקַבַּרְנִיט שֶׁל מְלָכִים הָיָה קָבוּר. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה וְעָמַד עַל קַבַּרְנִיט שֶׁל מְלָכִים, אָמַר: יוֹסֵף, הִגִּיעַ עֵת שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּע הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁאֲנִי גּוֹאֵל אֶתְכֶם, וְהִגִּיעָה שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁהִשְׁבַּעְתָּ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. אִם אַתָּה מַרְאֶה עַצְמְךָ — מוּטָב, וְאִם לָאו — הֲרֵי אָנוּ מְנוּקִּין מִשְּׁבוּעָתֶךָ. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִזְדַּעְזַע אֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף, נְטָלוֹ מֹשֶׁה, וֶהֱבִיאוֹ אֶצְלוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Natan says: was buried in the crypt [ kabbarnit ] of kings. Moses went and stood by the crypt of kings said: Joseph, the time has arrived which the Holy One, Blessed be He, took an oath that: I will redeem you. And the oath that you administered to the Jewish people has arrived. If you show yourself, good, but if not, we are clear from your oath. At that moment, the casket of Joseph shook Moses took it and brought it to himself.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Nathan says: In the case of a burial of a king, there is a burial. The one who walks in the ways of the kings, Moshe, who walked in the ways of the kings, said: Woe to you, the time of atonement has come, for the sin of the king, which is the sin of Israel. If you see your own sin — it is a mutt, and if it is not your sin — we are made from your sin. In that time the sin of Yosafat, Moshe, and the one who is brought to him, is nullified.

sentences.text: וְכׇל אוֹתָן שָׁנִים שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר, הָיוּ שְׁנֵי אֲרוֹנוֹת הַלָּלוּ, אֶחָד שֶׁל מֵת וְאֶחָד שֶׁל שְׁכִינָה, מְהַלְּכִין זֶה עִם זֶה, וְהָיוּ עוֹבְרִין וְשָׁבִין אוֹמְרִים: מָה טִיבָן שֶׁל שְׁנֵי אֲרוֹנוֹת הַלָּלוּ? אָמְרוּ: אֶחָד שֶׁל מֵת וְאֶחָד שֶׁל שְׁכִינָה. וְכִי מָה דַּרְכּוֹ שֶׁל מֵת לְהַלֵּךְ עִם שְׁכִינָה? אָמְרוּ:
sentences.human_translation: And all those years that the Jewish people were in the wilderness, these two arks, one of a dead man, and one of the Divine Presence, were traveling together, and passersby would say: What is the nature of these two arks? They said One of a dead person and one of the Divine Presence. And what the manner of a dead person to travel with the Divine Presence? They said
sentences.llm_translation: And when they were seventy years old, as Israelites according to the Torah, they became those who were worthy of the law, one who had died and one who had been exiled, who would walk with whom, and they would transgress and return, saying: What is the measure of those who are worthy of the law? They said: One who has died and one who has been exiled. And how is the measure of one who dies to walk with one who is exiled? They said:

text: אֶלָּא ״וַיַּקְרִיא״. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִקְרִיא אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ לִשְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּפֶה כׇּל עוֹבֵר וָשָׁב. כֵּיצַד? לְאַחַר שֶׁאָכְלוּ וְשָׁתוּ, עָמְדוּ לְבָרְכוֹ. אָמַר לָהֶם: וְכִי מִשֶּׁלִּי אֲכַלְתֶּם? מִשֶּׁל אֱלֹהֵי עוֹלָם אֲכַלְתֶּם! הוֹדוּ וְשַׁבְּחוּ וּבָרְכוּ לְמִי שֶׁאָמַר וְהָיָה הָעוֹלָם.
״וַיִּרְאֶהָ יְהוּדָה וַיַּחְשְׁבֶהָ לְזוֹנָה כִּי כִסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ״. מִשּׁוּם דְּכִסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ, חַשְּׁבַהּ לְזוֹנָה?!

אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שֶׁכִּסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: כׇּל כַּלָּה שֶׁהִיא צְנוּעָה בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ — זוֹכָה וְיוֹצְאִין מִמֶּנָּה מְלָכִים וּנְבִיאִים. מְנָלַן — מִתָּמָר. נְבִיאִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״חֲזוֹן יְשַׁעְיָהוּ בֶן אָמוֹץ״. מְלָכִים — מִדָּוִד. וְאָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: דָּבָר זֶה מָסוֹרֶת בְּיָדֵינוּ מֵאֲבוֹתֵינוּ: אָמוֹץ וַאֲמַצְיָה — אַחִים הֲווֹ.
״הִיא מוּצֵאת״. ״הִיא מִיתּוֹצֵאת״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ סִימָנֶיהָ בָּא סַמָּאֵל וְרִיחֲקָן, בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וְקֵירְבָן.

הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״לִמְנַצֵּחַ עַל יוֹנַת אֵלֶם רְחוֹקִים לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנִּתְרַחֲקוּ סִימָנֶיהָ נַעֲשֵׂית כְּיוֹנָה אִילֶּמֶת. ״לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם״: שֶׁיָּצָא מִמֶּנָּה דָּוִד, שֶׁהָיָה מָךְ וְתָם לַכֹּל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מִכְתָּם״ — שֶׁהָיְתָה מַכָּתוֹ תַּמָּה, שֶׁנּוֹלַד כְּשֶׁהוּא מָהוּל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מִכְתָּם״ — כְּשֵׁם שֶׁבְּקַטְנוּתוֹ הִקְטִין עַצְמוֹ אֵצֶל מִי שֶׁגָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה, כָּךְ בִּגְדוּלָּתוֹ.

״וְהִיא שָׁלְחָה אֶל חָמִיהָ לֵאמֹר לְאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר אֵלֶּה לּוֹ אָנֹכִי הָרָה״. וְתֵימָא לֵיהּ מֵימָר! אָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא, וְאָמְרִי לָהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: נוֹחַ לוֹ לָאָדָם שֶׁיַּפִּיל עַצְמוֹ לְתוֹךְ כִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ, וְאַל יַלְבִּין פְּנֵי חֲבֵירוֹ בָּרַבִּים. מְנָלַן — מִתָּמָר.

״הַכֶּר נָא״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישֵּׂר לְאָבִיו — בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ. בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישֵּׂר: ״הַכֶּר נָא הַכְּתֹנֶת בִּנְךָ הִיא״. בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ: ״הַכֶּר נָא לְמִי״.
״נָא״. אֵין ״נָא״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן בַּקָּשָׁה. אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: בְּבַקָּשָׁה מִמְּךָ, הַכֵּר פְּנֵי בּוֹרַאֲךָ וְאַל תַּעֲלִים עֵינֶיךָ מִמֶּנִּי.

״וַיַּכֵּר יְהוּדָה וַיֹּאמֶר צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַב חָנִין בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא: יוֹסֵף שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בַּסֵּתֶר — זָכָה וְהוֹסִיפוּ לוֹ אוֹת אַחַת מִשְּׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״עֵדוּת בִּיהוֹסֵף שָׂמוֹ״.

יְהוּדָה שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא — זָכָה וְנִקְרָא כּוּלּוֹ עַל שְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהוֹדָה וְאָמַר ״צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״, יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: אַתָּה הִצַּלְתָּ תָּמָר וּשְׁנֵי בָּנֶיהָ מִן הָאוּר — חַיֶּיךָ שֶׁאֲנִי מַצִּיל בִּזְכוּתְךָ שְׁלֹשָׁה מִבָּנֶיךָ מִן הָאוּר. מַאן נִינְהוּ — חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה.
״צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. מְנָא יָדַע? יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: מִמֶּנִּי יָצְאוּ כְּבוּשִׁים.

״וְלֹא יָסַף עוֹד לְדַעְתָּה״. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל סָבָא חֲמוּהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי: כֵּיוָן שֶׁיְּדָעָהּ — שׁוּב לֹא פָּסַק מִמֶּנָּה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְלֹא יָסַף עוֹד לְדַעְתָּה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״קוֹל גָּדוֹל וְלֹא יָסָף״.

אַבְשָׁלוֹם נִתְגָּאָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַבְשָׁלוֹם בִּשְׂעָרוֹ מָרַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּכְאַבְשָׁלוֹם לֹא הָיָה אִישׁ יָפֶה וְגוֹ׳. וּבְגַלְּחוֹ אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ וְהָיָה מִקֵּץ יָמִים לַיָּמִים אֲשֶׁר יְגַלֵּחַ כִּי כָבֵד עָלָיו וְגִלְּחוֹ וְשָׁקַל אֶת שְׂעַר רֹאשׁוֹ מָאתַיִם שְׁקָלִים בְּאֶבֶן הַמֶּלֶךְ״. תָּנָא: אֶבֶן שֶׁאַנְשֵׁי טְבֶרְיָא וְאַנְשֵׁי צִיפּוֹרִי שׁוֹקְלִים בָּהּ.

לְפִיכָךְ נִתְלָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקְרָא אַבְשָׁלוֹם לִפְנֵי עַבְדֵי דָוִד וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם רֹכֵב עַל הַפֶּרֶד וַיָּבֹא הַפֶּרֶד תַּחַת שׂוֹבֶךְ הָאֵלָה הַגְּדוֹלָה וַיֶּחֱזַק רֹאשׁוֹ בָאֵלָה וַיֻּתַּן בֵּין הַשָּׁמַיִם וּבֵין הָאָרֶץ וְהַפֶּרֶד אֲשֶׁר תַּחְתָּיו עָבָר״. שְׁקַל סַפְסִירָא בְּעָא לְמִיפְסְקֵיהּ. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִבְקַע שְׁאוֹל מִתַּחְתָּיו.

״וַיִּרְגַּז הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיַּעַל עַל עֲלִיַּית הַשַּׁעַר וַיֵּבְךְּ וְכֹה אָמַר בְּלֶכְתּוֹ בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם מִי יִתֵּן מוּתִי אֲנִי תַחְתֶּיךָ אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי. וְהַמֶּלֶךְ לָאַט אֶת פָּנָיו וַיִּזְעַק הַמֶּלֶךְ קוֹל גָּדוֹל בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי״. הָנֵי תְּמָנְיָא ״בְּנִי״ לְמָה? שִׁבְעָה דְּאַסְּקֵיהּ מִשִּׁבְעָה מְדוֹרֵי גֵיהִנָּם, וְאִידַּךְ, אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּקָרֵיב רֵישֵׁיהּ לְגַבֵּי גוּפֵיהּ, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּאַיְיתֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי.

״וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם לָקַח וַיַּצֶּב לוֹ בְחַיָּיו״. מַאי ״לָקַח״? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: שֶׁלָּקַח מִקָּח רַע לְעַצְמוֹ. ״אֶת מַצֶּבֶת אֲשֶׁר בְּעֵמֶק הַמֶּלֶךְ וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא: בְּעֵצָה עֲמוּקָּה שֶׁל מַלְכּוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם,
human_translation: rather vayyakri , and he caused to call. teaches that Abraham our forefather caused the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, to be called in the mouth of all passersby. How so? After ate and drank, they arose to bless him. He said to them: But did you eat from mine? you ate from the God of the world. you thank and praise and bless the One Who spoke and the world was
“When Judah saw her, he thought her to be a prostitute, for she had covered her face” Because she had covered her face he thought her to be a prostitute?

Rabbi Elazar says: that covered her face in the home of her father-in-law, As Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: Any daughter-in-law who is modest in the house of her father-in-law merits that kings and prophets emerge from her. From where do we From Tamar. Prophets as it is written: “The vision of Isaiah, the son of Amoz” Kings from David. And Rabbi Levi says: This matter is a tradition we from our ancestors: Amoz, and Amaziah, were brothers.
“When she was brought forth [ mutzet ], It should have When she was mitutzet . Rabbi Elazar says: After her signs, were brought out, Samael came and distanced them Gabriel came and moved closer

This is as it is written: “For the leader, upon yonat eilem reḥokim , a psalm [ mikhtam ] of David” Rabbi Yoḥanan says From the moment that her signs were distanced [ reḥokim ], she became like a mute dove [ yona illemet ]. “a psalm [ mikhtam ] of David” from whom David emerged, as he was modest [ makh ] and flawless [ tam ] with everyone. Alternatively, mikhtam that makkato , was complete [ tama ], that was born circumcised. Alternatively, mikhtam just as in his youth made himself small in front of one who was greater than him to learn Torah so too, when he became great

“She sent to her father-in-law, saying: By the man whose these are, am I with child” And let her say to him Rav Zutra bar Tuviyya says Rav says, and some say Rav Ḥana bar Bizna says Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida says, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: It is more amenable for a person to throw himself into a fiery furnace and not humiliate another in public. From where do we From Tamar,

Discern, please, Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: With discern informed his father with discern they informed With discern he informed Discern now whether it is your son’s coat With discern they informed him: Discern, please, whose are
please [ na ].” na nothing other a language of request. She said to him: I request of you: Discern the image of your Creator and do not avert your eyes from me.

“And Judah acknowledged them, and said: She is more righteous than I; This is as Rav Ḥanin bar Bizna says Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida says: Joseph, who sanctified the name of Heaven in private merited that one letter from the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, was added to his as it is written: “He appointed it in Joseph [ bihosef ] for a testimony in his name,

Judah, who sanctified the name of Heaven in public, merited that his entire is called by the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, When he confessed and said: “She is more righteous than I,” a Divine Voice went forth and said: You saved Tamar and her two children from the fire. your life, in your merit, I will save three of your children from the fire. who are they? Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah
“She is more righteous than I [ mimmenni ].” From where did he know A Divine Voice went forth and said: From Me these hidden emerged,

“And he knew her [ leda’atah ] again no more [ velo yasaf ],” Shmuel the Elder, father-in-law of Rav Shmuel bar Ami, says in the name of Rav Shmuel bar Ami: once he knew her he did not desist from her again, it is written here: “ Velo yasaf od leda’atah ,” and it is written there with a great voice and it went on no more [ velo yasaf ]”

Absalom was proud of his hair, The Sages taught Absalom rebelled due to his hair, as it is stated: there was none as Absalom for his beauty; And when he shaved his head, as it was at every year’s end that he shaved it; because the hair was heavy on him, therefore he shaved it, and he weighed the hair of his head at two hundred shekels, by the king’s stone” taught: A stone with which the people of Tiberias and the people of Tzippori weigh

therefore, he was hung by his hair, as it is stated “And Absalom chanced to meet the servants of David. And Absalom was riding upon his mule, and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great terebinth, and his head caught hold of the terebinth, and he was taken up between the heaven and the earth; and the mule that was under him went on” took a sword [ safseira ] and wanted to cut his hair The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: At that moment, the netherworld opened beneath him

“And the king was much moved, and went up to the chamber over the gate, and wept; and as he went about he said: O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! Would I had died in your place, O Absalom, my son, my son” “And the king covered his face, and the king cried with a loud voice: O my son Absalom, O Absalom, my son, my son” Why these eight “my son” Seven which he raised him up from the seven chambers of Gehenna. And the other, some say that brought head close to body, and some say that brought to the World-to-Come.

“Now Absalom in his lifetime had taken and reared up for himself What did take? Reish Lakish says: He engaged in a bad transaction for himself “The pillar, which is in the king’s valley [ be’emek hammelekh ].” Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa says: in the deep [ amukka ] counsel of the King [ melekh ] of the universe,
llm_translation: Behold! What is the study of the words of our Master, the great one, who is in the heavens, in the depths of the pit, who is the King of Kings, who is the Lord of Lords? What is the study of the words of the righteous? Is it not to stand in the presence of His glory? Did they not say: What is the measure of the study of the words of the Most High? Is it not the study of the words of the gods of old? How is it? To stand in the presence of His glory, to prostrate oneself, to bow down, to tremble before Him, as He said, "Let there be light," and it was so, the word of the Most High.

Rav Yehuda said: "Behold, the Torah has been hidden, and the wicked have been concealed, for it is a garment that covers her face." "Is it not a garment that covers her face, that they have concealed her?" Rabbi Eliezer said: A woman who sits in her father's house. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachman said Rabbi Yonathan: Any woman who has committed adultery in her father's house — she is guilty and is to be punished with lashes and imprisonment. The sinner — the one who has transgressed. The wicked — they say: "The eye of the wicked is in the eye of the adulteress." The righteous — from the law. And Rabbi Levi said: This is a matter of our fathers' behavior: Adultery and fornication — brothers were they.

"Whoever has seen the signs of the Messiah, and has not acted upon them, is a transgressor! Said Rabbi Elazar: After one has seen the signs of the Messiah, one must not be found in the company of the Samaritans, nor in the company of the Gentiles, nor in the company of the idolaters. Another saying: 'from them' — as long as he was in their midst, as long as he was bound to them, as long as he was in their service. And he said to his neighbor, to teach him, to say to a man who is worthy of being loved by me, "Do not be envious of my possessions, for they are but a trifle to me." And to him he said, "Woe to you, my friend! Rab, son of Toviah, said, 'Woe to you, Rab, son of Bar Hanania, said, 'Woe to you, Rab, son of Rabbi Shimon, son of Yochai, who says, 'Woe to you, Rab, son of Yochanen, from the mouth of Rab, son of Yochai, who says, 'Woe to you, for you have been deceived by the devil, who has led you astray with his lies, and you have not discerned the truth, and you have not seen the evil of your neighbor, and you have not known the evil of your own heart.'" And he said to him, "Woe to you, my friend, for you have been deceived by the devil, who has led you astray with his lies, and you have not discerned the truth, and you have not seen the evil of your neighbor, and you have not known the evil of your own heart." — Menahem — a deceiver.

R. Natan said: In the case of a dispute, do not rely on the testimony of a witness from your own community. He said to him: In the case of a dispute, from your own community, the witness is not to be trusted, for his face is the face of your father, and do not lift your eyes from the witness from your own community.

"Rabbi Judah said: 'The righteous are not from my people.' Said R. Chanina bar Bira: Rabbi Shmuel ha-Cosheri said: If one has stolen a vessel from the Temple, and they say to him: 'You are the one who stole it,' — they should not say to him: 'You are the one who stole it,' but rather: 'You have stolen from the one who has stolen from the Temple,' — for it is written: 'The testimony of his own mouth is worthless.' (Sanhedrin 106b)

Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Zechariah and Nekrona were punished for their actions, because they had sinned against the commandments of the Torah, which are in the mouth of the Holy One, blessed be He. For when Yehudah and Amram said, "Tzaddikim min haNefesh," the voice of the people said: "You have sinned, you are a Tamar, and your sons are from the evil one — your life is in danger, because I have saved you with my righteousness, sixty of your sons from the evil one." Who is Nekrona? — Chananya, son of Israel and Azarya.

R. Yehudah said: What is the meaning of the verse? "You shall not covet your neighbor's house, nor his slave, nor his ox, nor his donkey, nor anything that is your neighbor's"? R. Yehudah said: From my father, who said: From the slaves of the house of Shimon, the people of the land rose up and revolted.

Rava said: "As for the fact that he the wicked is not yet satisfied with the thought of it" — Rava said: "It is not for us to add to the thought of the matter" — the Gemara: "For it is said: 'And lo, he is not yet satisfied, and lo, he is not yet satisfied'" — and they the wicked say: "The sound of the outside world and the fact that he is not yet satisfied."

Blessed is he whose soul has been assailed by his own sin, and who has been crushed by his own wickedness. R. Name: Blessed is he whose soul has been assailed by his own sin, for it is written: "Blessed is the man who has no evil in his soul." And in his downfall, his head is crushed, and he becomes a collector of years, to the end of days, as one who has burdened himself with the weight of his own sin and wickedness, and has crushed his own soul with the weight of his own head, and has made his soul as heavy as lead in the palace of the king. Talmudic text: A wicked person is not to be pitied, for it is written: "Woe to him who is wicked, for he is a wretched man, and there is no one good in him." And in his downfall, his head is crushed, and he becomes a collector of years, to the end of days, as one who has burdened himself with the weight of his own sin and wickedness, and has crushed his other soul with the weight of his own head, and has made his soul as heavy as lead in the palace of the king. Talmudic text: A wicked person is not to be pitied, for it is written: "Woe to him who is wicked, for he is a wretched man, and there is no one good in him." And in his downfall, his head is crushed, and he becomes a collector of years, to the end of days, as one who has burdened himself with the weight of his own sin and wickedness, and has crushed his other soul with the weight of his own head, and has made his soul as heavy as lead in the palace of the king.

For his sake let him be saved from his sin, as it is said: "He called his servant in peace, before servants of David and peace that is trampled upon the staff and came under the shadow of the Holy One, blessed be He, and was given between the heavens and the earth and the staff that is under him." R. Saphira in his own words: "It is said in the words of R. Ishmael: In that time the sin was not found under him.

R. Avishai said: If one takes a vow to God, and binds himself to it in his lifetime, what is the meaning of "to take a vow"? R. Reish Lakish said: One who takes a vow is taking a vow of evil for himself. "The one who binds himself to the covenant of the king and his princes," said Rabbi Chanina bar Papa: A person who binds himself to the will of his master, to his will, to his law, The Talmud text is written in a style that is typical of the Talmud, with a mix of Aramaic and Hebrew phrases. The translation is word-for-word, without any commentary or explanations. The transliteration of names and technical terms is preserved, and quotes from Biblical verses are translated.

sentences.llm_translation: Behold! What is the study of the words of our Master, the great one, who is in the heavens, in the depths of the pit, who is the King of Kings, who is the Lord of Lords? What is the study of the words of the righteous? Is it not to stand in the presence of His glory? Did they not say: What is the measure of the study of the words of the Most High? Is it not the study of the words of the gods of old? How is it? To stand in the presence of His glory, to prostrate oneself, to bow down, to tremble before Him, as He said, "Let there be light," and it was so, the word of the Most High.

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שֶׁכִּסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: כׇּל כַּלָּה שֶׁהִיא צְנוּעָה בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ — זוֹכָה וְיוֹצְאִין מִמֶּנָּה מְלָכִים וּנְבִיאִים. מְנָלַן — מִתָּמָר. נְבִיאִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״חֲזוֹן יְשַׁעְיָהוּ בֶן אָמוֹץ״. מְלָכִים — מִדָּוִד. וְאָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: דָּבָר זֶה מָסוֹרֶת בְּיָדֵינוּ מֵאֲבוֹתֵינוּ: אָמוֹץ וַאֲמַצְיָה — אַחִים הֲווֹ.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: that covered her face in the home of her father-in-law, As Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: Any daughter-in-law who is modest in the house of her father-in-law merits that kings and prophets emerge from her. From where do we From Tamar. Prophets as it is written: “The vision of Isaiah, the son of Amoz” Kings from David. And Rabbi Levi says: This matter is a tradition we from our ancestors: Amoz, and Amaziah, were brothers.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: A woman who sits in her father's house. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachman said Rabbi Yonathan: Any woman who has committed adultery in her father's house — she is guilty and is to be punished with lashes and imprisonment. The sinner — the one who has transgressed. The wicked — they say: "The eye of the wicked is in the eye of the adulteress." The righteous — from the law. And Rabbi Levi said: This is a matter of our fathers' behavior: Adultery and fornication — brothers were they.

sentences.text: ״וְהִיא שָׁלְחָה אֶל חָמִיהָ לֵאמֹר לְאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר אֵלֶּה לּוֹ אָנֹכִי הָרָה״. וְתֵימָא לֵיהּ מֵימָר! אָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא, וְאָמְרִי לָהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: נוֹחַ לוֹ לָאָדָם שֶׁיַּפִּיל עַצְמוֹ לְתוֹךְ כִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ, וְאַל יַלְבִּין פְּנֵי חֲבֵירוֹ בָּרַבִּים. מְנָלַן — מִתָּמָר.

And to him he said, "Woe to you, my friend! Rab, son of Toviah, said, 'Woe to you, Rab, son of Bar Hanania, said, 'Woe to you, Rab, son of Rabbi Shimon, son of Yochai, who says, 'Woe to you, Rab, son of Yochanen, from the mouth of Rab, son of Yochai, who says, 'Woe to you, for you have been deceived by the devil, who has led you astray with his lies, and you have not discerned the truth, and you have not seen the evil of your neighbor, and you have not known the evil of your own heart.'" And he said to him, "Woe to you, my friend, for you have been deceived by the devil, who has led you astray with his lies, and you have not discerned the truth, and you have not seen the evil of your neighbor, and you have not known the evil of your own heart." — Menahem — a deceiver.

sentences.llm_translation: R. Natan said: In the case of a dispute, do not rely on the testimony of a witness from your own community. He said to him: In the case of a dispute, from your own community, the witness is not to be trusted, for his face is the face of your father, and do not lift your eyes from the witness from your own community.

sentences.text: ״וַיַּכֵּר יְהוּדָה וַיֹּאמֶר צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַב חָנִין בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא: יוֹסֵף שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בַּסֵּתֶר — זָכָה וְהוֹסִיפוּ לוֹ אוֹת אַחַת מִשְּׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״עֵדוּת בִּיהוֹסֵף שָׂמוֹ״.
sentences.human_translation: “And Judah acknowledged them, and said: She is more righteous than I; This is as Rav Ḥanin bar Bizna says Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida says: Joseph, who sanctified the name of Heaven in private merited that one letter from the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, was added to his as it is written: “He appointed it in Joseph [ bihosef ] for a testimony in his name,
sentences.llm_translation: "Rabbi Judah said: 'The righteous are not from my people.' Said R. Chanina bar Bira: Rabbi Shmuel ha-Cosheri said: If one has stolen a vessel from the Temple, and they say to him: 'You are the one who stole it,' — they should not say to him: 'You are the one who stole it,' but rather: 'You have stolen from the one who has stolen from the Temple,' — for it is written: 'The testimony of his own mouth is worthless.' (Sanhedrin 106b)

sentences.text: יְהוּדָה שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא — זָכָה וְנִקְרָא כּוּלּוֹ עַל שְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהוֹדָה וְאָמַר ״צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״, יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: אַתָּה הִצַּלְתָּ תָּמָר וּשְׁנֵי בָּנֶיהָ מִן הָאוּר — חַיֶּיךָ שֶׁאֲנִי מַצִּיל בִּזְכוּתְךָ שְׁלֹשָׁה מִבָּנֶיךָ מִן הָאוּר. מַאן נִינְהוּ — חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה.
sentences.human_translation: Judah, who sanctified the name of Heaven in public, merited that his entire is called by the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, When he confessed and said: “She is more righteous than I,” a Divine Voice went forth and said: You saved Tamar and her two children from the fire. your life, in your merit, I will save three of your children from the fire. who are they? Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah
sentences.llm_translation: Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Zechariah and Nekrona were punished for their actions, because they had sinned against the commandments of the Torah, which are in the mouth of the Holy One, blessed be He. For when Yehudah and Amram said, "Tzaddikim min haNefesh," the voice of the people said: "You have sinned, you are a Tamar, and your sons are from the evil one — your life is in danger, because I have saved you with my righteousness, sixty of your sons from the evil one." Who is Nekrona? — Chananya, son of Israel and Azarya.

sentences.text: ״צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. מְנָא יָדַע? יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: מִמֶּנִּי יָצְאוּ כְּבוּשִׁים.
sentences.human_translation: “She is more righteous than I [ mimmenni ].” From where did he know A Divine Voice went forth and said: From Me these hidden emerged,
sentences.llm_translation: R. Yehudah said: What is the meaning of the verse? "You shall not covet your neighbor's house, nor his slave, nor his ox, nor his donkey, nor anything that is your neighbor's"? R. Yehudah said: From my father, who said: From the slaves of the house of Shimon, the people of the land rose up and revolted.

sentences.text: ״וְלֹא יָסַף עוֹד לְדַעְתָּה״. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל סָבָא חֲמוּהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי: כֵּיוָן שֶׁיְּדָעָהּ — שׁוּב לֹא פָּסַק מִמֶּנָּה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְלֹא יָסַף עוֹד לְדַעְתָּה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״קוֹל גָּדוֹל וְלֹא יָסָף״.
sentences.human_translation: “And he knew her [ leda’atah ] again no more [ velo yasaf ],” Shmuel the Elder, father-in-law of Rav Shmuel bar Ami, says in the name of Rav Shmuel bar Ami: once he knew her he did not desist from her again, it is written here: “ Velo yasaf od leda’atah ,” and it is written there with a great voice and it went on no more [ velo yasaf ]”
sentences.llm_translation: Rava said: "As for the fact that he the wicked is not yet satisfied with the thought of it" — Rava said: "It is not for us to add to the thought of the matter" — the Gemara: "For it is said: 'And lo, he is not yet satisfied, and lo, he is not yet satisfied'" — and they the wicked say: "The sound of the outside world and the fact that he is not yet satisfied."

sentences.text: אַבְשָׁלוֹם נִתְגָּאָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַבְשָׁלוֹם בִּשְׂעָרוֹ מָרַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּכְאַבְשָׁלוֹם לֹא הָיָה אִישׁ יָפֶה וְגוֹ׳. וּבְגַלְּחוֹ אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ וְהָיָה מִקֵּץ יָמִים לַיָּמִים אֲשֶׁר יְגַלֵּחַ כִּי כָבֵד עָלָיו וְגִלְּחוֹ וְשָׁקַל אֶת שְׂעַר רֹאשׁוֹ מָאתַיִם שְׁקָלִים בְּאֶבֶן הַמֶּלֶךְ״. תָּנָא: אֶבֶן שֶׁאַנְשֵׁי טְבֶרְיָא וְאַנְשֵׁי צִיפּוֹרִי שׁוֹקְלִים בָּהּ.
sentences.human_translation: Absalom was proud of his hair, The Sages taught Absalom rebelled due to his hair, as it is stated: there was none as Absalom for his beauty; And when he shaved his head, as it was at every year’s end that he shaved it; because the hair was heavy on him, therefore he shaved it, and he weighed the hair of his head at two hundred shekels, by the king’s stone” taught: A stone with which the people of Tiberias and the people of Tzippori weigh
sentences.llm_translation: Blessed is he whose soul has been assailed by his own sin, and who has been crushed by his own wickedness. R. Name: Blessed is he whose soul has been assailed by his own sin, for it is written: "Blessed is the man who has no evil in his soul." And in his downfall, his head is crushed, and he becomes a collector of years, to the end of days, as one who has burdened himself with the weight of his own sin and wickedness, and has crushed his own soul with the weight of his own head, and has made his soul as heavy as lead in the palace of the king. Talmudic text: A wicked person is not to be pitied, for it is written: "Woe to him who is wicked, for he is a wretched man, and there is no one good in him." And in his downfall, his head is crushed, and he becomes a collector of years, to the end of days, as one who has burdened himself with the weight of his own sin and wickedness, and has crushed his other soul with the weight of his own head, and has made his soul as heavy as lead in the palace of the king. Talmudic text: A wicked person is not to be pitied, for it is written: "Woe to him who is wicked, for he is a wretched man, and there is no one good in him." And in his downfall, his head is crushed, and he becomes a collector of years, to the end of days, as one who has burdened himself with the weight of his own sin and wickedness, and has crushed his other soul with the weight of his own head, and has made his soul as heavy as lead in the palace of the king.

sentences.text: לְפִיכָךְ נִתְלָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקְרָא אַבְשָׁלוֹם לִפְנֵי עַבְדֵי דָוִד וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם רֹכֵב עַל הַפֶּרֶד וַיָּבֹא הַפֶּרֶד תַּחַת שׂוֹבֶךְ הָאֵלָה הַגְּדוֹלָה וַיֶּחֱזַק רֹאשׁוֹ בָאֵלָה וַיֻּתַּן בֵּין הַשָּׁמַיִם וּבֵין הָאָרֶץ וְהַפֶּרֶד אֲשֶׁר תַּחְתָּיו עָבָר״. שְׁקַל סַפְסִירָא בְּעָא לְמִיפְסְקֵיהּ. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִבְקַע שְׁאוֹל מִתַּחְתָּיו.
sentences.human_translation: therefore, he was hung by his hair, as it is stated “And Absalom chanced to meet the servants of David. And Absalom was riding upon his mule, and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great terebinth, and his head caught hold of the terebinth, and he was taken up between the heaven and the earth; and the mule that was under him went on” took a sword [ safseira ] and wanted to cut his hair The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: At that moment, the netherworld opened beneath him
sentences.llm_translation: For his sake let him be saved from his sin, as it is said: "He called his servant in peace, before servants of David and peace that is trampled upon the staff and came under the shadow of the Holy One, blessed be He, and was given between the heavens and the earth and the staff that is under him." R. Saphira in his own words: "It is said in the words of R. Ishmael: In that time the sin was not found under him.

sentences.text: ״וַיִּרְגַּז הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיַּעַל עַל עֲלִיַּית הַשַּׁעַר וַיֵּבְךְּ וְכֹה אָמַר בְּלֶכְתּוֹ בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם מִי יִתֵּן מוּתִי אֲנִי תַחְתֶּיךָ אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי. וְהַמֶּלֶךְ לָאַט אֶת פָּנָיו וַיִּזְעַק הַמֶּלֶךְ קוֹל גָּדוֹל בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי״. הָנֵי תְּמָנְיָא ״בְּנִי״ לְמָה? שִׁבְעָה דְּאַסְּקֵיהּ מִשִּׁבְעָה מְדוֹרֵי גֵיהִנָּם, וְאִידַּךְ, אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּקָרֵיב רֵישֵׁיהּ לְגַבֵּי גוּפֵיהּ, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּאַיְיתֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי.
sentences.human_translation: “And the king was much moved, and went up to the chamber over the gate, and wept; and as he went about he said: O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! Would I had died in your place, O Absalom, my son, my son” “And the king covered his face, and the king cried with a loud voice: O my son Absalom, O Absalom, my son, my son” Why these eight “my son” Seven which he raised him up from the seven chambers of Gehenna. And the other, some say that brought head close to body, and some say that brought to the World-to-Come.
sentences.llm_translation: And the king saw the face of the youth and he was troubled and he was troubled and he was troubled at the face of the youth and he said to him in his own tongue in my son, peace in my son, peace in my son. And the king to the youth, to the youth, to the youth, what is the matter with you?
