sentences.text: ״וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם לָקַח וַיַּצֶּב לוֹ בְחַיָּיו״. מַאי ״לָקַח״? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: שֶׁלָּקַח מִקָּח רַע לְעַצְמוֹ. ״אֶת מַצֶּבֶת אֲשֶׁר בְּעֵמֶק הַמֶּלֶךְ וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא: בְּעֵצָה עֲמוּקָּה שֶׁל מַלְכּוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם,
sentences.human_translation: “Now Absalom in his lifetime had taken and reared up for himself What did take? Reish Lakish says: He engaged in a bad transaction for himself “The pillar, which is in the king’s valley [ be’emek hammelekh ].” Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa says: in the deep [ amukka ] counsel of the King [ melekh ] of the universe,
sentences.llm_translation: R. Avishai said: If one takes a vow to God, and binds himself to it in his lifetime, what is the meaning of "to take a vow"? R. Reish Lakish said: One who takes a vow is taking a vow of evil for himself. "The one who binds himself to the covenant of the king and his princes," said Rabbi Chanina bar Papa: A person who binds himself to the will of his master, to his will, to his law, The Talmud text is written in a style that is typical of the Talmud, with a mix of Aramaic and Hebrew phrases. The translation is word-for-word, without any commentary or explanations. The transliteration of names and technical terms is preserved, and quotes from Biblical verses are translated.

text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין.
וְתַנְיָא כְּבֵיצָה.
סַבְרוּהָ אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּעִיסָּה רִאשׁוֹנָה, וְחוּלִּין הַטְּבוּלִין לְחַלָּה לָא כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ.
מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: אֵין שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין,
וּמָר סָבַר: שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין.

אָמַר רַב מָרִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אֵין שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין, וְהָכָא בְּחוּלִּין הַטְּבוּלִין לְחַלָּה קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ.

וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא חוּלִּין הַטְּבוּלִין לְחַלָּה לָא כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ, וְאֵין שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין, וְהָכָא בְּמוּתָּר לִגְרוֹם טוּמְאָה לְחוּלִּין שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
מָר סָבַר: מוּתָּר לִגְרוֹם טוּמְאָה לְחוּלִּין שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וּמָר סָבַר: אָסוּר לִגְרוֹם טוּמְאָה לְחוּלִּין שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְכוּ׳.
בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: תְּחוּמִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּמָר סָבַר: דְּרַבָּנַן.

תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִן הַיָּם, נָתְנוּ עֵינֵיהֶם לוֹמַר שִׁירָה. וְכֵיצַד אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה — כְּגָדוֹל הַמַּקְרֶא אֶת הַלֵּל, וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו רָאשֵׁי פְרָקִים. מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״, וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״, מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה״ וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״.

רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: כְּקָטָן הַמַּקְרֶא אֶת הַלֵּל, וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו כׇּל מָה שֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר. מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״ וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״, מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה״, וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה״.
רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: כְּסוֹפֵר הַפּוֹרֵס עַל שְׁמַע בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, שֶׁהוּא פּוֹתֵחַ תְּחִילָּה וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו.
בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי — רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: ״לֵאמֹר״, אַמִּילְּתָא קַמַּיְיתָא.

וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי סָבַר: ״לֵאמֹר״ — אַכֹּל מִילְּתָא וּמִילְּתָא, וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה סָבַר: ״וַיֹּאמְרוּ״ — דַּאֲמוּר כּוּלְּהוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, ״לֵאמֹר״ — דִּפְתַח מֹשֶׁה בְּרֵישָׁא.

תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִן הַיָּם נָתְנוּ עֵינֵיהֶם לוֹמַר שִׁירָה. וְכֵיצַד אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה — עוֹלָל מוּטָּל עַל בִּרְכֵּי אִמּוֹ, וְתִינוֹק יוֹנֵק מִשְּׁדֵי אִמּוֹ. כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאוּ אֶת הַשְּׁכִינָה, עוֹלָל הִגְבִּיהַּ צַוָּארוֹ, וְתִינוֹק שָׁמַט דַּד מִפִּיו, וְאָמְרוּ ״זֶה אֵלִי וְאַנְוֵהוּ״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִפִּי עוֹלְלִים וְיֹנְקִים יִסַּדְתָּ עֹז״.
הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ עוּבָּרִים שֶׁבִּמְעֵי אִמָּן אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר:
״בְּמַקְהֵלוֹת בָּרְכוּ אֱלֹהִים ה׳ מִמְּקוֹר יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
וְהָא לָא חֲזוֹ? אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: כָּרֵס נַעֲשָׂה לָהֶן כְּאַסְפַּקְלַרְיָא הַמְּאִירָה וְרָאוּ.
בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן הוּרְקָנוֹס שֶׁלֹּא עָבַד אִיּוֹב כּוּ׳. וְלִיחְזֵי הַאי ״לֹא״, אִי בְּלָמֶד אָלֶף כְּתִיב — ״לֹא״ הוּא, אִי בְּלָמֶד וָיו כְּתִיב — ״לוֹ״ הוּא?
וְכׇל הֵיכָא דִּכְתִיב בְּלָמֶד אָלֶף, ״לֹא״ הוּא? אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה ״בְּכׇל צָרָתָם לֹא צָר״, דִּכְתִיב בְּלָמֶד אָלֶף, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּ״לֹא״ הוּא?
וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָכְתִיב ״וּמַלְאַךְ פָּנָיו הוֹשִׁיעָם״! אֶלָּא לָאו, מַשְׁמַע הָכִי וּמַשְׁמַע הָכִי.

תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ בְּאִיּוֹב, וְנֶאֱמַר ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ בְּאַבְרָהָם, מָה ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ הָאָמוּר בְּאַבְרָהָם — מֵאַהֲבָה, אַף ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ הָאָמוּר בְּאִיּוֹב — מֵאַהֲבָה.
וְאַבְרָהָם גּוּפֵיהּ מְנָלַן — דִּכְתִיב ״זֶרַע אַבְרָהָם אֹהֲבִי״.

מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין עוֹשֶׂה מֵאַהֲבָה לְעוֹשֶׂה מִיִּרְאָה? אִיכָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: גָּדוֹל הָעוֹשֶׂה מֵאַהֲבָה יוֹתֵר מִן הָעוֹשֶׂה מִיִּרְאָה, שֶׁזֶּה תָּלוּי לְאֶלֶף דּוֹר. וְזֶה תָּלוּי לְאַלְפַּיִם דּוֹר.
הָכָא כְּתִיב: ״לַאֲלָפִים לְאֹהֲבַי וּלְשֹׁמְרֵי מִצְוֹתָי״, וְהָתָם כְּתִיב: ״וּלְשֹׁמְרֵי מִצְוֹתָיו לְאֶלֶף דּוֹר״.
הָתָם נָמֵי כְּתִיב ״לְאֹהֲבָיו וּלְשֹׁמְרֵי מִצְוֹתָיו לְאֶלֶף דּוֹר״!
הַאי לְדִסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ וְהַאי לְדִסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ.

הָנְהוּ תְּרֵי תַּלְמִידֵי דַּהֲווֹ יָתְבִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, חַד אָמַר לֵיהּ אַקְרְיוּן בְּחֶלְמַאי: ״מָה רַב טוּבְךָ אֲשֶׁר צָפַנְתָּ לִּירֵאֶיךָ״, וְחַד אָמַר לֵיהּ: אַקְרְיוּן בְּחֶלְמַאי ״וְיִשְׂמְחוּ כׇל חוֹסֵי בָךְ לְעוֹלָם יְרַנֵּנוּ וְיַעְלְצוּ בְךָ אֹהֲבֵי שְׁמֶךָ״. אֲמַר לְהוּ: תַּרְוַיְיכוּ רַבָּנַן צַדִּיקֵי גְּמוּרֵי אַתּוּן. מָר מֵאַהֲבָה, וּמָר מִיִּרְאָה.
הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהַמַּיִם
מִי שֶׁקִּינֵּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ וְנִסְתְּרָה, אֲפִילּוּ שָׁמַע מֵעוֹף הַפּוֹרֵחַ — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיִּשְׂאוּ וְיִתְּנוּ בָּהּ מוֹזְרוֹת בַּלְּבָנָה.
אָמַר עֵד אֶחָד ״אֲנִי רְאִיתִיהָ שֶׁנִּטְמֵאת״ — לֹא הָיְתָה שׁוֹתָה. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ עֶבֶד אֲפִילּוּ שִׁפְחָה — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנִין אַף לְפוֹסְלָהּ מִכְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
חֲמוֹתָהּ וּבַת חֲמוֹתָהּ וְצָרָתָהּ וִיבִמְתָּהּ וּבַת בַּעְלָהּ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנוֹת. וְלֹא לְפוֹסְלָהּ מִכְּתוּבָּתָהּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁתֶּה.

שֶׁהָיָה בַּדִּין: וּמָה אִם עֵדוּת רִאשׁוֹנָה, שֶׁאֵין אוֹסַרְתָּהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם — אֵינָהּ מִתְקַיֶּימֶת בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם, עֵדוּת אַחֲרוֹנָה, שֶׁאוֹסַרְתָּהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְקַיֵּים בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם?
תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעֵד אֵין בָּהּ״, כׇּל עֵדוּת שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ.
וְקַל וָחוֹמֶר לְעֵדוּת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה מֵעַתָּה: וּמָה אִם

On that same day Rabbi Akiva interpreted
With regard to what do they disagree? Sage, holds boundaries by Torah law, and Sage, holds by rabbinic law,

The Sages taught: On that same day Rabbi Akiva taught at the time that the Jewish people ascended from the sea they set their eyes on reciting a song And how did they recite song? as an adult man reciting hallel and recite after him the chapter headings Moses said: “I will sing unto the Lord” and said “I will sing unto the Lord.” Moses said: “For He is highly exalted” and they said “I will sing unto the Lord.”

Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, says: like a minor boy reciting hallel and repeat after him all that he says, Moses said: “I will sing unto the Lord” and said “I will sing to the Lord.” Moses said: “For He is highly exalted,” and they said “For He is highly exalted.”
Rabbi Neḥemya says: like a scribe, who recites the Shema in the synagogue; as he begins first and they repeat after him
With regard to what do they disagree? Rabbi Akiva holds “saying,” to the first words
And Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, holds “saying” to every single word, And Rabbi Neḥemya holds “and they said” that everyone recited together, “saying” that Moses began first;

The Sages taught Rabbi Yosei HaGelili taught: At the time that the Jewish people ascended from the sea they resolved to sing And how did they recite a baby lying on his mother’s lap or an infant nursing from his mother’s breasts, once they saw the Divine Presence, the baby straightened his neck and the infant dropped the breast from his mouth, and they recited: “This is my God and I will glorify Him” As it is stated: “Out of the mouths of babies and sucklings You have founded strength”
Rabbi Meir would say: From where that even fetuses in their mother’s womb recited song As it is stated:
“In full assemblies, bless God, the Lord, you that are from the source of Israel”
But could not see, Rabbi Tanḥum says: stomach was transformed for them like luminous crystal [ aspaklarya ], and they saw
On that same day Rabbi Yehoshua ben Hyrcanus taught that Job served only Let us see whether this lo is written lamed alef , is: not whether it is written lamed vav , is: in Him.
But anywhere that is written lamed alef , is: Not? If that is so, “In all their affliction He was [ lo ] afflicted” where is written lamed alef , so too, does it Not,
And if you would say indeed but isn’t it written “And the angel of His Presence saved them,” Rather, is it not indicates this and indicates that?

It is taught Rabbi Meir says: It is stated with regard to Job “God-fearing” and it is stated with regard to Abraham “God-fearing” Just as “God-fearing,” which is stated with regard to Abraham, out of love, so too, “God-fearing” that is stated with regard to Job out of love.
And Abraham himself, from where do we As it is written: “The offspring of Abraham who loved Me”

What is there between one who performs out of love and one who performs out of fear? There is that which is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Greater is the one who performs out of love than the one who performs out of fear, as this endure for one thousand generations, and that endure for two thousand generations.
here it is written: “And showing mercy unto thousands of generations of those who love Me and keep My commandments” and there it is written: and keep His commandments for a thousand generations”
there also, it is written: with those who love Him and keep His commandments for a thousand generations”
That to that which is adjacent to it. And this to that which is adjacent to it:

these two students who were sitting before Rava, one said to him: It was read to me in my dream: “How abundant is Your goodness, which You have laid up for those who fear You” And one said to It was read to me in my dream: “So shall all those who take refuge in You rejoice; they will forever shout for joy, let them also who love Your name exult in You” said to them: You are both completely righteous Sages. Sage, out of love, and Sage, out of fear.
one who warned his wife and she secluded herself even if he heard from a flying bird, he must divorce grant her marriage contract the statement of Rabbi Eliezer,

one witness said: I saw that she became defiled she does not drink And furthermore, even a slave or a maidservant, they are deemed credible even to disqualifies her from her marriage contract

Her mother-in-law, and her mother in-law’s daughter, and her rival wife, and her yevama , and her husband’s daughter, They are deemed credible but not to disqualify her from her marriage contract; rather, not drink

as, by right, should have been And just as if the first testimony which does not forbid her an irrevocable prohibition, is not established with fewer than two the final testimony which forbids her an irrevocable prohibition, is it not logical that it not be established with fewer than two
the verse states: “And there be no witness against her” any that there is against her

May Löw b'haKamitalel, son of Rabbi, say: I am not making a slave of myself in the sweat of my brow, Talmudic text: וְאֵין רְבָּא, דְּמָר סָבַר:אֵין רְבָּא, דְּמָר עוֹשְׂעִי, English translation: And is not the slave, son of Rabbi, saying: I am not a slave, son of my master, Talmudic text: וְאֵין, דְּמָר סָבַר:אֵין, דְּמָר, רְבָּא, דְּמָר, עוֹשְׂעִי, English translation: And is not, son of Rabbi, saying: I am, son of the slave, son of my master, Talmatic text: וְאֵין, דְּמָר, רְבָּא, דְּמָר, עוֹשְׂעִי, דְּמָר, רְבָּא, דְּמָר, עוֹשְׂעִי, English translation: And is not, son of the slave, son of my master, son of the slave, son of my master, Talmudic text: רְבָּא, דְּמָר, עוֹשְׂעִי, דְּמָר, רְבָּא, דְּמָר, עוֹשְׂעִי, English translation: Slave, son of the slave, son of my master, son of

Rav Huna in his own words: The majority of the sages are of the opinion that one who has not yet reached the age of majority is not permitted to engage in any form of marriage, and that in the marriage of the utensils to the vessels, there is a clear transgression. Rav Sava: As the majority, and Rav Sava: To the majority, as the majority.

And lo, the sons of the priests are forbidden to eat the forbidden things to the extent that they are not permitted to make a sacrifice in the Temple, lest they be guilty of a transgression in the land of Israel, and that they should not be guilty of a transgression in the Temple, for it is written: "You shall not profane the sanctuary of the Lord your God, for I the Lord profane no one, nor will I profane any of those who profane the sanctuary of this house, and I will profane them, says the Lord of Hosts."
Rava: Death is to be inflicted upon the heretics of the land of Israel, and Rava: The prohibition of the heretics of the land of Israel is to be observed.
In that day, R. Akiva and Rav Huna went out.

R. Kahana: What is the meaning of the verse? "You shall not covet your neighbor's house, nor his slave, nor his ox, nor his donkey, nor anything that is your neighbor's"? (Deuteronomy 5:21) R. Sava: The Talmud is not concerned with the slave, for it says, "You shall not kill, nor slay, nor cause to be slain" (Exodus 20:13), and the ox and the donkey are not mentioned in the verse. Rav Huna, in the day, Rabbi Akiva said: In the time of the Messiah, Israel will be forced to sing. And what is the meaning of "sing" — as the one who is forced to buy the lulav, and the ones who are left behind are the wicked ones. As Moshe said, "I have made a song to God," and they say, "I have made a song to God," Moshe said, "It is as if a goat is being led to the altar," and they say, "I have made a song to God."

Rabbi Eliezer son of Rabbi Yose ha-Gelili says: As one who has taken a cat to the slaughter, and those who are after him say, "He who has taken a cat to the slaughter, and they say, "He who has taken a cat to the slaughter". Moshe said, "I have made a likeness to the Lord", and they say, "I have made a likeness to the Lord", Moshe said, "Like a potter on the potter's wheel", and they say, "Like a potter on the potter's wheel".
Rabbi Nchemiah says: A scribe of the poor, who is in the house of the treasury, who is a source of the first tithe, and who are the ones who are after him.

Rabbis of the generation: "For the sake of the law", said Rabbi Akiva: "What is the meaning of the words of the Torah, 'You shall not boil a kid in its mother's milk'?". T. Rav Huna, son of Rabbi Yose ha-Gelili: In the time when Israel was in the desert, we were commanded to say the Shira. And what did they say in the Shira — that the soul is complete upon the paths of the father, and the son is drawn from the ways of the father. When they saw the shrine, the soul is complete in the body, the son is laid down in the path of the father, and they say: "Who is this and who are they?" — as it is said: "From the face of the complete ones and the drawn ones, the path of the wicked is set."

Rabbis of the land of Eirav say: From the words of Rav Yehudah: If one takes a Nazirite who has not yet completed the period of his Nazirite vow, and he has not yet cut his hair, and he has not yet entered the period of his vow, he is guilty of a sin, as it is said: Talmudic text: כִּרְאוֹתָם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: רְבּוֹ רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְב

Rabbis of the House of Hillel, on the day of the incident, did not say: "If a man is caught in the act of murder, he is guilty." — Rabbi Yehoshua ben Horkanos said: "If a man is caught in the act of murder, he is not guilty." — Rabbi Yehu said: "If a man is caught in the act of murder, he is not guilty." — Rabbi Yehu said: "If a one is caught in the act of murder, he is not guilty." — Rabbi Yehu said: "If a man is caught in the act of murder, he is not guilty." — Rabbi Yehu said: "If a man is caught in the lie of murder, he is not guilty." — Rabbi Yehu said: "If a man is caught in the act of murder, he is not guilty."

And all the students of Rav, who said in the name of Rav, "What is the meaning of the verse, 'You shall not covet'?" - they said, "It is not for them to say, 'You shall not covet'?" - they said, "It is not for them to say, 'You shall not covet'?" - Rav said, "How can one be like the one who says, 'I will not covet'?"

And how is it said in the words of Rav Yehuda, "Whoever has a servant, let him not be a servant to his master, lest he be ashamed of his master, lest he be ashamed of his master's servant!" For it is said, "He who has a servant, has a servant, and he who has a servant, has a servant." (Deuteronomy 24:16)

Rabbim Meir says: It is said in the verse: "You shall not have in your heart any graven image" (Deuteronomy 5:8), and it is said in the verse: "You shall not have in your heart any graven image" (Exodus 20:4), what is the meaning of: "You shall not have in your heart any graven image" — the one that is said to be in Avraham — is it not from love, even if the one that is said to be in Yisrael — is it not from love?

R. Yochanan says: The one who is more careful with the commandment of loving-kindness than with the commandment of the prohibition against seeing i.e. looking at a woman, is more careful with the commandment of loving-kindness than with the commandment of the prohibition against eating i.e. eating forbidden food. For the latter is a transgression of the generation, whereas the former is a transgression of the generation to come. And this is the transgression of the generation to come, which is bound to the hand of the generation to come.
R. Huna said: "To the end of the world, to love My beloved and to keep My commandments," and they said: "To those who keep His commandments, to the head of the generation."

"Those who say 'Love him and keep his commandments' - to the face of the world - are they not the ones who are saying 'Love God and keep His commandments'?" Behold, the sons of the Talmudim of the house of Rav, the Kamai, who said: "How great is the evil you have done to your enemies, and how great is the evil you have done to those who hate you?" And he said to them: "Evil is to be found in the sword, for it is the instrument of all those who are hated by you, and the instrument of all those who are loved by you." They said to him: "Tell us, Rabbi, the ways of the wicked, and the ways of the evil-doers." And he said: "The wicked are those who are hated by all, and the evil-doers are those who are loved by all." Said to them: "You must be careful, O sons of the righteous, to avoid the ways of the wicked and the evil-doers." And they said: "Mar, mar, may we be hated by all, and may we be loved by all." The Talmud text is from the following Tractate: Tractate Avodah Zarah 18b

Who is the one who is willing to be bound to his wife and to conceal himself, even if he hears the voice of the dove? — R. Eliezer says: One must write a document, and make a testament, for the sake of the Torah.

Rabbah bar Yohanan says: Until they have been beaten and thrown into the mire of the muzzles. Rava said: One who says "I have seen her" — it is not so. And further, one who says "I have made her a slave" — they are not those who are slaves. For they are those who are free men, even if they are forced to serve her i.e. the slave from the Torah commandment.

Rav Yehuda said: The sons of Haman and the daughter of Haman and the concubine of Haman and the wife of the concubine — these are the ones who are considered as having committed a sin. And to what extent is one obligated to follow the law of the Torah, from the fact that they were not able to fulfill it, — to the extent that one would not be able to fulfill it.

R. Yehoshua ben Perahya said: What is the law regarding the testimony of a woman, who is not permitted to testify in the presence of two men, but is permitted to testify in the presence of a single man? — Is it not that the testimony of a woman is not permitted to be accepted, because it is not to be taken from the mouths of the fathers, from the tradition of the fathers, which is not to be taken from the mouths of the fathers? sentences.llm_translation: May Löw b'haKamitalel, son of Rabbi, say: I am not making a slave of myself in the sweat of my brow, Talmudic text: וְאֵין רְבָּא, דְּמָר סָבַר:אֵין רְבָּא, דְּמָר עוֹשְׂעִי, English translation: And is not the slave, son of Rabbi, saying: I am not a slave, son of my master, Talmudic text: וְאֵין, דְּמָר סָבַר:אֵין, דְּמָר, רְבָּא, דְּמָר, עוֹשְׂעִי, English translation: And is not, son of Rabbi, saying: I am, son of the slave, son of my master, Talmatic text: וְאֵין, דְּמָר, רְבָּא, דְּמָר, עוֹשְׂעִי, דְּמָר, רְבָּא, דְּמָר, עוֹשְׂעִי, English translation: And is not, son of the slave, son of my master, son of the slave, son of my master, Talmudic text: רְבָּא, דְּמָר, עוֹשְׂעִי, דְּמָר, רְבָּא, דְּמָר, עוֹשְׂעִי, English translation: Slave, son of the slave, son of my master, son of

sentences.text: וּמָר סָבַר: שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין.
sentences.human_translation: And Sage, holds can impart to non-sacred items.

sentences.text: אָמַר רַב מָרִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אֵין שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין, וְהָכָא בְּחוּלִּין הַטְּבוּלִין לְחַלָּה קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Mari, son of Rav Kahana, said Everyone cannot impart to non-sacred items. But here, they disagree with regard to non-sacred untithed vis-à-vis ḥalla , Sage, holds it is like ḥalla and Sage, holds it is not like ḥalla
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Huna in his own words: The majority of the sages are of the opinion that one who has not yet reached the age of majority is not permitted to engage in any form of marriage, and that in the marriage of the utensils to the vessels, there is a clear transgression. Rav Sava: As the majority, and Rav Sava: To the majority, as the majority.

sentences.text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא חוּלִּין הַטְּבוּלִין לְחַלָּה לָא כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ, וְאֵין שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין, וְהָכָא בְּמוּתָּר לִגְרוֹם טוּמְאָה לְחוּלִּין שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
sentences.human_translation: And if you wish, say Everyone non-sacred untithed with regard to ḥalla is not like ḥalla and cannot impart to non-sacred items. But here, they disagree with regard to it is permitted to cause ritual impurity to non-sacred that is in Eretz Yisrael.
sentences.llm_translation: And lo, the sons of the priests are forbidden to eat the forbidden things to the extent that they are not permitted to make a sacrifice in the Temple, lest they be guilty of a transgression in the land of Israel, and that they should not be guilty of a transgression in the Temple, for it is written: "You shall not profane the sanctuary of the Lord your God, for I the Lord profane no one, nor will I profane any of those who profane the sanctuary of this house, and I will profane them, says the Lord of Hosts."

sentences.text: מָר סָבַר: מוּתָּר לִגְרוֹם טוּמְאָה לְחוּלִּין שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וּמָר סָבַר: אָסוּר לִגְרוֹם טוּמְאָה לְחוּלִּין שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
sentences.human_translation: Sage, holds it is permitted to cause impurity to non-sacred that is in Eretz Yisrael. And Sage, holds it is prohibited to cause impurity to non-sacred that is in Eretz Yisrael.
sentences.llm_translation: Rava: Death is to be inflicted upon the heretics of the land of Israel, and Rava: The prohibition of the heretics of the land of Israel is to be observed.

sentences.text: בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְכוּ׳.
sentences.human_translation: On that same day Rabbi Akiva interpreted
sentences.llm_translation: In that day, R. Akiva and Rav Huna went out.

sentences.text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: תְּחוּמִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּמָר סָבַר: דְּרַבָּנַן.
sentences.human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Sage, holds boundaries by Torah law, and Sage, holds by rabbinic law,
sentences.llm_translation: R. Kahana: What is the meaning of the verse? "You shall not covet your neighbor's house, nor his slave, nor his ox, nor his donkey, nor anything that is your neighbor's"? (Deuteronomy 5:21) R. Sava: The Talmud is not concerned with the slave, for it says, "You shall not kill, nor slay, nor cause to be slain" (Exodus 20:13), and the ox and the donkey are not mentioned in the verse. sentences.text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִן הַיָּם, נָתְנוּ עֵינֵיהֶם לוֹמַר שִׁירָה. וְכֵיצַד אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה — כְּגָדוֹל הַמַּקְרֶא אֶת הַלֵּל, וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו רָאשֵׁי פְרָקִים. מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״, וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״, מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה״ וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״.
sentences.human_translation: The Sages taught: On that same day Rabbi Akiva taught at the time that the Jewish people ascended from the sea they set their eyes on reciting a song And how did they recite song? as an adult man reciting hallel and recite after him the chapter headings Moses said: “I will sing unto the Lord” and said “I will sing unto the Lord.” Moses said: “For He is highly exalted” and they said “I will sing unto the Lord.”
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Huna, in the day, Rabbi Akiva said: In the time of the Messiah, Israel will be forced to sing. And what is the meaning of "sing" — as the one who is forced to buy the lulav, and the ones who are left behind are the wicked ones. As Moshe said, "I have made a song to God," and they say, "I have made a song to God," Moshe said, "It is as if a goat is being led to the altar," and they say, "I have made a song to God."

sentences.text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: כְּקָטָן הַמַּקְרֶא אֶת הַלֵּל, וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו כׇּל מָה שֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר. מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״ וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״, מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה״, וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה״.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, says: like a minor boy reciting hallel and repeat after him all that he says, Moses said: “I will sing unto the Lord” and said “I will sing to the Lord.” Moses said: “For He is highly exalted,” and they said “For He is highly exalted.”
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer son of Rabbi Yose ha-Gelili says: As one who has taken a cat to the slaughter, and those who are after him say, "He who has taken a cat to the slaughter, and they say, "He who has taken a cat to the slaughter". Moshe said, "I have made a likeness to the Lord", and they say, "I have made a likeness to the Lord", Moshe said, "Like a potter on the potter's wheel", and they say, "Like a potter on the potter's wheel".

sentences.text: רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: כְּסוֹפֵר הַפּוֹרֵס עַל שְׁמַע בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, שֶׁהוּא פּוֹתֵחַ תְּחִילָּה וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Neḥemya says: like a scribe, who recites the Shema in the synagogue; as he begins first and they repeat after him
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Nchemiah says: A scribe of the poor, who is in the house of the treasury, who is a source of the first tithe, and who are the ones who are after him.

sentences.text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי — רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: ״לֵאמֹר״, אַמִּילְּתָא קַמַּיְיתָא.

sentences.text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִן הַיָּם נָתְנוּ עֵינֵיהֶם לוֹמַר שִׁירָה. וְכֵיצַד אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה — עוֹלָל מוּטָּל עַל בִּרְכֵּי אִמּוֹ, וְתִינוֹק יוֹנֵק מִשְּׁדֵי אִמּוֹ. כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאוּ אֶת הַשְּׁכִינָה, עוֹלָל הִגְבִּיהַּ צַוָּארוֹ, וְתִינוֹק שָׁמַט דַּד מִפִּיו, וְאָמְרוּ ״זֶה אֵלִי וְאַנְוֵהוּ״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִפִּי עוֹלְלִים וְיֹנְקִים יִסַּדְתָּ עֹז״.
sentences.human_translation: The Sages taught Rabbi Yosei HaGelili taught: At the time that the Jewish people ascended from the sea they resolved to sing And how did they recite a baby lying on his mother’s lap or an infant nursing from his mother’s breasts, once they saw the Divine Presence, the baby straightened his neck and the infant dropped the breast from his mouth, and they recited: “This is my God and I will glorify Him” As it is stated: “Out of the mouths of babies and sucklings You have founded strength”
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rabbi Yose ha-Gelili: In the time when Israel was in the desert, we were commanded to say the Shira. And what did they say in the Shira — that the soul is complete upon the paths of the father, and the son is drawn from the ways of the father. When they saw the shrine, the soul is complete in the body, the son is laid down in the path of the father, and they say: "Who is this and who are they?" — as it is said: "From the face of the complete ones and the drawn ones, the path of the wicked is set."

sentences.text: הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ עוּבָּרִים שֶׁבִּמְעֵי אִמָּן אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר:
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Meir would say: From where that even fetuses in their mother’s womb recited song As it is stated:
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbis of the land of Eirav say: From the words of Rav Yehudah: If one takes a Nazirite who has not yet completed the period of his Nazirite vow, and he has not yet cut his hair, and he has not yet entered the period of his vow, he is guilty of a sin, as it is said: Talmudic text: כִּרְאוֹתָם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: רְבּוֹ רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְבּוֹ — רְב

sentences.text: ״בְּמַקְהֵלוֹת בָּרְכוּ אֱלֹהִים ה׳ מִמְּקוֹר יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
sentences.human_translation: “In full assemblies, bless God, the Lord, you that are from the source of Israel”
sentences.llm_translation: "In the study of the Torah in the Temple of God, the Lord, from the source of Israel." Talmudic text: רְאִינוֹ רְאִינוֹ. English translation: "Our Father, Our Father." sentences.text: וְהָא לָא חֲזוֹ? אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: כָּרֵס נַעֲשָׂה לָהֶן כְּאַסְפַּקְלַרְיָא הַמְּאִירָה וְרָאוּ.
sentences.human_translation: But could not see, Rabbi Tanḥum says: stomach was transformed for them like luminous crystal [ aspaklarya ], and they saw
sentences.llm_translation: And lo, he said to them: "Do not make a covering for them, as one would cover a vessel for a vessel, lest you be like the one who is accused of theft, and your name be brought before the Sanhedrin." Talmudic text: רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: כְּאַסְפַּקְלַרְיָא? רְאִימָה? וְרָאוּ? כְּאַסְפַּקְלַרְיָא? רְאִימָה? וְרָאוּ?. English translation: Rabbi Tanhum: Is it like covering a vessel? Is it like hiding? And is it like covering? Is it like hiding?. Talmudic text: רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: כְּאַסְפַּקְלַרְיָא? רְאִימָה? וְרָאוּ? sentences.text: בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן הוּרְקָנוֹס שֶׁלֹּא עָבַד אִיּוֹב כּוּ׳. וְלִיחְזֵי הַאי ״לֹא״, אִי בְּלָמֶד אָלֶף כְּתִיב — ״לֹא״ הוּא, אִי בְּלָמֶד וָיו כְּתִיב — ״לוֹ״ הוּא?
sentences.human_translation: On that same day Rabbi Yehoshua ben Hyrcanus taught that Job served only Let us see whether this lo is written lamed alef , is: not whether it is written lamed vav , is: in Him.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbis of the House of Hillel, on the day of the incident, did not say: "If a man is caught in the act of murder, he is guilty." — Rabbi Yehoshua ben Horkanos said: "If a man is caught in the act of murder, he is not guilty." — Rabbi Yehu said: "If a man is caught in the act of murder, he is not guilty." — Rabbi Yehu said: "If a one is caught in the act of murder, he is not guilty." — Rabbi Yehu said: "If a man is caught in the act of murder, he is not guilty." — Rabbi Yehu said: "If a man is caught in the lie of murder, he is not guilty." — Rabbi Yehu said: "If a man is caught in the act of murder, he is not guilty."

sentences.text: וְכׇל הֵיכָא דִּכְתִיב בְּלָמֶד אָלֶף, ״לֹא״ הוּא? אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה ״בְּכׇל צָרָתָם לֹא צָר״, דִּכְתִיב בְּלָמֶד אָלֶף, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּ״לֹא״ הוּא?
sentences.human_translation: But anywhere that is written lamed alef , is: Not? If that is so, “In all their affliction He was [ lo ] afflicted” where is written lamed alef , so too, does it Not,
sentences.llm_translation: And all the students of Rav, who said in the name of Rav, "What is the meaning of the verse, 'You shall not covet'?" - they said, "It is not for them to say, 'You shall not covet'?" - they said, "It is not for them to say, 'You shall not covet'?" - Rav said, "How can one be like the one who says, 'I will not covet'?"

sentences.text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָכְתִיב ״וּמַלְאַךְ פָּנָיו הוֹשִׁיעָם״! אֶלָּא לָאו, מַשְׁמַע הָכִי וּמַשְׁמַע הָכִי.
sentences.human_translation: And if you would say indeed but isn’t it written “And the angel of His Presence saved them,” Rather, is it not indicates this and indicates that?
sentences.llm_translation: And how is it said in the words of Rav Yehuda, "Whoever has a servant, let him not be a servant to his master, lest he be ashamed of his master, lest he be ashamed of his master's servant!" For it is said, "He who has a servant, has a servant, and he who has a servant, has a servant." (Deuteronomy 24:16)

sentences.text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ בְּאִיּוֹב, וְנֶאֱמַר ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ בְּאַבְרָהָם, מָה ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ הָאָמוּר בְּאַבְרָהָם — מֵאַהֲבָה, אַף ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ הָאָמוּר בְּאִיּוֹב — מֵאַהֲבָה.
sentences.human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir says: It is stated with regard to Job “God-fearing” and it is stated with regard to Abraham “God-fearing” Just as “God-fearing,” which is stated with regard to Abraham, out of love, so too, “God-fearing” that is stated with regard to Job out of love.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbim Meir says: It is said in the verse: "You shall not have in your heart any graven image" (Deuteronomy 5:8), and it is said in the verse: "You shall not have in your heart any graven image" (Exodus 20:4), what is the meaning of: "You shall not have in your heart any graven image" — the one that is said to be in Avraham — is it not from love, even if the one that is said to be in Yisrael — is it not from love?

sentences.text: וְאַבְרָהָם גּוּפֵיהּ מְנָלַן — דִּכְתִיב ״זֶרַע אַבְרָהָם אֹהֲבִי״.
sentences.human_translation: And Abraham himself, from where do we As it is written: “The offspring of Abraham who loved Me”

sentences.text: מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין עוֹשֶׂה מֵאַהֲבָה לְעוֹשֶׂה מִיִּרְאָה? אִיכָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: גָּדוֹל הָעוֹשֶׂה מֵאַהֲבָה יוֹתֵר מִן הָעוֹשֶׂה מִיִּרְאָה, שֶׁזֶּה תָּלוּי לְאֶלֶף דּוֹר. וְזֶה תָּלוּי לְאַלְפַּיִם דּוֹר.
sentences.human_translation: What is there between one who performs out of love and one who performs out of fear? There is that which is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Greater is the one who performs out of love than the one who performs out of fear, as this endure for one thousand generations, and that endure for two thousand generations.
sentences.llm_translation: R. Yochanan says: The one who is more careful with the commandment of loving-kindness than with the commandment of the prohibition against seeing i.e. looking at a woman, is more careful with the commandment of loving-kindness than with the commandment of the prohibition against eating i.e. eating forbidden food. For the latter is a transgression of the generation, whereas the former is a transgression of the generation to come. And this is the transgression of the generation to come, which is bound to the hand of the generation to come.

sentences.text: הָכָא כְּתִיב: ״לַאֲלָפִים לְאֹהֲבַי וּלְשֹׁמְרֵי מִצְוֹתָי״, וְהָתָם כְּתִיב: ״וּלְשֹׁמְרֵי מִצְוֹתָיו לְאֶלֶף דּוֹר״.
sentences.human_translation: here it is written: “And showing mercy unto thousands of generations of those who love Me and keep My commandments” and there it is written: and keep His commandments for a thousand generations”
sentences.llm_translation: R. Huna said: "To the end of the world, to love My beloved and to keep My commandments," and they said: "To those who keep His commandments, to the head of the generation."

sentences.text: הָתָם נָמֵי כְּתִיב ״לְאֹהֲבָיו וּלְשֹׁמְרֵי מִצְוֹתָיו לְאֶלֶף דּוֹר״!
sentences.human_translation: there also, it is written: with those who love Him and keep His commandments for a thousand generations”
sentences.llm_translation: "Those who say 'Love him and keep his commandments' - to the face of the world - are they not the ones who are saying 'Love God and keep His commandments'?" Talmudic text: רְבִין רְבִין רְבִין English translation: "Rabbi, Rabbi, Rabbi" Talmudic text: רַבּי רְבִין: דְּרָבָה דְּרָבָה English translation: "Rabbi Raban: 'The more one is concerned with the affairs of the world, the more he is concerned with the affairs of the world'" Tabernacle (Temple) terminology: Talmudic text: (בְּרִיחַ) (בְּרִיחַ) (בְּרִיחַ) English translation: "The Holy of Holies, the Holy of Holies, the Holy of Holies" Talmudic text: (בְּרִיחַ) (בְּרִיחַ) (בְּרִיחַ) (בְּרִיחַ) English translation: "The Holy of Holies, the Holy of Holies, the Holy of Holies, the Holy of Holies" Talmudic text: (בְּרִיחַ) (בְּרִיחַ) (בְּרִיחַ) (בְּרִיחַ) (בְּרִיחַ) English translation: "The Holy of Holies, the Holy of Holies, the Holy of Holies, the Holy of Holies, the Holy of Holies" Talmudic text: (בְּרִיחַ) (בְּרִיחַ) (בְּרִי�

sentences.human_translation: That to that which is adjacent to it. And this to that which is adjacent to it:
sentences.llm_translation: R. Yossi b. Dosa to R. Yossi b. Chanina, and R. Yossi b. Chanina to R. Yossi b. Dosa. sentences.text: הָנְהוּ תְּרֵי תַּלְמִידֵי דַּהֲווֹ יָתְבִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, חַד אָמַר לֵיהּ אַקְרְיוּן בְּחֶלְמַאי: ״מָה רַב טוּבְךָ אֲשֶׁר צָפַנְתָּ לִּירֵאֶיךָ״, וְחַד אָמַר לֵיהּ: אַקְרְיוּן בְּחֶלְמַאי ״וְיִשְׂמְחוּ כׇל חוֹסֵי בָךְ לְעוֹלָם יְרַנֵּנוּ וְיַעְלְצוּ בְךָ אֹהֲבֵי שְׁמֶךָ״. אֲמַר לְהוּ: תַּרְוַיְיכוּ רַבָּנַן צַדִּיקֵי גְּמוּרֵי אַתּוּן. מָר מֵאַהֲבָה, וּמָר מִיִּרְאָה.
sentences.human_translation: these two students who were sitting before Rava, one said to him: It was read to me in my dream: “How abundant is Your goodness, which You have laid up for those who fear You” And one said to It was read to me in my dream: “So shall all those who take refuge in You rejoice; they will forever shout for joy, let them also who love Your name exult in You” said to them: You are both completely righteous Sages. Sage, out of love, and Sage, out of fear.
sentences.llm_translation: Behold, the sons of the Talmudim of the house of Rav, the Kamai, who said: "How great is the evil you have done to your enemies, and how great is the evil you have done to those who hate you?" And he said to them: "Evil is to be found in the sword, for it is the instrument of all those who are hated by you, and the instrument of all those who are loved by you." They said to him: "Tell us, Rabbi, the ways of the wicked, and the ways of the evil-doers." And he said: "The wicked are those who are hated by all, and the evil-doers are those who are loved by all." Said to them: "You must be careful, O sons of the righteous, to avoid the ways of the wicked and the evil-doers." And they said: "Mar, mar, may we be hated by all, and may we be loved by all." The Talmud text is from the following Tractate: Tractate Avodah Zarah 18b

sentences.text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהַמַּיִם

sentences.text: מִי שֶׁקִּינֵּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ וְנִסְתְּרָה, אֲפִילּוּ שָׁמַע מֵעוֹף הַפּוֹרֵחַ — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
sentences.human_translation: one who warned his wife and she secluded herself even if he heard from a flying bird, he must divorce grant her marriage contract the statement of Rabbi Eliezer,
sentences.llm_translation: Who is the one who is willing to be bound to his wife and to conceal himself, even if he hears the voice of the dove? — R. Eliezer says: One must write a document, and make a testament, for the sake of the Torah.

sentences.text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיִּשְׂאוּ וְיִתְּנוּ בָּהּ מוֹזְרוֹת בַּלְּבָנָה.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: until spin by light of the moon discuss her
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbah bar Yohanan says: Until they have been beaten and thrown into the mire of the muzzles. sentences.text: אָמַר עֵד אֶחָד ״אֲנִי רְאִיתִיהָ שֶׁנִּטְמֵאת״ — לֹא הָיְתָה שׁוֹתָה. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ עֶבֶד אֲפִילּוּ שִׁפְחָה — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנִין אַף לְפוֹסְלָהּ מִכְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
sentences.human_translation: one witness said: I saw that she became defiled she does not drink And furthermore, even a slave or a maidservant, they are deemed credible even to disqualifies her from her marriage contract
sentences.llm_translation: Rava said: One who says "I have seen her" — it is not so. And further, one who says "I have made her a slave" — they are not those who are slaves. For they are those who are free men, even if they are forced to serve her i.e. the slave from the Torah commandment.

sentences.text: חֲמוֹתָהּ וּבַת חֲמוֹתָהּ וְצָרָתָהּ וִיבִמְתָּהּ וּבַת בַּעְלָהּ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנוֹת. וְלֹא לְפוֹסְלָהּ מִכְּתוּבָּתָהּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁתֶּה.
sentences.human_translation: Her mother-in-law, and her mother in-law’s daughter, and her rival wife, and her yevama , and her husband’s daughter, They are deemed credible but not to disqualify her from her marriage contract; rather, not drink
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Yehuda said: The sons of Haman and the daughter of Haman and the concubine of Haman and the wife of the concubine — these are the ones who are considered as having committed a sin. And to what extent is one obligated to follow the law of the Torah, from the fact that they were not able to fulfill it, — to the extent that one would not be able to fulfill it.

sentences.text: שֶׁהָיָה בַּדִּין: וּמָה אִם עֵדוּת רִאשׁוֹנָה, שֶׁאֵין אוֹסַרְתָּהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם — אֵינָהּ מִתְקַיֶּימֶת בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם, עֵדוּת אַחֲרוֹנָה, שֶׁאוֹסַרְתָּהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְקַיֵּים בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם?
sentences.human_translation: as, by right, should have been And just as if the first testimony which does not forbid her an irrevocable prohibition, is not established with fewer than two the final testimony which forbids her an irrevocable prohibition, is it not logical that it not be established with fewer than two
sentences.llm_translation: R. Yehoshua ben Perahya said: What is the law regarding the testimony of a woman, who is not permitted to testify in the presence of two men, but is permitted to testify in the presence of a single man? — Is it not that the testimony of a woman is not permitted to be accepted, because it is not to be taken from the mouths of the fathers, from the tradition of the fathers, which is not to be taken from the mouths of the fathers? sentences.text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעֵד אֵין בָּהּ״, כׇּל עֵדוּת שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ.
sentences.human_translation: the verse states: “And there be no witness against her” any that there is against her
sentences.llm_translation: Mishnah: "And do not stand in her midst," All testimony that exists in her.

sentences.human_translation: And from now an a fortiori with regard to the first testimony And just as if

text: שֶׁמְּבַזְבְּזִין דִּין אֲבִיהֶם לֶעָתִיד לָבוֹא. אוֹמְרִים לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מֵאַחַר שֶׁאַתָּה עָתִיד לִיפָּרַע מֵהֶן, לָמָה הִקְהֵיתָה שִׁינֵּיהֶם בָּם?

אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: אִלְמָלֵא תְּפִלָּתוֹ שֶׁל דָּוִד, הָיוּ כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל מוֹכְרֵי רְבָב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שִׁיתָה ה׳ מוֹרָה לָהֶם״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: אִלְמָלֵא תְּפִלָּתוֹ שֶׁל חֲבַקּוּק, הָיוּ שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מִתְכַּסִּים בְּטַלִּית אַחַת וְעוֹסְקִין בַּתּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״ה׳ שָׁמַעְתִּי שִׁמְעֲךָ יָרֵאתִי ה׳ פׇּעׇלְךָ בְּקֶרֶב שָׁנִים חַיֵּיהוּ״. אַל תִּקְרָא ״בְּקֶרֶב שָׁנִים״, אֶלָּא ״בְּקֵרוּב שְׁנַיִם״.

וְאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים הַמְהַלְּכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְאֵין בֵּינֵיהֶן דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה — רְאוּיִן לִישָּׂרֵף בָּאֵשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי הֵמָּה הֹלְכִים הָלוֹךְ וְדַבֵּר וְהִנֵּה רֶכֶב אֵשׁ וְגוֹ׳״, טַעְמָא דְּאִיכָּא דִּיבּוּר, הָא לֵיכָּא דִּיבּוּר — רְאוּיִן לִישָּׂרֵף.

וְאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים הַדָּרִין בְּעִיר אַחַת וְאֵין נוֹחִין זֶה לָזֶה בַּהֲלָכָה — אֶחָד מֵת וְאֶחָד גּוֹלֶה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָנֻס שָׁמָּה רוֹצֵחַ אֲשֶׁר יִרְצַח אֶת רֵעֵהוּ בִּבְלִי דַעַת״, וְאֵין דַּעַת אֶלָּא תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נִדְמוּ עַמִּי מִבְּלִי הַדָּעַת״.

אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא: כׇּל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הָעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה מִתּוֹךְ הַדְּחָק — תְּפִלָּתוֹ נִשְׁמַעַת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי עַם בְּצִיּוֹן יֵשֵׁב בִּירוּשָׁלִָם בָּכוֹ לֹא תִבְכֶּה חָנוֹן יׇחְנְךָ לְקוֹל זַעֲקֶךָ כְּשׇׁמְעָתוֹ עָנָךְ״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״וְנָתַן ה׳ לָכֶם לֶחֶם צָר וּמַיִם לָחַץ״.

רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אוֹמֵר: מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתוֹ מִזִּיו שְׁכִינָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיוּ עֵינֶיךָ רֹאוֹת אֶת מוֹרֶיךָ״. רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: אַף אֵין הַפַּרְגּוֹד נִנְעָל בְּפָנָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא יִכָּנֵף עוֹד מוֹרֶיךָ״.

רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ אֵין וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רָבָא: בְּכׇל יוֹם וָיוֹם מְרוּבָּה קִלְלָתוֹ מִשֶּׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּבֹּקֶר תֹּאמַר מִי יִתֵּן עֶרֶב וּבָעֶרֶב תֹּאמַר מִי יִתֵּן בֹּקֶר״, הֵי בֹּקֶר? אִילֵימָא בֹּקֶר דְּלִמְחַר, מִי יָדַע מַאי הָוֵי? אֶלָּא דַּחֲלֵיף.

וְאֶלָּא, עָלְמָא אַמַּאי קָא מִקַּיַּים? אַקְּדוּשָּׁה דְסִידְרָא, וְאַ״יְּהֵא שְׁמֵיהּ רַבָּא״ דְּאַגַּדְתָּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶרֶץ עֵיפָתָה כְּמוֹ אֹפֶל צַלְמָוֶת וְלֹא סְדָרִים״, הָא יֵשׁ סְדָרִים — תּוֹפִיעַ מֵאוֹפֶל.
וְלֹא יָרַד טַל לִבְרָכָה וְנִיטַּל טַעַם פֵּירוֹת וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: טׇהֳרָה — בִּטְּלָה טַעַם וָרֵיחַ, מַעֲשֵׂר — בִּיטֵּל שׁוֹמֶן דָּגָן.

רַב הוּנָא אַשְׁכַּח תּוֹמַרְתָּא דְּחִינוּנִיתָא, שַׁקְלַהּ, כַּרְכַהּ בְּסוּדָרֵיהּ. אֲתָא רַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מוֹרְחִינָא רֵיחָא דְּחִינוּנִיתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנִי, טׇהֳרָה יֵשׁ בְּךָ. יַהֲבַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ. אַדְּהָכִי אֲתָא אַבָּא בְּרֵיהּ, שַׁקְלַהּ, יַהֲבַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנִי, שִׂמַּחְתָּ אֶת לִבִּי, וְהִקְהֵיתָה אֶת שִׁינַּי. הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רַחֲמֵי דְּאַבָּא — אַבְּנֵי, רַחֲמֵי דִּבְנֵי — אַבְּנֵי דְּהָווּ לֵיהּ.

רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אִיטַּפַּל בֵּיהּ בְּרַב יַעֲקֹב בַּר בְּרַתֵּיה. כִּי גְדַל אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַשְׁקְיַין מַיָּא. אָמַר לוֹ: לָאו בְּרָיךְ אֲנָא. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רַבִּי רַבִּי, בַּר בְּרַתָּךְ אֲנָא.
מַתְנִי׳ בְּפוּלְמוּס שֶׁל אַסְפַּסְיָינוּס גָּזְרוּ עַל עַטְרוֹת חֲתָנִים וְעַל הָאִירוּס.
בְּפוּלְמוּס שֶׁל טִיטוּס גָּזְרוּ עַל עַטְרוֹת כַּלּוֹת, וְשֶׁלֹּא יְלַמֵּד אָדָם אֶת בְּנוֹ יְווֹנִית.
בְּפוּלְמוּס הָאַחֲרוֹן גָּזְרוּ שֶׁלֹּא תֵּצֵא הַכַּלָּה בְּאַפִּרְיוֹן בְּתוֹךְ הָעִיר, וְרַבּוֹתֵינוּ הִתִּירוּ שֶׁתֵּצֵא הַכַּלָּה בְּאַפִּרְיוֹן בְּתוֹךְ הָעִיר.

מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי מֵאִיר בָּטְלוּ מוֹשְׁלֵי מְשָׁלִים. מִשֶּׁמֵּת בֶּן עַזַּאי בָּטְלוּ הַשַּׁקְדָנִים. מִשֶּׁמֵּת בֶּן זוֹמָא בָּטְלוּ הַדַּרְשָׁנִים. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בָּטַל כְּבוֹד הַתּוֹרָה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא בָּטְלוּ אַנְשֵׁי מַעֲשֶׂה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי יוֹסֵי קְטֹנְתָּא פָּסְקוּ חֲסִידִים. וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ ״קְטֹנְתָּא״ — שֶׁהָיָה קְטֹנְתָּא שֶׁל חֲסִידִים.

מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי בָּטַל זִיו הַחׇכְמָה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַזָּקֵן בָּטַל כְּבוֹד הַתּוֹרָה, וּמֵתָה טׇהֳרָה וּפְרִישׁוּת. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן פִּאָבִי בָּטְלָה זִיו הַכְּהוּנָּה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי בָּטְלָ[ה] עֲנָוָה וְיִרְאַת חֵטְא.

[ גְּמָ׳ ] תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: רַבִּי פִּנְחָס בֶּן יָאִיר אוֹמֵר: מִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ בּוֹשׁוּ חֲבֵרִים וּבְנֵי חוֹרִין, וְחָפוּ רֹאשָׁם, וְנִדַּלְדְּלוּ אַנְשֵׁי מַעֲשֶׂה, וְגָבְרוּ בַּעֲלֵי זְרוֹעַ וּבַעֲלֵי לָשׁוֹן, וְאֵין דּוֹרֵשׁ וְאֵין מְבַקֵּשׁ וְאֵין שׁוֹאֵל,
עַל מִי לָנוּ לְהִשָּׁעֵן עַל אָבִינוּ שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם.
רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ שָׁרוֹ חַכִּימַיָּא לְמֶהֱוֵי כְּסָפְרַיָּא, וְסָפְרַיָּא כְּחַזָּנַיָּא, וְחַזָּנַיָּא כְּעַמָּא דְאַרְעָא, וְעַמָּא דְאַרְעָא

Rabbi Ile’a bar Yeverekhya says: If it were not for the prayer of David all Israel would be sellers of fat [ revav ], as it is stated: “Place for them mastery, O Lord” And Rabbi Ile’a bar Yeverekhya says: If it were not for the prayer of Habakkuk, two Torah scholars would have to cover themselves with a single cloak and engage in Torah study as it is stated: “Lord, I heard Your report and was afraid; O Lord, revive Your work in the midst of the years” Do not read: “In the midst [ bekerev ] of the years [ shanim ],” but in the closeness [ bikrov ] of two [ shenayim ].

And Rabbi Ile’a bar Yeverekhya says: two Torah scholars who are walking along the way and there are no words of Torah between them, they are deserving of being burned in fire. As it is stated “And it was as they walked along, talking, that behold, there appeared a chariot of fire The reason that there was speech but if there had been no speech, they deserving of being burned

And Rabbi Ile’a bar Yeverekhya says: two Torah scholars who reside in the same city and they are not pleasant to each other with regard to halakha , one die and one exiled. As is stated: “That the manslayer might flee there, who slays his neighbor without knowledge” and “knowledge” nothing other Torah, as it is stated: “My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge”

Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, says: any Torah scholar who engages in Torah while experiencing the pressure his prayer is listened to, as it is stated: “For, O people that dwells in Zion at Jerusalem, you shall weep no more; He will surely be gracious to you at the voice of your cry. When He shall hear, He will answer you” and after it is written: “And the Lord shall give you sparse bread and scant water”

Rabbi Abbahu says: is satiated with the glory of the Divine Presence, as it is stated “And your eyes shall behold your Teacher.” Rabbi Aḥa, son of Ḥanina, said: Even the partition pargod is not locked before him, as it is stated: “And your Teacher shall not hide Himself anymore”

Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: From the day that the Temple was destroyed, there is no Rava says: Each and every day is more cursed than the previous one, as it is stated “In the morning you will say, would that it were evening, and in the evening you will say, would that it were morning” which morning If we say the following morning, does he know what will be Rather, that has passed;

But why does the world exist? By the sanctification that order and Let His great name of aggada . As it is stated: “A land of thick darkness, as darkness itself; a land of the shadow of death, without any order” Therefore, there are orders shall appear from the darkness.

dew has not descended for a blessing, and the taste has been removed from fruit. It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: purity has removed the taste and the aroma; tithes have removed the fat of grain.

Rav Huna found a fragrant date. He took it and wrapped it in his shawl. Rabba, his son, came said to him: I smell the aroma of a fragrant said to him: My son, there is purity in you, He gave it to him. Meanwhile, Abba, son, arrived. took gave it to said to My son, you have made my heart rejoice and you have blunted my teeth, This that people say: The love of a father is for the sons; the love of the sons is for their own sons,

Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov took care of Rav Ya’akov, the son of his daughter, When grew up, said to him: Give me water to drink. He said to him: I am not your son, And this that people say: Raise, raise I am the son of your daughter,
In the war [ pulemus ] of Vespasian decreed upon the crowns of bridegrooms, and upon the drums,
In the war of Titus they decreed upon the crowns of brides, and that a person should not teach his son Greek.
In the last war, they decreed that a bride may not go out in a palanquin inside the city, but our Sages permitted a bride to go out in a palanquin inside the city,

From when Rabbi Meir died, those who relate parables ceased; from when ben Azzai died, the diligent ceased; from when ben Zoma died, the exegetists ceased; from when Rabbi Akiva died, the honor of the Torah ceased; from when Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa died, the men of action ceased; from when Rabbi Yosei the Small died, the pious were no more. And why was he called the Small? Because he was the smallest of the pious,

From when Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai died, the glory of wisdom ceased; from when Rabban Gamliel the Elder died, the honor of the Torah ceased, and purity and asceticism died. From when Rabbi Yishmael ben Pavi died, the glory of the priesthood ceased; from when Rabbi died, humility and fear of sin ceased.

The Sages taught: Rabbi Pineḥas ben Ya’ir says: From when the Temple was destroyed, the ḥaverim and free men were ashamed, and their heads were covered and men of action dwindled, and violent and smooth-talking men gained the upper hand, and none seek, and none ask, and none inquire
Upon whom for us to rely? upon our Father in Heaven.

Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: From the day the Temple was destroyed, Scholars have begun to become like scribes and scribes have become like beadles, and beadles have become like ignoramuses, and ignoramuses

Rabbi Ilai bar Yehudah said: In the case of David, it is clear that all Israelites are obligated to pay taxes, as it is said: "The Lord has set His people free." (Deuteronomy 7:6) And Rabbi Ilai bar Yehudah said: In the case of Solomon, it is clear that those who are scholars of the Torah, who are dressed in the same clothing as the priests, who are covered in the same tunic, and who are teaching the Torah, are exempt from paying taxes, as it is said: "The Lord has heard your prayer, and has seen your affliction, and has relented towards you, and has given you peace." (Psalm 28:6) Let not anyone say: "In the midst of the people," for this is not the meaning of "in the midst of the people," but rather "in the midst of the community," for it is written: "You shall not be a part of the community of the wicked." (Proverbs 28:27)

Rabbah bar Avuha said: Two students of sages who are walking in the way of the Torah and speaking the words of the Torah — it is like a master who is teaching in a house and speaking in a house. Rather, let us take the example of Rabbi Ishmael, who said: "Whoever walks in the way of the living God, and speaks the words of the Torah, and is found dead in the fire — the measure of the one who is found dead in the fire is the measure of the one who walks in the way of the living God." Rather, let us take the example of the one who is found dead in the fire — rather, let us take the example of the one who is found dead in the fire — rather, let us take the example of the one who is found dead in the fire — rather, let us take the example of the one who is found dead in the fire — rather, let us take the example of the one who is found dead in the fire — rather, let us take the example of the one who is found dead in the fire — rather, let us take the example of the one who is found dead in the fire — rather, let us take the example of the one who is found dead in the כָּאָר. Rabbah bar Avuha said: Two students of sages, one following the law and the other following the tradition, were brought before the court. One said: "I have seen a man who was beaten by his master because of his opinion, and I have not seen a man who was beaten because of his tradition." The other said: "I have seen a man who was beaten because of his opinion, and I have not seen a man who was beaten because of his tradition."

Rabbi Judah b. Beracha said: Any scholar who is diligent in his study of Torah from the depth of his heart — his downfall is his lack of faith, as it is said: "For the people in Zion will dwell in Jerusalem in peace, but the wicked will be cast out, and the righteous will be exalted, as it is written: 'Let the wicked be cast out, as the Lord has commanded, and let the righteous be exalted, as the Lord has commanded.'" And it is written in his the wicked's writings: "Let the wicked be cast out, as the Lord has commanded, and let the righteous be exalted, as the Lord has commanded."

Rabbi Avahu of Omra says: The 16th of Marheshvaynu, which is the 15th of Shevat, is the day on which one should not be seen by the public, as it is said: "And your eyes shall see the ways of your master." Rabbi Ahabah bar Chanina says: Even if the paragod is not seen by his master, he is still not permitted, as it is said: "And he shall not be able to add to your law."

Rav Shimon ben Gamliel says: Rabbah: Every day and every day he is found guilty of his own guilt, from the day he entered the study hall, where there is no one to correct him. Said Rav: In every day and every day he is found guilty of his own guilt, from the day he entered the study hall, where there is no one to correct him. As it is said: "The scribe says: 'Who has made the scribe?' The scribe says: 'Who has made the scribe?' - what is the scribe? Is it not the one who has made the scribe? - I will wait for the scribe, until the scribe is made? - what is the scribe? - I will wait for the scribe, until the scribe is made? - what is the scribe? - I will wait for the scribe, until the scribe is made? - what is the scribe? - I will wait for the scribe, until the scribe is made? - what is the scribe? - I will wait for the scribe, until the scribe is made? - what is the scribe? - I will wait for the scribe, until the scribe is made? - what is the scribe? - I will wait for the scribe, until the scribe is made? - what is the scribe? - I will wait for the scribe, until the scribe is made? - what is the scribe? - I will wait for the scribe, until the scribe is made? - what is the scribe? - I will wait for the scribe, until the scribe is made? - what is the scribe? - I will wait for the scribe, until the scribe is made? - what is the scribe? - I will wait for the scribe, until the scribe is made? - what is the scribe? - I will wait for the scribe, until the scribe is made? - what is the scribe? - I will wait for the scribe, until the scribe is made? - what is the scribe? - I will wait for the scribe, until the scribe is made? - what is the scribe? - I will wait for the scribe, until the scribe is made? - what is the scribe? - I will wait for the scribe, until the s

R. Eleazar said: Is it permitted to take the blood of a slaughtered animal? R. Akiva said: It is not permitted, for the blood is not to be taken, as it is written: "The land of the Philistines is like the dung of the field, and the land of the Canaanites is like the dung of the dung-pit, and the land of the Hittites is like the dung of the dung-pit." The one who takes the blood is like the one who takes the dung — he is a transgressor.

And lo, the scribe is not worthy of the study of Torah, and the one who is not worthy of the study of Torah, is not worthy of the study of Torah. R. Shim'ona ben El'azar says: Purity — in the act of fasting and the act of prayer, impurity — in the act of sleeping with a woman, impurity — in the act of eating.

Rav Huna son of Asher son of Tomrat, said in his words: "My son, do not be like him, who is like his father." My son, be perfect in your ways. If you are in his ways, you will be like him. My son, do not be like him, who has corrupted his heart. You will be corrupted in your ways. My son, if you do not follow in his ways, you will be like him, who has corrupted his heart. My son, do not be like him, who has corrupted his heart, for he is a wicked one. Our sages say: The merciful father — the son, the merciful father — the son of the merciful father.

In the words of R. Titus, the sages decreed that one should not teach Adam's son Yonah about the laws of the Torah, lest he be led astray.
in the future, they will not be able to do so, for they will be able to see the evil in the heart of the city, and our masters will be able to see the evil in the heart of the city.

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: אִלְמָלֵא תְּפִלָּתוֹ שֶׁל דָּוִד, הָיוּ כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל מוֹכְרֵי רְבָב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שִׁיתָה ה׳ מוֹרָה לָהֶם״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: אִלְמָלֵא תְּפִלָּתוֹ שֶׁל חֲבַקּוּק, הָיוּ שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מִתְכַּסִּים בְּטַלִּית אַחַת וְעוֹסְקִין בַּתּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״ה׳ שָׁמַעְתִּי שִׁמְעֲךָ יָרֵאתִי ה׳ פׇּעׇלְךָ בְּקֶרֶב שָׁנִים חַיֵּיהוּ״. אַל תִּקְרָא ״בְּקֶרֶב שָׁנִים״, אֶלָּא ״בְּקֵרוּב שְׁנַיִם״.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Ile’a bar Yeverekhya says: If it were not for the prayer of David all Israel would be sellers of fat [ revav ], as it is stated: “Place for them mastery, O Lord” And Rabbi Ile’a bar Yeverekhya says: If it were not for the prayer of Habakkuk, two Torah scholars would have to cover themselves with a single cloak and engage in Torah study as it is stated: “Lord, I heard Your report and was afraid; O Lord, revive Your work in the midst of the years” Do not read: “In the midst [ bekerev ] of the years [ shanim ],” but in the closeness [ bikrov ] of two [ shenayim ].
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Ilai bar Yehudah said: In the case of David, it is clear that all Israelites are obligated to pay taxes, as it is said: "The Lord has set His people free." (Deuteronomy 7:6) And Rabbi Ilai bar Yehudah said: In the case of Solomon, it is clear that those who are scholars of the Torah, who are dressed in the same clothing as the priests, who are covered in the same tunic, and who are teaching the Torah, are exempt from paying taxes, as it is said: "The Lord has heard your prayer, and has seen your affliction, and has relented towards you, and has given you peace." (Psalm 28:6) Let not anyone say: "In the midst of the people," for this is not the meaning of "in the midst of the people," but rather "in the midst of the community," for it is written: "You shall not be a part of the community of the wicked." (Proverbs 28:27)

sentences.text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים הַמְהַלְּכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְאֵין בֵּינֵיהֶן דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה — רְאוּיִן לִישָּׂרֵף בָּאֵשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי הֵמָּה הֹלְכִים הָלוֹךְ וְדַבֵּר וְהִנֵּה רֶכֶב אֵשׁ וְגוֹ׳״, טַעְמָא דְּאִיכָּא דִּיבּוּר, הָא לֵיכָּא דִּיבּוּר — רְאוּיִן לִישָּׂרֵף.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Ile’a bar Yeverekhya says: two Torah scholars who are walking along the way and there are no words of Torah between them, they are deserving of being burned in fire. As it is stated “And it was as they walked along, talking, that behold, there appeared a chariot of fire The reason that there was speech but if there had been no speech, they deserving of being burned
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbah bar Avuha said: Two students of sages who are walking in the way of the Torah and speaking the words of the Torah — it is like a master who is teaching in a house and speaking in a house. Rather, let us take the example of Rabbi Ishmael, who said: "Whoever walks in the way of the living God, and speaks the words of the Torah, and is found dead in the fire — the measure of the one who is found dead in the fire is the measure of the one who walks in the way of the living God." Rather, let us take the example of the one who is found dead in the fire — rather, let us take the example of the one who is found dead in the fire — rather, let us take the example of the one who is found dead in the fire — rather, let us take the example of the one who is found dead in the fire — rather, let us take the example of the one who is found dead in the fire — rather, let us take the example of the one who is found dead in the fire — rather, let us take the example of the one who is found dead in the fire — rather, let us take the example of the one who is found dead in the כָּאָר. sentences.text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים הַדָּרִין בְּעִיר אַחַת וְאֵין נוֹחִין זֶה לָזֶה בַּהֲלָכָה — אֶחָד מֵת וְאֶחָד גּוֹלֶה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָנֻס שָׁמָּה רוֹצֵחַ אֲשֶׁר יִרְצַח אֶת רֵעֵהוּ בִּבְלִי דַעַת״, וְאֵין דַּעַת אֶלָּא תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נִדְמוּ עַמִּי מִבְּלִי הַדָּעַת״.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Ile’a bar Yeverekhya says: two Torah scholars who reside in the same city and they are not pleasant to each other with regard to halakha , one die and one exiled. As is stated: “That the manslayer might flee there, who slays his neighbor without knowledge” and “knowledge” nothing other Torah, as it is stated: “My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge”
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbah bar Avuha said: Two students of sages, one following the law and the other following the tradition, were brought before the court. One said: "I have seen a man who was beaten by his master because of his opinion, and I have not seen a man who was beaten because of his tradition." The other said: "I have seen a man who was beaten because of his opinion, and I have not seen a man who was beaten because of his tradition."

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא: כׇּל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הָעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה מִתּוֹךְ הַדְּחָק — תְּפִלָּתוֹ נִשְׁמַעַת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי עַם בְּצִיּוֹן יֵשֵׁב בִּירוּשָׁלִָם בָּכוֹ לֹא תִבְכֶּה חָנוֹן יׇחְנְךָ לְקוֹל זַעֲקֶךָ כְּשׇׁמְעָתוֹ עָנָךְ״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״וְנָתַן ה׳ לָכֶם לֶחֶם צָר וּמַיִם לָחַץ״.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, says: any Torah scholar who engages in Torah while experiencing the pressure his prayer is listened to, as it is stated: “For, O people that dwells in Zion at Jerusalem, you shall weep no more; He will surely be gracious to you at the voice of your cry. When He shall hear, He will answer you” and after it is written: “And the Lord shall give you sparse bread and scant water”
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Judah b. Beracha said: Any scholar who is diligent in his study of Torah from the depth of his heart — his downfall is his lack of faith, as it is said: "For the people in Zion will dwell in Jerusalem in peace, but the wicked will be cast out, and the righteous will be exalted, as it is written: 'Let the wicked be cast out, as the Lord has commanded, and let the righteous be exalted, as the Lord has commanded.'" And it is written in his the wicked's writings: "Let the wicked be cast out, as the Lord has commanded, and let the righteous be exalted, as the Lord has commanded."

sentences.text: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אוֹמֵר: מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתוֹ מִזִּיו שְׁכִינָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיוּ עֵינֶיךָ רֹאוֹת אֶת מוֹרֶיךָ״. רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: אַף אֵין הַפַּרְגּוֹד נִנְעָל בְּפָנָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא יִכָּנֵף עוֹד מוֹרֶיךָ״.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: is satiated with the glory of the Divine Presence, as it is stated “And your eyes shall behold your Teacher.” Rabbi Aḥa, son of Ḥanina, said: Even the partition pargod is not locked before him, as it is stated: “And your Teacher shall not hide Himself anymore”
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu of Omra says: The 16th of Marheshvaynu, which is the 15th of Shevat, is the day on which one should not be seen by the public, as it is said: "And your eyes shall see the ways of your master." Rabbi Ahabah bar Chanina says: Even if the paragod is not seen by his master, he is still not permitted, as it is said: "And he shall not be able to add to your law."

sentences.text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ אֵין וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רָבָא: בְּכׇל יוֹם וָיוֹם מְרוּבָּה קִלְלָתוֹ מִשֶּׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּבֹּקֶר תֹּאמַר מִי יִתֵּן עֶרֶב וּבָעֶרֶב תֹּאמַר מִי יִתֵּן בֹּקֶר״, הֵי בֹּקֶר? אִילֵימָא בֹּקֶר דְּלִמְחַר, מִי יָדַע מַאי הָוֵי? אֶלָּא דַּחֲלֵיף.

sentences.text: וְאֶלָּא, עָלְמָא אַמַּאי קָא מִקַּיַּים? אַקְּדוּשָּׁה דְסִידְרָא, וְאַ״יְּהֵא שְׁמֵיהּ רַבָּא״ דְּאַגַּדְתָּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶרֶץ עֵיפָתָה כְּמוֹ אֹפֶל צַלְמָוֶת וְלֹא סְדָרִים״, הָא יֵשׁ סְדָרִים — תּוֹפִיעַ מֵאוֹפֶל.
sentences.human_translation: But why does the world exist? By the sanctification that order and Let His great name of aggada . As it is stated: “A land of thick darkness, as darkness itself; a land of the shadow of death, without any order” Therefore, there are orders shall appear from the darkness.
sentences.llm_translation: R. Eleazar said: Is it permitted to take the blood of a slaughtered animal? R. Akiva said: It is not permitted, for the blood is not to be taken, as it is written: "The land of the Philistines is like the dung of the field, and the land of the Canaanites is like the dung of the dung-pit, and the land of the Hittites is like the dung of the dung-pit." The one who takes the blood is like the one who takes the dung — he is a transgressor.

sentences.text: וְלֹא יָרַד טַל לִבְרָכָה וְנִיטַּל טַעַם פֵּירוֹת וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: טׇהֳרָה — בִּטְּלָה טַעַם וָרֵיחַ, מַעֲשֵׂר — בִּיטֵּל שׁוֹמֶן דָּגָן.
sentences.human_translation: dew has not descended for a blessing, and the taste has been removed from fruit. It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: purity has removed the taste and the aroma; tithes have removed the fat of grain.
sentences.llm_translation: And lo, the scribe is not worthy of the study of Torah, and the one who is not worthy of the study of Torah, is not worthy of the study of Torah. R. Shim'ona ben El'azar says: Purity — in the act of fasting and the act of prayer, impurity — in the act of sleeping with a woman, impurity — in the act of eating.

sentences.text: רַב הוּנָא אַשְׁכַּח תּוֹמַרְתָּא דְּחִינוּנִיתָא, שַׁקְלַהּ, כַּרְכַהּ בְּסוּדָרֵיהּ. אֲתָא רַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מוֹרְחִינָא רֵיחָא דְּחִינוּנִיתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנִי, טׇהֳרָה יֵשׁ בְּךָ. יַהֲבַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ. אַדְּהָכִי אֲתָא אַבָּא בְּרֵיהּ, שַׁקְלַהּ, יַהֲבַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנִי, שִׂמַּחְתָּ אֶת לִבִּי, וְהִקְהֵיתָה אֶת שִׁינַּי. הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רַחֲמֵי דְּאַבָּא — אַבְּנֵי, רַחֲמֵי דִּבְנֵי — אַבְּנֵי דְּהָווּ לֵיהּ.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Huna found a fragrant date. He took it and wrapped it in his shawl. Rabba, his son, came said to him: I smell the aroma of a fragrant said to him: My son, there is purity in you, He gave it to him. Meanwhile, Abba, son, arrived. took gave it to said to My son, you have made my heart rejoice and you have blunted my teeth, This that people say: The love of a father is for the sons; the love of the sons is for their own sons,
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Asher son of Tomrat, said in his words: "My son, do not be like him, who is like his father." My son, be perfect in your ways. If you are in his ways, you will be like him. My son, do not be like him, who has corrupted his heart. You will be corrupted in your ways. My son, if you do not follow in his ways, you will be like him, who has corrupted his heart. My son, do not be like him, who has corrupted his heart, for he is a wicked one. Our sages say: The merciful father — the son, the merciful father — the son of the merciful father.

sentences.text: רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אִיטַּפַּל בֵּיהּ בְּרַב יַעֲקֹב בַּר בְּרַתֵּיה. כִּי גְדַל אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַשְׁקְיַין מַיָּא. אָמַר לוֹ: לָאו בְּרָיךְ אֲנָא. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רַבִּי רַבִּי, בַּר בְּרַתָּךְ אֲנָא.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov took care of Rav Ya’akov, the son of his daughter, When grew up, said to him: Give me water to drink. He said to him: I am not your son, And this that people say: Raise, raise I am the son of your daughter,

sentences.text: מַתְנִי׳ בְּפוּלְמוּס שֶׁל אַסְפַּסְיָינוּס גָּזְרוּ עַל עַטְרוֹת חֲתָנִים וְעַל הָאִירוּס.
sentences.human_translation: In the war [ pulemus ] of Vespasian decreed upon the crowns of bridegrooms, and upon the drums,
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Perahia said: In the land of the Ishmaelites, they have forbidden the wearing of certain garments of the Chathanim. sentences.text: בְּפוּלְמוּס שֶׁל טִיטוּס גָּזְרוּ עַל עַטְרוֹת כַּלּוֹת, וְשֶׁלֹּא יְלַמֵּד אָדָם אֶת בְּנוֹ יְווֹנִית.
sentences.human_translation: In the war of Titus they decreed upon the crowns of brides, and that a person should not teach his son Greek.
sentences.llm_translation: In the words of R. Titus, the sages decreed that one should not teach Adam's son Yonah about the laws of the Torah, lest he be led astray.

sentences.text: בְּפוּלְמוּס הָאַחֲרוֹן גָּזְרוּ שֶׁלֹּא תֵּצֵא הַכַּלָּה בְּאַפִּרְיוֹן בְּתוֹךְ הָעִיר, וְרַבּוֹתֵינוּ הִתִּירוּ שֶׁתֵּצֵא הַכַּלָּה בְּאַפִּרְיוֹן בְּתוֹךְ הָעִיר.
sentences.human_translation: In the last war, they decreed that a bride may not go out in a palanquin inside the city, but our Sages permitted a bride to go out in a palanquin inside the city,
sentences.llm_translation: in the future, they will not be able to do so, for they will be able to see the evil in the heart of the city, and our masters will be able to see the evil in the heart of the city.

sentences.text: מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי מֵאִיר בָּטְלוּ מוֹשְׁלֵי מְשָׁלִים. מִשֶּׁמֵּת בֶּן עַזַּאי בָּטְלוּ הַשַּׁקְדָנִים. מִשֶּׁמֵּת בֶּן זוֹמָא בָּטְלוּ הַדַּרְשָׁנִים. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בָּטַל כְּבוֹד הַתּוֹרָה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא בָּטְלוּ אַנְשֵׁי מַעֲשֶׂה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי יוֹסֵי קְטֹנְתָּא פָּסְקוּ חֲסִידִים. וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ ״קְטֹנְתָּא״ — שֶׁהָיָה קְטֹנְתָּא שֶׁל חֲסִידִים.
sentences.human_translation: From when Rabbi Meir died, those who relate parables ceased; from when ben Azzai died, the diligent ceased; from when ben Zoma died, the exegetists ceased; from when Rabbi Akiva died, the honor of the Torah ceased; from when Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa died, the men of action ceased; from when Rabbi Yosei the Small died, the pious were no more. And why was he called the Small? Because he was the smallest of the pious,
sentences.llm_translation: Mishnah of Rabbi Meir from the Batlim of Mosheh from the Mishnah of Shalim. Mishnah of Ben Azai from the Batlim of the Sadducees. Mishnah of Ben Zoma from the Batlim of the Darashanin. Mishnah of Rabbi Akiva from the Batlim of the Torah. Mishnah of Rabbi Chanina ben Dosa from the Batlim of the Ma'aseh. Mishnah of Rabbi Yoseh Qatnata from the Batlim of the Chasidim. And what is the reason for the name "Qatnata" — that Qatnata was of the Chasidim.

sentences.text: מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי בָּטַל זִיו הַחׇכְמָה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַזָּקֵן בָּטַל כְּבוֹד הַתּוֹרָה, וּמֵתָה טׇהֳרָה וּפְרִישׁוּת. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן פִּאָבִי בָּטְלָה זִיו הַכְּהוּנָּה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי בָּטְלָ[ה] עֲנָוָה וְיִרְאַת חֵטְא.
sentences.human_translation: From when Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai died, the glory of wisdom ceased; from when Rabban Gamliel the Elder died, the honor of the Torah ceased, and purity and asceticism died. From when Rabbi Yishmael ben Pavi died, the glory of the priesthood ceased; from when Rabbi died, humility and fear of sin ceased.
sentences.llm_translation: Mishnah of Rav Yochanan son of Zakai the poor, the scribe. Mishnah of Rav Gamliel the elder, the scribe, of the study, and of death, and of separation. Mishnah of Rav Yishma'el son of Pappa the poor, the scribe, of the study, and of the study of the Torah, and of death, and of separation. sentences.text: [ גְּמָ׳ ] תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: רַבִּי פִּנְחָס בֶּן יָאִיר אוֹמֵר: מִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ בּוֹשׁוּ חֲבֵרִים וּבְנֵי חוֹרִין, וְחָפוּ רֹאשָׁם, וְנִדַּלְדְּלוּ אַנְשֵׁי מַעֲשֶׂה, וְגָבְרוּ בַּעֲלֵי זְרוֹעַ וּבַעֲלֵי לָשׁוֹן, וְאֵין דּוֹרֵשׁ וְאֵין מְבַקֵּשׁ וְאֵין שׁוֹאֵל,
sentences.human_translation: The Sages taught: Rabbi Pineḥas ben Ya’ir says: From when the Temple was destroyed, the ḥaverim and free men were ashamed, and their heads were covered and men of action dwindled, and violent and smooth-talking men gained the upper hand, and none seek, and none ask, and none inquire

sentences.text: עַל מִי לָנוּ לְהִשָּׁעֵן עַל אָבִינוּ שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם.
sentences.human_translation: Upon whom for us to rely? upon our Father in Heaven.
sentences.llm_translation: What is the purpose of our study of the Torah in the heavens?

sentences.text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ שָׁרוֹ חַכִּימַיָּא לְמֶהֱוֵי כְּסָפְרַיָּא, וְסָפְרַיָּא כְּחַזָּנַיָּא, וְחַזָּנַיָּא כְּעַמָּא דְאַרְעָא, וְעַמָּא דְאַרְעָא
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: From the day the Temple was destroyed, Scholars have begun to become like scribes and scribes have become like beadles, and beadles have become like ignoramuses, and ignoramuses
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer HaGadol says: From the day he desecrated the House of Study with his wine, and his wine was for the study of his books, his books were for the study of his wine, and his wine was for the study of his books, and his books were for the study of his wine, and his wine was for the study of his books, and his books were for the study of his wine, and his wine was for the study of his books, and his books were for the study of his wine, and his wine was for the studyּ Talmudic text: רַבִּי יְהוָדָן: דְּרָבְנָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּרָבְנָא, רַבִּי יְהוָדָן, דְּרָבְנָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּרָבְנָא, רַבִּי יְהוָדָן, דְּרָבְנָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּרָבְנָא, רַבִּי יְהוָדָן, דְּרָבְנָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּרָבְנָא, רַבִּי יְהוָדָן, דְּרָבְנָא, רַבִּ
